prompt: I need some good hobby suggestions that are inexpensive and easy to try. I'm open to both indoor and outdoor hobbies, but I do want a mix of both - I live in a cold place and will need a hobby during the winter, too!

messages.content: I need some good hobby suggestions that are inexpensive and easy to try. I'm open to both indoor and outdoor hobbies, but I do want a mix of both - I live in a cold place and will need a hobby during the winter, too!

No problem, here are a few great hobby ideas for you to try that are both affordable and easy to start. 

1. Blogging - While there are a lot of people who blog professionally as their main source of income, there are also some who blog just for fun. You can start a blog on any topic you are interested in. You can make it humorous, or write about a serious topic you are passionate about. You are not pressured to follow a particular schedule or format and you may end up connecting with others who share you same interests through your blog. 

2. Reading - Grabbing a book and reading for hours may already be a favorite pastime for many people, but if you haven't picked up a book in a while and you are looking for a good way to pass the time, reading is an excellent option. Studies show that just a few minutes of reading something you enjoy can lower your stress levels by as much as 60 percent. 

3. Learning a new language - There are a few hobbies out there that can be as useful in today's world as learning a new language. And if you are good enough at it, you could even find ways to use your new skill in your professional life as well. Or you could simply enjoy being able to communicate with locals on your next vacation. 

4. Journaling - While keeping a diary or journal may seem like something you would only do in your younger years, journaling has been known to be extremely therapeutic and helpful. Trends such as hand lettering or bullet journaling have made keeping a journal these days a fun and functional work of art and there are many tutorials out there that can show you ways to journal more effectively. 

5. Staying Informed on Current Events - Yes, staying up to date on current news and world happenings can be a hobby. If you would like to stay in the know but do not want to get bogged down by negativity, you can choose to have free daily briefs sent to your email or smartphone device. These quick and shortened blurbs of information will provide you with your daily news stories without all the unnecessary drama. 

6. Gardening - Few hobbies are as rewarding as gardening. You get to spend time outdoors in the fresh air, care for and nurture your plants and watch them grow into thriving flowers or fruits and vegetables for you to enjoy. All it takes to get started are a few seeds soil, fertilizers, and a few basic gardening tools. If you are new to gardening, growing a few herbs or flowers in a pot is a great way to start. 

7. Hiking - Hiking is another great hobby that costs nothing and will benefit you in more ways than one. If you love nature and being outdoors, you will love going out and exploring hiking trails at your local park or other fun destinations. Hiking can help you mentally by reducing stress while helping you physically at the same time. You can find simple, low-impact hiking trails for beginners or expert trails with inclines and rugged terrain if you are up to the challenge. 

8. Camping - Another excellent hobby for anyone who loves the great outdoors is camping. You don't have to go to extremes and spend a lot of money to enjoy camping. You can go with the basic supplies and have just as much, if not more, fun than those who go camping in large exquisite tents or RVs.

prompt: Generate a list of strategies and solutions to encourage and facilitate sustainable transportation options for residents in a major city

messages.content: Generate a list of strategies and solutions to encourage and facilitate sustainable transportation options for residents in a major city

Here are some ideas: 

Bike-Share Program: Implement a city-wide bike-sharing program that offers affordable and accessible bicycles for residents to use as an alternative mode of transportation.

Electric Vehicle (EV) Infrastructure: Develop an extensive network of electric vehicle charging stations throughout the city, making it convenient for residents to charge their electric cars. This will encourage the adoption of electric vehicles by addressing range anxiety.

Pedestrian-Friendly Infrastructure: Improve and expand pedestrian infrastructure such as wider sidewalks, crosswalks, and pedestrian bridges. This encourages walking as a viable mode of transportation and promotes physical activity. 

Public transportation Enhancement: Invest in improving and expanding public transportation options including busses, trams, and trains. This would include frequency of service and improved connectivity.

Education and Awareness Campaigns: Launch educational campaigns to raise awareness of the benefits of sustainable transportation and provide resources on how to make the switch.

Employer Initiatives: Collaborate with local businesses and organizations to implement workplace initiatives that encourage sustainable commuting, such as offering flexible work hours, telecommuting options, or providing incentives for employees who use public transportation or carpool. 

Each of these ideas contributes to a comprehensive and sustainable transportation initiative, aiming to reduce carbon emissions, improve air quality alleviate traffic congestion, and promote healthier, more efficient options for residents.

prompt: I have to write a paper for my Abnormal Psychology class for my bachelor's program. It's about conduct disorder in children, but I need a specific topic to write about. Can you give me three ideas for topics? Include a 1-3 sentence explanation of each topic and why it's important. Each one needs to have a research study to back it up.

messages.content: I have to write a paper for my Abnormal Psychology class for my bachelor's program. It's about conduct disorder in children, but I need a specific topic to write about. Can you give me three ideas for topics? Include a 1-3 sentence explanation of each topic and why it's important. Each one needs to have a research study to back it up.

Here are three ideas you can write about: 

1. The role of media in conduct disorder. Children who are exposed to violence in movies, tv shows, and video games are more likely to engage in these behaviors themselves. A 2010 analytic review of 136 studies, published in Psychological Bulletin, showed that exposure to violent media is associated with increased aggression, decreased empathy, and decreased prosocial behavior, all of which are risk factors for conduct disorder. 

2. The causes of conduct disorder. There has been much research on the role of both genetics and environment in conduct disorder. In a 2018 article published in Neuroscience and Biobehavioral Reviews, the authors review research on gene-environment interactions. They conclude that there are a number of genes that have been linked to conduct disorder, but the effects of these genes aren't always clear. They also note that various environmental factors have been linked to conduct disorder. 

3. The prognosis of children with conduct disorder. A 1999 article published in the Journal of the American Academy of Child and Adolescent Psychiatry examined the long-term outcome of children and adolescents with conduct disorder. The authors found that with early intervention and treatment, children with conduct disorder can grow up to be happy and productive.

prompt: Now I would like a few non-art and nonhistory museums in Portland, OR

messages.content: Now I would like a few non-art and nonhistory museums in Portland, OR

Of course! Here's a list of five Portland museums, not including art and history ones:

1. Oregon Museum of Science and Industry (OMSI): OMSI is one of the top science museums in the country, with hands-on exhibits and interactive displays that explore a range of scientific topics. Highlights include the planetarium, the submarine exhibit, and the Science Playground for younger visitors.
2. Lan Su Chinese Garden: This traditional Chinese garden was built by artisans from Portland's sister city, Suzhou, China. The garden's design incorporates elements of Chinese architecture, landscaping, and horticulture, and includes a tea house, a pavilion, and a lake.
3. The Freakybuttrue Peculiarium and Museum: This quirky museum features a collection of oddities and curiosities, including taxidermy animals, vintage medical equipment, and a giant chocolate waterfall. Visitors can also enjoy ice cream and other treats at the museum's cafe.
4. Portland Children's Museum: The Portland Children's Museum is designed for kids aged 0-10, with interactive exhibits and activities that encourage creativity, imagination, and learning. Highlights include the clay studio, the water play area, and the outdoor adventure playground.
5. The Hat Museum: The Hat Museum is a small museum dedicated to the history and culture of hats. The museum's collection includes hats from around the world, as well as exhibits on hat-making techniques and the social significance of hats.

prompt: I’m opening a pop-up restaurant and need some ideas for a dress code to recommend for employees. It doesn’t make financial sense to buy them all uniforms for a short term pop-up, but I do want a cohesive look for the staff so that customers know who to ask For help. The restaurant is neither formal nor super casual, and I need a uniform that works for the full gender spectrum.

messages.content: I’m opening a pop-up restaurant and need some ideas for a dress code to recommend for employees. It doesn’t make financial sense to buy them all uniforms for a short term pop-up, but I do want a cohesive look for the staff so that customers know who to ask For help. The restaurant is neither formal nor super casual, and I need a uniform that works for the full gender spectrum.

I can help with that! Here are some basic dress code ideas that could work to give your employees a cohesive look:

-Basic black: Wear black from head to toe.
-Black and white: Wear black pants or shorts with a white top.
-Canadian tuxedo: Though people sometimes mock this as a civilian fashion choice, pairing a denim top with blue jeans can be a stylish look.
-Primary colors: Pair blue jeans with red, yellow, or blue tee shirts.
-Head-to-toe color: Maybe your restaurant’s interior prominently features a color that isn’t black, white, or primary, like teal or orange. You can have your employees wear a top in this color or dress in it from head to toe.
-Business casual: Your employees could all wear polo shirts and khaki bottoms for a unified but diverse look. 
-Standardized pattern: Your employees could all wear plaid flannel tops, gingham prints, tie-dye, stripes, polka dots, paisley, or floral patterns. They could also wear more whimsical patterns if they’re on brand for your restaurant, such as Hawaiian shirts for tropical island cuisine or ugly holiday sweaters for an eatery serving comfort food in the last months of the year.
-Signature aprons: It may not be sensible to purchase full uniforms for your staff, but custom aprons could make a less expensive and more practical alternative. They would not need to be tailored to each employee’s individual size, so the staff members could share from a collective pool of clean aprons in much the same way they’d share resources like napkins and trays. You'd just need to pay to have the aprons laundered in bulk every few days. 
-Standardized accessory: You could allow employees to wear whatever they’re most comfortable in, but have everyone wear the same accessory to make them easy for patrons to pick out of a crowd. This accessory could be a colorful hat, scarf, or necktie, among other options, but for visibility to customers, it’s a good idea to choose something worn above waist level.
-Theme costume: If your restaurant’s menu lends itself to a specific theme—for example, a prohibition-era speakeasy, a Mexican cantina, or a 1950s-style diner—you could ask your staff to dress in relevant costumes of their own choosing. Bear in mind that this does place a burden of responsibility on staff that could be quite costly; on the other hand, your employees might really enjoy putting their own costumes together and view it as a perk of the job.

prompt: What are some pranayama exercises I can try if I am a beginner?

messages.content: What are some pranayama exercises I can try if I am a beginner?

Pranayama is a yoga practice that involves managing and controlling the breath and can aid in mental and physical health and well-being. There are a few different pranayama exercises that are recommended for beginners:

- Ujjayi pranayama involves exhaling with an open mouth, feeling the breath moving across your throat, and imagining you are fogging up a glass with your breath by gently constricting the throat. As you become more comfortable with this style of breathing, you can try closing your mouth and inhaling and exhaling through your nose.

- Sama Vritti Pranayama, or box breathing, involves inhaling for a count of 4, holding for 4, exhaling for 4, and again holding for 4. This cycle can be repeated for a few minutes. It should help you feel calm and relaxed. 

- Dirgha pranayama, commonly referred to as three-part breath, involves quickly stopping your inhalations and exhalations with short pauses. It involves inhaling until one-third of the lung's capacity is filled, then pausing for 2-3 seconds. Then inhale another third and pause for 2-3 seconds. Lastly, inhale until the lungs are completely filled. Then repeat this same pattern on the exhale.

prompt: I would like to try making homemade cat food. Could you give me some recipes and ideas?

messages.content: I would like to try making homemade cat food. Could you give me some recipes and ideas?

Making your own cat food can be a rewarding way to provide nutrition to your pet. Try these ideas:
- Chicken and Tuna Dinner: This recipe is a simple and easy way to make a healthy and nutritious meal for your cat. It is made with chicken, tuna, and a few simple ingredients.

Ingredients:
1. 1 pound of ground chicken
2. 1 can of tuna, drained
3. 1 cup of cooked brown rice
4. 1/2 cup of peas
5. 1/4 cup of carrots, chopped
6. 1/4 cup of spinach, chopped
7. 1 tablespoon of olive oil
8. 1 teaspoon of fish oil
9. 1/2 teaspoon of salt
10. 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper

Instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit.
2. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients.
3. Mix well.
4. Pour the mixture into a greased 9/13-inch baking dish.
5. Bake for 30 minutes, or until cooked through.
6. Let cool slightly before serving.

- Mackerel Recipe: This recipe is a simple and easy way to make a healthy and nutritious meal for your cat. It is made with mackerel, which is a good source of protein and omega-3 fatty acids. The brown rice adds fiber and the chicken and beef broth helps to keep the food moist.

Ingredients:
1. 1 cup of canned mackerel
2. 1 tablespoon oil from canned fish
3. 1 tablespoon organic, brown rice, cooked
4. 1 to 2 tablespoons of chicken or beef broth, or water.

Instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a food processor and pulse until blended.
2. Serve immediately and refrigerate leftovers for up to three days.

- Sardine Cat Food Recipe: Cats love the smell of sardines, but they like the flavor even more. This recipe is made with sardines, which are a good source of protein and omega-3 fatty acids. The cooked carrot adds sweetness and the oatmeal adds fiber.

Ingredients:
1. 1 can sardines in oil
2. 2 tablespoons of cooked carrot, mashed
3. 1/3 cup cooked oatmeal

Instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
2. Mash ingredients together and serve.
3. Store leftovers in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

messages.content: Can you brainstorm reasons why my cat might be licking me? I woke up from a nap to her licking my nose, and I'd like some explanations.

Aww, that sounds sweet! Here are some reasons why your furry friend might be licking you:

1. Bonding: Cats groom each other to bond, so your cat is likely showing you affection and befriending you as a part of her social group.
2. Sharing scent: Your kitty may be spreading her scent to you as a way of letting you know she trusts you and you're part of her friend group.
3. It feels good: Licking releases endorphins in a cat, whether she's licking herself or you.
4. She's anxious or stressed: Excessive licking could indicate she's not happy, so read her other body language at the time - a swishing or flicking tail, pinned-back ears, biting, or scratching.

prompt: Give me some benefits of credit cards

messages.content: Give me some benefits of credit cards

Here are ten benefits of using a credit card for payments.

1. Ability to pay on credit. 
Sometimes you don't have enough money to pay for something, but you really need it. A credit card lets you purchase a product as soon as you want and then pay off the balance over time. Certain situations can be highly beneficial, such as expensive emergencies or wanting to spread the costs of a large purchase over time. 

2. Most accepted payment method. 
Retailers almost universally accept credit cards. This means you can carry one card around instead of constantly withdrawing cash. Visa and Mastercard are the largest payment processors for credit cards, and you will find that they are accepted almost everywhere in the world. This is an excellent benefit if you travel a lot and don't want to keep track of currencies. 

3. Interest-free cash withdrawals.
Some credit cards allow users to withdraw large amounts of cash without paying interest for up to 45 days. This can be extremely useful in emergencies. 

4. Reward points. 
Credit cards often give users reward points for using their cards. This means you get extra value on your purchases simply by using a credit card. Certain credit cards offer specific rewards for specific spending categories giving users a bonus for spending money, for example, on travel. These rewards are often limitless, which gives customers an excellent opportunity to get maximum value from the card. 

5. Insurance. 
Credit cards offer significant security measures such as insurance. Having personal accident coverage and travel insurance just for having a credit card is a massive benefit that entices credit card users. As well as this, credit cards also offer a sense of security as users are often able to get refunds on transactions that they did not receive a product or in instances where the product was not as described. 

6. Make travel easy. 
Some credit cards give you great travel benefits. As well as not worrying about organizing local currency, some credit cards offer discounts on flights, dining out, and hotels. Credit cards sometimes offer reward bonuses for money spent on travel. Sometimes, your credit card can give you priority access to airport lounges and other areas.

7. Discount and cashback. 
Similar to rewards, credit cards offer users exceptional discounts for spending at preferred stores and sometimes offer money back as cashback. Money for free is a great benefit of using a credit card.

8. Improve your credit score. 
If you want to buy a house or secure a loan, you must have a strong credit history and rating. A credit card improves your credit score by showing you can be trusted to repay your borrowed money. Along with smaller bills like phone and tv subscriptions, this is the best way to build a credit history. 

9. Safety. 
Not having to carry cash around can make you feel a lot safer. A credit card allows you to carry just one card and have far more money than cash. 

10. Keep track of expenses. 
If you regularly use cash to pay for things, tracking your expenses can be difficult without much effort. Using a credit card will mean receiving monthly statements outlining every transaction. This makes it much easier to see where your money is spent and make informed decisions regarding your spending.

prompt: It is raining outside, and my kids are bored. Give me five ideas for what the kids and I can do on this dreary day.

messages.content: It is raining outside, and my kids are bored. Give me five ideas for what the kids and I can do on this dreary day.

Ok, here are some fun ideas to try for a rainy day:

- Board or card games. Just about every household has a small stack of board games, or a deck of cards around. These games can be a fun and mentally stimulating way to pass the time, and a good deal of these games can be played with many age groups. Sorry, Monopoly, and Chutes and Ladders are classics, while UNO and Yahtzee provide a little something different. Don’t forget about tabletop role-playing games for older family members!

- Arts and crafts. There are lots of things that can be made with regular household objects. Get some paper, school glue, and some scissors and make collages. Or get some pipe cleaners and make stick figures. Find some googly eyes and glue them to a clothespin. Use your imagination; you are bound to find some old items that can be repurposed for a fun piece of art.

- Build a blanket and pillow fort. This is great for the little ones - they seem to love places to play hide and seek and you can get creative with bed pillows, couch throw pillows, blankets, sheets, and whatever else you can find. You can make this into a fun way to watch a movie or binge some family TV shows.

- Have a talent show. Sing a song, make up a silly dance, or tell some dad jokes. Take turns and see who can come up with the craziest character or most original dance. Add some music and turn it into a fun karaoke party! 

- Make some tasty treats. Nothing beats rainy fun than eating some treats that you made for yourself. Cookies and brownies are easy staples that the kids can help with, while older folk may experiment with more decadent treats like chocolate mousse or a no-bake cheesecake. There’s a little something for everyone here, and you can be as healthy or indulgent as you like.

prompt: What are some healthy dinner ideas that are kid friendly?

messages.content: What are some healthy dinner ideas that are kid friendly?

Finding meals that kids like but are also healthy is always tricky. Here are some ideas:

1. Cauliflower crust pizza. Pizza is always a favorite, but incorporating cauliflower crust sneaks in more veggies and fewer carbs. Bonus points if you get veggies in as a topping.
2. Healthy tacos. Kids love building their own tacos at dinner. Make a filling using lean ground beef or turkey, and add black beans and veggies.
3. Turkey burgers. Everyone loves a burger, not just kids! Use turkey and fresh veggies like tomato or avocado to make it a little more rounded.
4. Air fryer chicken tenders. Taking the deep fryer away from this kid's favorite will make it a more sensible option.
5. Spaghetti with healthy meatballs. Noodles are a hit with most kids, and you can make them a little more balanced with plant-based or veggie meatballs.

prompt: What are 3 suggestions for board games that I can play with 4 people that are easy to teach and don’t take too long to play. Include the approximate game length in minutes. I don’t like classic Hasbro games.

messages.content: What are 3 suggestions for board games that I can play with 4 people that are easy to teach and don’t take too long to play. Include the approximate game length in minutes. I don’t like classic Hasbro games.

Sure! Here are some suggestions for some easy-to-teach games for 4 players.

• Can’t Stop – 30 minutes – This is a push-your-luck game centered around rolling dice. Players race to be the first lock in their dice rolls to move up columns numbered 2 through 12 on the game board. The first player to reach the top of 3 columns win. 

• Codenames – 15 minutes – Players organize into two teams; each team selects a team leader who gives clues to have their team guess the correct pattern of words from a 5 by 5 grid of word cards by using word association to link various words together. 

• Game of 49 – 45 minutes – This is a competitive auction game where players are bidding on spaces on the game board numbered 1 through 49 in a 7 by 7 grid. Numbers are drawn randomly from a deck of cards then players take turns bidding on it to take control of the space, the highest bid wins. The first player to control 4 spaces in a row wins.

prompt: Give me three reasons why I should keep creating art. I want to give up. A recession is about to hit, and people are losing work....give me three ideas to keep going.

messages.content: Give me three reasons why I should keep creating art. I want to give up. A recession is about to hit, and people are losing work....give me three ideas to keep going.

Of course! Remind yourself of these three facts every day:

1. Civilization couldn't exist without art. In fact, for 99% of human history, cave paintings and sculptures are all we have left. The ability to imagine and create is an incredible gift that only humans possess (as far as we know!)
2. You never know who your art will reach. Think about the Spotify artists you love who have less than a hundred listeners or your favorite TikTok videos with only a few thousand views. Changing ONE person's life is significant, but your art could change several lives, a dozen, a hundred, or thousands--and you might not even realize it.
3. If you give up now, you don't know what could happen. Who knows how many people in human history gave up right when they were about to succeed? Every second you spend creating art is a success story because it means you didn't give up.

A final word: picking up another job in the meantime doesn't make you a failure. You can create art and have a day job at the same time. One day, art might become your day job. Good luck!

prompt: What are some techniques i can use when negotiating. This will be concerning my pay.

messages.content: What are some techniques i can use when negotiating. This will be concerning my pay.

Here are five tips to use when negotiating your pay. 

1. Know your worth.
Before entering negotiations regarding your pay, you must know what you are worth. Knowing what you are worth to a company will give you a base for negotiations. It can be tough to see what you are worth to your company, but luckily, you can use sites like glassdoor.com and payscale.com to get a better idea of what people in similar roles and companies to you do earn. This knowledge will mean you can confidently suggest a number in line with the market rate. Offering a rate identical to others in your field will allow you to have confidence that the company will not be able to find someone better without at least paying an equal rate. Hiring new staff is often tedious and not cost-effective, so forcing your employer into this decision can work in your favor. 

2. Use good timing. 
Timing is everything in negotiations, which is never more true than in salary negotiations. Utilizing good timing can be the difference between a successful salary negotiation and an awkward conversation with your boss. Try to initiate salary negotiations while the company is doing well and you are being seen to impact that success substantially. A salesman who isn't hitting targets regularly would be ill-advised to open negotiations regarding salary. It may be that they can get a higher wage but unlikely to be sufficient if they don't have the data to back up their claimed performances. If you've just completed a profitable project and been a key player, it's probably a great time to strike while the iron is hot and ask for a pay rise. 

3. Be realistic.
It is necessary to know your worth and understand your value to a company, but remaining realistic is also pivotal. If you aim for the stars and ask for 50% more than you are worth, you can expect your employer to grow frustrated and unsympathetic to your request. The better tactic is to have a number in mind you would like, then add a small % to it so that you can work down to your ideal number. This will allow your employer some wiggle room to negotiate and feel they are not being played. It is essential to back your realistic request up with why you deserve it and what others are getting. 

4. Don't ask too often. 
As stated above, alienating and frustrating your employer is not a good idea. If you do this, you risk no negotiations and just a simple no. This will leave you in no better position than you were before. That is precisely why it is essential not to ask too frequently for a pay rise. Think of a similar situation in the car when a child asks the parents are we there yet over and over. The parents become frustrated and eventually will stop answering. The same will happen with your employer. They will revert to a standard no answer if you continuously ask for something. Instead, be sure to research what you are worth and strike while the iron is hot, as we described in point 2. 

5. Don't be afraid to ask. 
It seems silly to put this point straight after point 4. However, the fact is valid and should be discussed. While asking too often is not advised, not asking at all will probably get you nowhere. While this can't be said for all companies, most are reluctant to hand out pay raises regularly and will wait until they are asked or forced. That's why it is crucial that if you feel you deserve a pay rise and the circumstances dictate one, you stand up for yourself and ask. The worst thing they can say is no. If you don't think you deserve a pay raise, that's fine. Don't ask till you do. But if you have been stuck at the same rate for years and are integral to our company's operations, then speak up and ask for your worth.

prompt: I've been looking into bitcoin for a while, and I want to expand my range of knowledge about cryptocurrency. Can you go through a list of some other kinds of cryptocurrency that aren't bitcoin?

messages.content: I've been looking into bitcoin for a while, and I want to expand my range of knowledge about cryptocurrency. Can you go through a list of some other kinds of cryptocurrency that aren't bitcoin?

Absolutely! Here is the list of some cryptocurrencies that aren't bitcoin.

1. Litecoin (LTC) - Litecoin is a bitcoin alternative that's gotten quite popular. Litecoin has a Bitcoin-compatible API and a quick-running blockchain. You can mine Litecoin using the Scrypt algorithm which is memory and compute-intensive. It also can't be mined by Bitcoin's API chips.
2. Ethereum (ETH) - Russian-founded Ethereum is an application platform that puts storage resources across the internet, and it's similar to peer-to-peer streaming services. The resources on Ethereum are paid by Ether, which is the cryptocurrency the platform is named after. Ethereum allows for contracts built into its software DNA, and the currency pays out when conditions are met. You can mine Ether with Ethereum's resources, and it is possible for the cryptocurrency to go through inflation.
3. Ripple (XRP) - The Ripple cryptocurrency is controlled by Ripple Labs Inc, which is connected to the banking industry. Ripple has been taken on by large banking companies such as Bank of America and UPS, and it's used in securing transactions internationally. Ripple comes with low transaction fees and a high speed.
4. Zcash (Zec) - Bitcoin transactions are on public record, but Zcash is a private currency. It has a "zero-knowledge" security implementation, which makes it a safe option. It also works with a blockchain mechanism that doesn't link old and current transactions. Zcash can be mined with a gaming GPU.
5. Dash (DASH) - The name dash comes from the words digital and cash, and it used to be called Xcoin and then Darkcoin. This litecoin works with almost instant transaction speeds, and its money transfers are private. Dash isn't actually governed by humans, and its contract is actually encoded into its program.

prompt: Give me 7 tips for writing an awesome CV.

messages.content: Give me 7 tips for writing an awesome CV.

Of course. Below, I have written seven tips for writing a standout CV.

1. Start strong. 
Start your CV by listing your best achievements to date. Highlight your skills and experience, and just champion yourself. The goal of a CV is to convince a potential employer you are the right fit for them, so don't be shy and tell them exactly why your skills and experience will assist their company. If you don't get this bit right, it is unlikely recruiters will get much further into your CV. 

2. Emphasize past results rather than responsibilities. 
When detailing your work history, try to avoid discussing what you were responsible for and instead highlight your actual results. It is far more meaningful for someone to see results rather than try to infer what you have achieved through roles and responsibilities. It sounds better to say, "I ensured the completion of 5 major projects within my time at the company," rather than, "In my role, I was responsible for major projects."

3. Customise. 
One CV does not fit all jobs. Try to tailor your CV to the job you are applying for, and bring to the fore the experiences that suit the role and company you are applying to. Research the company to understand who they are, then tailor your CV to match its ethos and culture.

4. Highlight growth and change. 
Change is good, and growth is even better. If you have been promoted or changed roles at a previous company, mention that. Recruiters will take that as you are versatile and willing to learn. This will give them affirmation from the actions of your previous employer that you were both competent and proactive. 

5. Demonstrate your network. 
Showcase that if you have a large network and are well connected. Employers will see that as an opportunity to hire you and get the added bonus of your well-established network as a resource. If you are hired, they get two for the price of one. 

6. Show industry insight. 
It doesn't hurt to give a small opinion if you are applying to an industry that's currently topical or experiencing changes. Doing this shows you are current, in the know, and committed to your career in this industry. You don't have to give an opinion. You could forecast a change you foresee and mention how you see this impacting a role. 

7. Use powerful words. 
A CV is extremely important in grabbing a recruiter's attention. Using powerful words like implemented and adaptable will help you stand out from the crowd and keep your CV in the prospects' file. Consider the difference in the sentences "I am willing to change" and "I am very adaptable" one seems weak, and one seems far stronger. You can research topical power words online or use the thesaurus feature in Microsoft word to make your language stand out.

prompt: Give me a list of different types of horse riding competitions. I only ride English, and I do not need to know about Western. Be sure to mention Dressage and why it is important in the English riding culture. make sure it's a numbered list. Keep the text under 300 words.

messages.content: Give me a list of different types of horse riding competitions. I only ride English, and I do not need to know about Western. Be sure to mention Dressage and why it is important in the English riding culture. make sure it's a numbered list. Keep the text under 300 words.

That will not be a problem; here are the following types of competitions in the English type:

1. Show Jumping: Show jumping requires a lot of precision, agility, speed, and athleticism. With a clear goal, the rider takes the hours through multiple obstacles in a specific pattern. Faults are considered when a pole is dismantled, the rider goes off from the way, or if the rider takes too much time on the course than the required allocated time.

2. Eventing: This particular form of English riding consists of three different event types. The first is Dressage to show how well the horse has received discipline. The second is Jumping, to prove the performance of precision and speed. While the third is cross-country, which demonstrates the agility and endurance of the horse and rider.

3. Dressage: Dressage is a specific form of English riding that trains the horse to learn discipline. This discipline shows how well the horse responds to the rider's commands and how much control the rider has over the horse's movements. This is a highly communicative type of riding between the rider and horse to ensure a tight connection. 

4. Saddle Seat: Saddle Seat is meant to showcase a horse's various gaits, with focused high-stepping abilities. For this type of English, a close-contact saddle is needed for most disciplines with its lightweight and high-performance qualities. Additionally, the horse and rider in this competition are proven, similar to Dressage, in how well they communicate through body language.

prompt: Give me a list of things to consider when trying to identify my target audience. I own a tech company and am trying to get more brand awareness.

messages.content: Give me a list of things to consider when trying to identify my target audience. I own a tech company and am trying to get more brand awareness.

Here are eight things to consider when identifying your target audience. 

1. Analyze current customers.
If you are in a position where you have existing customers, then a good first step is to identify traits and characteristics among them. Think about the demographic they belong to and why they may be purchasing products or services from you already. You may already have data regarding your current customer's ages, locations, and vocations. These are all valuable metrics to track and interpret when defining your target audience. 

2. Market research.
Conducting market research is a valuable process. By conducting market research, you can identify areas in which you may be able to grow an audience or a blind spot where your services could be of real value. Looking into your competitors can provide great insights into what works and doesn't and where services like yours perform well. Knowing what others offer gives you an advantage when creating a unique selling point that sets you apart. 

3. Industry trends. 
Keeping your finger on the pulse and identifying what changes are occurring within your industry allows you to tailor content and services in a way that provides real value. This leads on from market research slightly and is another way of ensuring you stay informed concerning your customers' expectations and desires. This will allow you to provide them with a constant value.  

4. Distinguish benefits from features. 
Benefits and features are fundamentally different things. It is important to clarify this to your target audience. It is excellent that you have a feature or product that can help them in some way, but it's even better if you can explain the practical benefit of the feature. Take, for example, a product that improves productivity. Emphasizing productivity improvement and what that means is more important than highlighting the actual feature that does the work. People are more interested in what you will enable them to do rather than how you will do it. 

5. Spy on your competition. 
Just as important as your customers are your competitors. Keep an eye on what they are doing and the content they are producing. What could be working for them, and what could you do to improve what they have? This is an easy way to gain inspiration and see what's not being offered. This will allow you to fill in the gaps and potentially convert customers to you and your services. If your competition produces content about something you are not, this may mean they have researched and identified a weak spot. Now you can do your own research and improve on what they have done. 

6. Who isn't your target audience?
Knowing who your target audience is made much easier if you can identify exactly who it isn't. Who won't benefit from what you are offering or take an interest in what you are saying? By analyzing these questions, you can reduce your audience to specifics and tailor your services to those likely to benefit from and purchase them. Doing this will give you more time to concentrate on those that matter. 

7. Be objective. 
Making assumptions can lead to alienating some of your customer base. This can be avoided by posting content that leads by facts more than anything else. By being objective, you show your customers you can be trusted and only care about black and white. This should help to foster a sense of trust in you and your products. 

8. Go niche. 
It may seem like going to a niche would limit your customers, and while that may be true to an extent, you shouldn't underestimate how many people are in the world. And also how being a leading figure in a super niche topic can grow your audience quickly and lead you to be the go-to person in said niche. Also, it is worth remembering that while your niche may mean fewer customers or audiences, it also means less competition.

prompt: I am travelling to the city of Chiang Mai this week what are 5 things i can do to entertain myself there.

messages.content: I am travelling to the city of Chiang Mai this week what are 5 things i can do to entertain myself there.

Sure! Here are five things you can do in Chiang Mai. 

1. Visit the Night Market Bazaar. 
The Chiang Mai night market bazaar is full of stalls and vendors selling just about anything you can think of. From woks to headphones, you can find just about anything in this busy market. You can shop at the many stalls and get gifts for friends and family or try some delicious food on offer as you walk around. The market is located on Tha Phae Road in the Meuang district of Chiang Mai. 

2. Cooking Class. 
Chiang Mai has a litany of incredible food and some incredible restaurants. You can use your time in the city to take a cooking class and learn the skills required to take the taste of Chiang Mai wherever you go. There are many options in Chiang Mai for cooking classes, and most schools will offer hotel pickup and drop-off. Classes can be long. Don't be surprised if you learn up to 7 dishes. 

3. Elephant Nature Park. 
The elephant nature park or elephant sanctuary on the outskirts of Chiang Mai has drawn plenty of praise from visitors for drawing attention to the exploitation of elephants. This sanctuary allows guests to bathe with the elephants. Once you have done your bathing you get the chance to eat yourself before feeding the elephants to round off the day. The address for the elephant sanctuary is Elephant Nature Park Office, Tambon Kuet Chang, Amphoe Mae Taeng, Chang Wat Chiang Mai 50100.

4. Get a massage. 
Anywhere you walk in Chiang Mai or Thailand, for that matter, you will see massage parlors lining the streets. Take the opportunity to indulge in a relaxing hour as a trained professional to ease your aches and pains. For a truly unique experience in Chiang Mai, head to Lila Thai Massage on 37 Rachadamnoen Rd Soi 7. Here the masseuses are also inmates at the local prison, don't worry; these inmates are nearing the end of their sentence and have been professionally trained.

5. Temples. 
With over 300 temples in Chiang Mai, it's a matter of when, not if, you will come across a Wat. Some of these temples are walkable from the main areas. However, some will require a tour or scooter to get to them. When visiting the temples, remember to act respectfully and check the etiquette before visiting. 

Some of the best temples to visit in Chiang Mai are below:
Wat Phra That Doi Suthep
Wat Chedi Luang
Wat Chiang Man
Wat Suan Dok
Wat Chet Yot
Wat Rong Khun

prompt: I want to create a fun and educational scavenger hunt for my kids. Can you suggest some clues or challenges that are age-appropriate and engaging? They can be both indoors or outdoors.

messages.content: I want to create a fun and educational scavenger hunt for my kids. Can you suggest some clues or challenges that are age-appropriate and engaging? They can be both indoors or outdoors.

No problem, I can help you with that. Here are some fun and educational scavenger hunt challenges for kids:
1. Backyard insect scavenger hunt: Get the kids adventurous in your backyard by giving them magnifying glasses and asking them to try to find small insects out there. To make it educational, have them count the legs and wings of the insects to learn about them.
2. Alphabet bug scavenger hunt: Print out cards with drawn images of bugs, and write lowercase and uppercase letters on the cards. Have the kids identify lowercase letters.
3. Color scavenger hunt: Fill out a canvas with a variety of colors and then get the kids to identify them. Make it more difficult for older kids by having them identify more subtle hues. 
4. Secret code scavenger hunt: In this challenge, create clues for some problems to be solved and get the kids to look for them. Then, have them use the clues to come up with the solutions for the problems/hidden messages.
5. Art scavenger hunt: In this educational scavenger hunt challenge, you print out pictures of animals on paper, and the kid who identifies an animal gets to color them.

prompt: I'm having such a hard time concentrating at work these days. I'm not sure why. Can you help me by giving me some ideas of things I can do to help improve my concentration that don't involve going to a doctor?

messages.content: I'm having such a hard time concentrating at work these days. I'm not sure why. Can you help me by giving me some ideas of things I can do to help improve my concentration that don't involve going to a doctor?

Here is a list of things that you can try on your own that may help you have better concentration:

1. Eliminate distractions - block out time for an activity you need to get done. Consider going to a quiet place like a library if possible.

2. Close apps - close the social media and other apps on your phone and turn off notifications for them.

3. Reduce multitasking - whenever possible, try to commit to one task at a time. Although it may feel more productive to multitask, it can also lead to distraction.

4. Practice mindfulness - add a meditation practice to your day. Having a calmer mind and more breath control can help overcome distractions during the day.

5. Get more sleep - avoid using screens like phones and TVs or exercising close to bedtime. Having a refreshed mind will help with focus.

prompt: Can you give me suggestions for cardio that aren't based on running? I hate running. I also can't spend more than $50 on any sort of equipment and I don't own a bicycle.

messages.content: Can you give me suggestions for cardio that aren't based on running? I hate running. I also can't spend more than $50 on any sort of equipment and I don't own a bicycle.

1. Dancing. If you want to build up a sweat and have some fun, dance workouts may be for you. There's no need to attend a studio or even leave the comfort of your own home with countless free dance workouts available on platforms like YouTube. You can find workouts and routines of various lengths, skill levels, and music tastes. 
2. Walking. The power of a simple walk cannot be understated. Walking is the simplest low-intensity cardio, can be done almost anywhere, and boosts both physical and mental well-being. In colder climates, many indoor shopping centres permit and encourage early morning or late evening walking to keep active in bitter winters. 
3. Swimming. If you live near a lake, or ocean, or have a pool, swimming is a fantastic form of cardio that is gentle on the joints and refreshing. Lap swimming can be self-regulated to be intense or relaxing, while activities like water aerobics can be done solo or in group classes. Check out your local community swimming pools for classes.
4. Jumping rope. This high-intensity cardio workout burns a lot of calories for very little investment. Jump ropes are widely available online and require a relatively small amount of space to use. There are free tutorials available on YouTube to learn about or improve your rope jumping technique. 
5. Stair climbing. Climbing stairs is great cardio and an excellent lower-body workout. By using your stairs at home, a nearby park, or even your office parking garage, you can get a great workout in for no additional cost. 

The best way to ensure you stick to an exercise plan is to make sure that you enjoy the exercise you're doing. Luckily, there are many low-cost and accessible cardio options to choose from.

prompt: Can you give me some suggestions on how a fleet business can benefit from a transportation management system?

messages.content: Can you give me some suggestions on how a fleet business can benefit from a transportation management system?

Here are a few ways a fleet business owner can benefit from using a TMS or transportation management system. 

1. Excellent Optimization 
A transportation management system or TMS can help a trucking company or fleet optimize its business. It helps create ways for a company to get the most out of its fleets. From finding the best routes to get you to your destination faster, to advanced telemetrics that can assist with keeping your sensitive materials at the right temperature, this system enables better efficiency within your business to allow your company to operate more professionally and help you gain more profits. 

2. Fewer Billing and Paycheck Issues 
Slow-paying clients and incorrect paychecks due to human error can do severe damage to your turnover rate. When you use a TMS program, it can help guarantee your drivers are paid accurately and on time.  These programs also provide the option to create statements that are straightforward and easy to understand. 

3. Improved Driver Analytics 
Owners of large fleets can learn a large amount of information from the data they collect from different sources. But, if you are unable to collect that data and present it in a way where everyone on your team can understand it, that information is useless to you. An efficient TMS system will produce the data you need in a clear and concise manner. It takes care of all the difficult work associated with gathering these details so you can focus on other areas of your business.

prompt: What are some things to keep in mind before traveling internationally?

messages.content: What are some things to keep in mind before traveling internationally?

1. Have a decision on which place you have to visit. Traveling abroad comes with a lot of challenges, from non-English speaking countries to budget constraints. When you've decided to travel abroad, put into place these problems, and make sure you evaluate your decisions on where you stand about them, then decide on one perfect location to avoid inconvenience.
2. Check on vaccination status. There are countries where prior vaccinations against certain types of diseases are required or recommended. Visit your doctor and find out from them if you need to be vaccinated before boarding your flight to your destination.
3. Check on your passport expiration date. Many countries do not allow visitors with passports that are nearly expiring, usually the last six months till their expiration date. If yours is expiring soon, renew it before travel.
4. Having passport copies. Your passport may get lost or, worse, stolen along with your belongings. When you have copies of your passport, you will have a quick solution and not panic about what to do.
5. Register with your embassy. In case of war or any other emergency, your country's embassy will be the best place to get help. So, before traveling internationally, be sure to register with your embassy.

messages.content: Hi! I'm writing a story set in a world I made, but I'm not really sure where to start in terms of initiating events. What are some ideas that can get a reluctant hero out into the world for an adventure? Note that this is a low-fantasy story, and it takes a slightly (but not overly) dark tone. The main character is a farmer in a small village, because of course they are. Give me five ideas.

Okay, here are five ideas that can act as the call to adventure for your reluctant hero/heroine:

1. Kidnapped friends or family: A sibling, parent, or close friend of theirs is spirited away by the main opposing force in the novel, and the main protagonist is the only person who can (or wants to) rescue them.
2. They are being hunted: The main protagonist has qualities that match a prophecy that the main antagonist doesn't want to be fulfilled. Enemies arrive one day, driving the protagonist away from their home.
3. The village is destroyed: An enemy army or monster arrives and destroys the village. The main protagonist flees along with the rest of the village to survive.
4. A trip gone awry: The main protagonist has to deliver crops to a neighboring town and is waylaid on the way there by a force related to the main antagonist.
5. An important item is stolen: A special item of great value is stolen from the village, and the main protagonist joins (or is drafted into) the party sent to recover it.

Do those work for your story? Let me know if you need more ideas or if you want any of the above concepts fleshed out.

Here are some nail drill bits that can be used to remove the product from the nail: 

- Violet safety bit: The super rounded top and smooth small teeth make this great for removing gel polish and reining the cuticle area of gel extensions and acrylic nails. It is a good choice for beginner nail techs. 

- Flame bit: This tip gives more refined cuticle area gel polish removal due to the tapered form. The strength of this drill bit makes it efficient in removing thicker gel polish, hard gel, and acrylic nails. It has a rounded tip to prevent cutting the skin and doesn't wear out as fast as other carbide nail drill bits. 

- T-Rex bit: The teeth of this drill bit allow for efficiently removing thicker gel polish, hard gel, and acrylic nails. The teeth help it to not wear out as quickly as other carbide nail drill bits. The top is round to help prevent cutting the skin around the cuticles.

prompt: I want to go on holiday but can't decide where to go. I don't want a beach holiday and I don't like big cities. What do you suggest?

messages.content: I want to go on holiday but can't decide where to go. I don't want a beach holiday and I don't like big cities. What do you suggest?

The world is full of amazing travel destinations, so it's understandably challenging to choose the perfect place to go. Here is a list of the best places to visit if you don't want a beach vacation and don't like big cities:

1. Glacier National Park
Glacier National Park is one of the most striking parks in North America. Snow-capped peaks and crystal-blue lakes, over 700 miles of hiking trails, and plenty of camping areas make this a great option for an adventurous holiday. There is a lot to do all year. In the winter, you can go snowshoeing and skiing, and in the summer, you can swim in Lake McDonald or go whitewater rafting on the Flathead River. There are also beautiful scenic drives if you prefer to go the comfortable route.

2. The Swiss Alps
The Swiss Alps are world-famous for their snow-covered mountains and cute little towns. If you visit in the winter, you will get some world-class skiing in St. Moritz or Zermatt. If you go in the summer, you can hike through the Swiss National Park or attend some festivals in Montreux. Don't forget to visit the Jungfrau Region to see the most idyllic mountain villages like Grindelwald and Mürren.

3. Costa Rica
Costa Rica offers travelers everything from volcanic mountains and rainforests to waterfalls and a stunning shoreline. You can hike along Arenal Volcano, try to spot exotic wildlife like river turtles, otters, and howler monkeys in Tortuguero National Park, swim next to some of the country's waterfalls, or zip line through rainforests. Just make sure you visit between mid-December and April, when Costa Rica has its dry season.

4. South Island, New Zealand
New Zealand's South Island offers amazing landscapes, beautiful mountains, and impressive fjords. From hiking trails to boat trips, you have limitless possibilities. Visit the Mount John Observatory for some peaceful stargazing at night, or go for the adrenaline experience in Queenstown for some bungee jumping. Make sure to visit a few wineries and indulge in winetasting if you visit the Marlborough region and stop by the two most accessible glaciers, Franz Josef and Fox Glacier, on the west coast.

5. Tasmania
Tasmania is Australia's island in the south, about 150 miles from the mainland. It has an abundance of wildlife like Tasmanian devils, penguins, and kangaroos, impressive scenery, and 19 national parks to explore. Visit Hobart and Launceston for some acclaimed art and gastronomy experiences, or give their wine trails a try to taste some pinot noir and sparkling options.

prompt: My sisters and I want to start a comedy podcast but we don't know how we should do the episodes. There are so many podcasts that do advice and rants and stuff, and we don't want to do that. What are some segments we could have on the podcast?

Here are some ideas for segments that you and your sisters can bring up on your podcast:

1) Spoiler-free movie reviews. You can talk about films you've seen in the past week, and discuss and review them without bringing up any details of the plot.
2) Weekly goals. You can discuss personal goals you have for yourselves, and invite listeners to participate or follow your journeys.
3) No context news. You and your sisters can each bring a list of news headlines that you have not read the articles to and discuss what you think the articles say.
4) Weekly challenges. Similar to the "goals" idea, you can challenge each other to do different things each week and discuss your outcomes the following episode.
5) Childhood diaries. If you kept diaries as children, you could take turns reading cringy stories. Alternatively, you could find entries on places like Reddit and Twitter and read other folks' entries.

Remember to share it on your socials when you publish your first episode!

prompt: Make a list of organizations in the United States currently working toward a more healthy and sustainable food system.

messages.content: Make a list of organizations in the United States currently working toward a more healthy and sustainable food system.

Sure! Here is a list of twenty organizations and companies in the United States that are actively working on creating a sustainable food system.

1. Big Green: This organization focuses on getting people to grow food through educational resources, grants, and more. 

2. Bread for the World: This is a faith-based organization that raises awareness and advocates for solutions to hunger and food insecurity in the US.

3. Chef Ann Foundation: This foundation focuses on providing healthy, unprocessed, and delicious meals cooked from scratch in schools throughout the country. 

4. Cooking for Salud: Based in California, this organization works with English and Spanish-speaking families on behavior change and how to cook healthily at home.

5. Deep Medicine Circle: This group is led by women of color working to change the food system and heal from colonialism in the US. 
 
6. Ecdysis Foundation: The foundation is all about promoting regenerative agriculture to create better products and a more sustainable food and farming system. 

7. Farmers Market Coalition: The coalition works to promote farmers' markets nationwide, focusing on access and awareness. 

8. Fed by Blue: The organization promotes “blue foods” for sustainable food sources and healthy diets. 

9. FIG: Based in NYC, this organization works to create a better food system for everyone by educating community members through workshops and farm field trips. 

10. First Nations Development Institute: This is an institute dedicated to assisting Native Americans and creating a food system around cultural values and fairness.

11. Food Recovery Network: Created by college students, this is a network now on several college campuses in the US for reducing waste on campuses while reducing food insecurity in the area. 
 
12. Food Research and Action Center (FRAC): This center aims to influence policy to better reflect the needs of citizens who struggle to eat or access nutritious diets.

13. FoodPrint: FoodPrint advocates for and educates people on how to make environmentally sustainable choices when it comes to diet. 

14. FromSoil2Soil: This organization runs courses to educate people about gardening, cooking, herbs, and more to hopefully help reconnect society with the Earth. 

15. Global Seafood Alliance: The alliance is there to educate and advocate for more healthy and sustainable seafood consumption by consumers. 

16. Good Food Institute: The GFI is dedicated to finding creative ways to reduce meat consumption by consumers to reduce environmental impact. 
 
17. Harlem Grown: This nonprofit is educating youth in NYC about urban farming, nutrition, and sustainability. 

18. Harvard Law School Food Policy and Clinic (FLPC): The FLPC is all about using policy to change the global food system for the better. 

19. Healthy Living Coalition: This coalition is focused on addressing nutrition insecurity and promoting a healthy diet for all by raising awareness and influencing policy. 

20. James Beard Foundation: The foundation is geared at improving the restaurant industry and has a specific program aimed at chefs to aid in creating a more healthy and sustainable food system.

prompt: I've been having a really hard time sleeping lately and it's affecting my day. I don't have time for an intricate routine, and I don't want to see a doctor or take medications. Help me come up with some tactics for getting better sleep at night.

messages.content: I've been having a really hard time sleeping lately and it's affecting my day. I don't have time for an intricate routine, and I don't want to see a doctor or take medications. Help me come up with some tactics for getting better sleep at night.

It can be incredibly disruptive to go days without adequate sleep. Fortunately, there are many things that can be done that are simple and don't require a doctor's visit or medication. Here are a few things you may want to try:

1. Maintain a good sleep schedule - Try to go to bed and wake up at the same time every night and morning, even on weekends. If you can't fall asleep in 20 minutes from the time you go to bed, try getting up and doing something relaxing, then try again.

2. Watch what you eat and drink - Don't have heavy or large meals within a couple of hours of going to bed, and don't go to bed either hungry or stuffed with food. Also, nicotine, caffeine, and alcohol can all affect sleep, so keep an eye on those.

3. Make your environment restful - Try not to be exposed to light in the evening, especially right before bedtime. Keep the room where you sleep cool, dark, and quiet. Consider a fan for white noise, or earplugs. Doing calming activities right before bedtime, like taking a warm bath, can also help.

4. Be careful with daytime naps - If you do find you need to nap during the day, try to limit the naps to no longer than an hour, and try not to have naps late in the day. If you work at night, try taking a nap late in the day before work to make up for some sleep.

5. Add physical activity to your daily routine - Avoid being active too close to bedtime, but making sure you get regular physical activity can help promote good sleep. Also, spending time outside is helpful.

6. Deal with your worries - If you have things on your mind that you're worried about and can't resolve them before bedtime, try writing them down and setting them aside until the next day. Try some stress management techniques, such as meditation and organization.

Here's to good sleep!

prompt: Can you suggest me some workout supplements? Please don’t suggest any dairy-based products because I’m lactose intolerant. Also, I need supplements that I can take after my workout. Just name the main ingredients. I will find the brands myself. I want to optimize muscle growth and improve my workout performance.

messages.content: Can you suggest me some workout supplements? Please don’t suggest any dairy-based products because I’m lactose intolerant. Also, I need supplements that I can take after my workout. Just name the main ingredients. I will find the brands myself. I want to optimize muscle growth and improve my workout performance.

Sure! Here are some non-dairy post-workout supplement ingredients that you should consider adding to your regimen:

1. Leucine: It’s an essential amino acid that plays a key role in building and repairing muscle tissue after a workout. It also activates the body's protein synthesis pathway, allowing for optimal muscle growth. Leucine can be found in protein-rich foods such as meat, fish, and beans, but supplementing with it can help enhance muscle protein synthesis and promote muscle recovery.

2. Creatine: Creatine is widely considered the most effective muscle-building supplement. It’s a compound produced naturally in the body that helps produce ATP – the primary source of energy for muscle cells. In short, it can boost power and strength after your workouts, which would allow you to lift heavier weights and perform more reps afterward, ultimately leading to increased muscle mass.

3. Beta-alanine: It’s a non-essential amino acid, but it contributes to the production of carnosine, which acts as a buffer to prevent acid buildup in the muscles after your exercise. That, in turn, delays muscle fatigue and can improve future workout performance, particularly after high-intensity exercises such as weightlifting or sprinting.

4. Spirulina: Spirulina is a nutrient-dense blue-green alga that is rich in protein, vitamins, and minerals, making it a popular supplement among athletes and fitness enthusiasts. It has also been shown to reduce inflammation in the body and enhance endurance. It would make a valuable addition to your post-workout regimen.

Incorporating these supplements into your post-workout fitness routine can optimize muscle growth and recovery, improve workout performance, and enhance overall health and well-being.

They can be mixed into soups, salads, or sauteed and eaten as a side dish.

Although these vegetables have been known to be eaten raw, cooking them by whatever means necessary may be helpful for people who have trouble digesting raw vegetables. prompt: How can I stop myself from getting so mad? I've already tried breathing techniques and it doesn't really work for me.

messages.content: How can I stop myself from getting so mad? I've already tried breathing techniques and it doesn't really work for me.

I'm sorry you are experiencing difficulty with anger. It's great that you want to make a healthy change. Seeking help from a professional is one of the best ways to process and manage your anger, but if that isn't an option for you right now, here are a few other suggestions:
- Reframe your anger: Instead of having an outburst or turning your anger inwards, have a constructive conversation with someone about how you feel. You might not need to speak to the person that triggered your anger in order to process it; talking to someone else can also be helpful, so long as you are working towards a constructive outcome rather than ruminating on your frustration. 
- Recognize your triggers to find better solutions: If you know that you get really worked up waiting in long lines, try to beat the crowds and run errands early, avoiding peak business hours. Or, if you have a co-worker who usually gets on your nerves, develop some strategies to minimize contact with them throughout the work day. Look for patterns in your anger and take a pragmatic approach to securing peace of mind. 
- Distract yourself:  If something happens that triggers your anger, look for a change of scenery. Go for a walk, open a new tab in your browser, or put on a favorite song while tackling chores in a different room in your home. Sometimes taking your mind off of things can help you recover more quickly.

prompt: my dog has to take a pill every morning but she’s allergic to peanut butter and won’t eat the pill if it’s just mixed in with her dry food. What else can I use to give her medicine?

Here are some ways to pill your dog that don't involve peanut butter: 

* Wet Food - If you have canned wet dog food, you can hide a pill in a tablespoon of it and feed it to your dog. 
* Semi-soft Cheese - Dogs love cheese, and its texture is great for hiding pills. Just be careful not to use cheese with added herbs or other ingredients, especially garlic, onion, or raisin, as these are toxic to dogs. Cheese is also quite fatty so take care to use it in moderation for the sake of your dog’s long-term health.
* Pumpkin Purée - Pumpkin puree is sweet and soft, a perfect alternative to peanut butter for pilling dogs. It’s also great for your dog’s health, packed with fiber and nutrients. Be careful to get plain pumpkin puree rather than pumpkin pie filling, though. 
* Hot Dog Chunks - Hot or cold slices of hot dog are a great place to hide pills. Your dog is sure to gobble these up without hesitation. 
* Scrambled Egg - It wouldn’t be terribly convenient to have to whip up a pan of scrambled eggs each time your dog needs to take a pill, but you could keep a batch of pre-made egg patties in your fridge or freezer for these occasions. Just pour the scrambled egg mixture into a lined cupcake pan, using a small amount for each patty, and bake in the oven. Again, be sure not to add any spices or ingredients that may be unsafe for your dog. 
* Greenies Pill Pockets - These are hollow dog treats made especially for pilling dogs.

prompt: I am having trouble sleeping. What are five things I can try? Please explain why each solution helps.

messages.content: I am having trouble sleeping. What are five things I can try? Please explain why each solution helps.

In order to get better sleep, one thing to do is set a regular bedtime. Going to bed and getting up at the same time every day trains our brains to get tired at the same time. 

Another tip is to limit caffeine intake. Caffeine is a stimulant and even one cup of coffee six hours before bed can disrupt your sleep. 

You should also stay off all screens an hour before bedtime. Numerous studies have shown that the blue light electronic screens emit reduces how much sleep you get. 

Do a "brain dump" before bed. Write down all the things that are on your mind before bed. Getting it all down on paper signals your brain that it doesn't need to think about those things, and the decreased stress and anxiety from racing thoughts help you get to sleep faster. 

The last suggestion is to make sure that your bedroom is ready for you to sleep. It should be dark and quiet with minimal distractions. This helps to quiet your mind so you can fall asleep faster.

prompt: I want to go to Japan in a few months but I’m unsure about a lot of it. Can you give me some tips on what I should know before visiting? What should I know to do and not do? I want to make sure I know proper etiquette for being in the country.

messages.content: I want to go to Japan in a few months but I’m unsure about a lot of it. Can you give me some tips on what I should know before visiting? What should I know to do and not do? I want to make sure I know proper etiquette for being in the country.

There can be big cultural differences between Japan and other parts of the world. Here are a few things to note to be respectful when in the country:

- Eat before you need to go somewhere: Walking and eating or drinking in public is frowned upon. Most people carry takeout in bags to have later or finish their drinks while at the vending machine. Eating on public transport is also prohibited.

- Eat all of your food: It's considered disrespectful to leave food unfinished and pick different parts out of your meal, both to your host and the farmers who farmed the vegetables and animals that gave their lives for your meal. 

- Learn proper chopstick etiquette: Lay your Chopsticks either flat in your bowl or on a chopstick rest. Never leave them sticking straight up in your rice bowl or pass food from chopsticks to chopsticks since these are associated with funeral rituals.

- Let your host fill your glass: It is seen as thinking your hosts are ungracious to fill your glass on your own when drinking alcohol. Hold your glass a little bit off your table and wait for your host to fill it.

- Give up your seat on public transit: If you see someone who may need your train seat more such as a pregnant woman, someone with small children, or elderly or disabled people be sure to give them your seat. Be aware some pregnant women are slim and carry pink tags to signify their right to reserved seats.

- Take your shoes off: When entering someone’s home take your shoes off, this is standard etiquette. It is seen as disrespectful to wear shoes inside. Some temples and restaurants may also require you to take off your shoes before going in.

prompt: I have so many plastic grocery bags at my house and I would like to do something besides just throw them away. Give me some ideas for ways to reuse them at least one more time, even if they are then thrown away eventually.

messages.content: I have so many plastic grocery bags at my house and I would like to do something besides just throw them away. Give me some ideas for ways to reuse them at least one more time, even if they are then thrown away eventually.

Those plastic grocery bags certainly can multiply quickly. There are many uses for them. Here is a list of ways to reuse your bags at least one more time before throwing them away:

1. Line your small trash cans. Smaller trash cans such as the ones in the bathroom can be lined with plastic grocery bags, which helps to keep the can clean and odor-free.

2. Use them as emergency trash bags for the car. Keep a handful of bags rolled up in the glove box so they're handy when you're out and need one.

3. Use them as wet bags. Take a few plastic grocery bags with you the next time you visit the pool or beach. They can be great for keeping wet clothes and towels separate.

4. Pack your shoes in them in suitcases. Instead of putting your shoes loosely in your suitcase, put them in a plastic grocery bag to keep the soles from dirtying your clean clothes.

5. Pick up dog poop. Keep a handful handy for dog walks, and use plastic grocery bags instead of buying poop bags.

6. Stuff some into your shoes and purses to help them to retain their shape. Ball up plastic grocery bags and stuff all the shoes and purses in your closet.

7. Use them for packing and moving. You can wrap a few bags around breakables before packing them into boxes to protect them from breakage. 

8. Store paint brushes or rollers in them. When you're going to come back to your painting project, just put your wet brush or roller into a bag until later. 

9. Line a paint tray. Using a plastic bag to line your paint tray will make cleanup super easy when you're done.

10. Line your cat's litter box. Having a plastic bag in the litter box makes cleaning out the box so much easier, eliminating the need to empty and wash it.
