A raised garden bed is a natural choice for a vegetable garden using containers. By using a trough planter, you have a raised or standing height that allows users to harvest and tends to their crops easily without needing to hunch over or kneel. As well as being a practical gardening solution, trough planters also offer a great visual benefit for adding height to your pot. 

2. Adding Potted Crops will Bring Productivity to any Patio 
Vegetable garden container ideas will give you the chance to increase your productivity on your patio. You can make use of your unused space and add a variety of crops such as tomatoes, beans, and pumpkins. And the great thing is you don't have to spend a lot of money on landscaping or dig up half your backyard for a fancy vegetable patch. Use your patio and seating space to add more symmetrical vibrance to your outdoor space. 

3. Grow Potatoes in a Bag 
Potatoes are one of the easiest and simplest vegetables to grow and they are best grown in containers. If they are grown in a border, potatoes will spread into all the available soil not just in a small section where they are planted. When potatoes are planted in the ground, it can be difficult to harvest all of the crops. Placing them in a bag or container, it makes it much easier to harvest everything so that nothing is wasted. 

4. Be Sure to Choose the Right Container 
Along with complementing your garden when using plant containers, you must get the right containers that are compatible with the plants you are growing. your containers should be 4 inches wider and deeper than the root ball of the plant. Shallow containers that are around 12 to 16 inches deep are great for shallow-rooted herbs and other annual vegetables. You can replenish the soil for each season when you replant them. If you are interested in growing larger plants such as aubergines or tomatoes, you would do your best by using one plant per container. 

5. Design Raised Garden Bed Containers to Suit Your Outdoor Space 
Raised garden beds can make great vegetable garden containers if you have a large enough space to work with. The benefit of this is that you can have these containers made to fit your landscaping, no matter how large or small they need to be. There are many great materials out there to use for raised beds. One expert suggests using Corten steel due to its durability and capacity to be bent or folded into an unusual shape. The deep rust shade of the material is also very attractive and will look great with other materials like buff-colored gravel.

prompt: I want to quit smoking cigarettes, but I don't know how to go about it. Give me five tips on how to quit and explain why you think each suggestion will be effective. Format your response in a numbered list.

messages.content: I want to quit smoking cigarettes, but I don't know how to go about it. Give me five tips on how to quit and explain why you think each suggestion will be effective. Format your response in a numbered list.

Here are five tips to help you quit smoking cigarettes along with an explanation for why each suggestion will be effective. The response is formatted in a numbered list:

1. Set a quit date within the next two weeks. Creating a concrete goal date will keep you accountable and help you mentally prepare to quit. Setting the date within the next two weeks will give you adequate time to prepare yourself without reducing your motivation to go through with it. 
2. Tell your family, friends, and co-workers that you plan to quit. Not only will this help keep you accountable and on track to quit, but you will need the support and encouragement of your friends and family in order to follow through.
3. Anticipate and plan for the challenges you'll face while quitting. Increase your chance of success by thinking of any likely challenges and creating a plan for how to manage them. By anticipating and planning for how you will deal with challenges such as nicotine withdrawal, you will be more likely to make it through those difficult moments without relapsing. 
4. Remove cigarettes from your home, car, and work. By completely removing cigarettes from your living and working areas, you will be less likely to think about cigarettes and consider smoking one once you've quit. 
5. Talk to your doctor about getting help to quit. There is no need to meet this challenge alone. Your doctor can help you come up with a plan to deal with withdrawal symptoms and may be able to recommend over-the-counter products such as nicotine patches, lozenges, and gum. Speaking to a medical professional will help you answer any questions you have and put you in a positive mindset for success. 

I hope that these suggestions help you as you create your plan to quit smoking cigarettes. Good luck!

prompt: I'm job searching and want to revise my resume. I need tips and suggestions on how to write a resume that will get noticed by hiring managers.

messages.content: I'm job searching and want to revise my resume. I need tips and suggestions on how to write a resume that will get noticed by hiring managers.

Here are some useful tips that will help you improve your resume so it will be noticed by hiring managers. 

1. Plan Ahead - When rewriting or updating your resume, you need to focus on the key sections, which are your experience, objections, special skills, and education. The more organized you are when preparing to write your resume, the more it will show in the outcome. Get started by writing an outline so that you will know what you are going to include and what you will leave out. 

2. Use Action Words and Bullet Points - Action verbs are incisive and can showcase to the reader what your skills are. Use words such as managed, planned, presented, supervised, coordinated, increased, or engaged to show off your accomplishments. And be sure to use plenty of bullet points to help make your content easy to scan and read. Doing so will also make it easier for you to make clear and concise statements. 

3. Always Be Specific - When writing about all you have accomplished, be sure to make your statements clear and specific. Something like "Grew department revenue by 30 percent each year" will have more power than a statement that simply says "increased department revenue for the company". Be sure to use specific numbers, percentages, or dollar amounts whenever possible. It will help you get your point across. 

4. Focus on the Positive - Always make sure you accentuate the positive thing and leave out anything negative when writing your resume. Share any special or unique accomplishments you have made, as well as any unique skills, awards, or winning work. And while it is a good idea to place your contact details at the top of the resume, you shouldn't add any personal details beyond that. 

5. Make Use of Key Words - Keywords are excellent tools to use when you want to get your resume noticed. Some companies will use scanners to seek out words that are relevant to the jobs they posted. Additionally, the keywords you use can show that you have the right amount of industry knowledge for the job you are applying for. For instance, a market research professional may mention having experience in the voice of customer work, developing actionable customer insights, or analyzing high-level data and research. 

By following these useful tips, you will be able to improve your resume and gain the attention of the hiring managers you want to impress.

prompt: Hello!  We are going to the Bronx Zoo tomorrow.  Please list five tips that will help me plan a successful trip!

messages.content: Hello!  We are going to the Bronx Zoo tomorrow.  Please list five tips that will help me plan a successful trip!

Hello user! Here are some tips for planning a trip to the Bronx Zoo:

1. Make room for "extras" 
Be sure to see the Congo Gorilla Forest and Tiger Mountain. Nature Trek is wonderful for younger kids, while older kids and teens (and adults) will love Treetop Adventure.  

2. Know what's open
Some exhibits are only open during warmer temperatures. For example, Butterfly Garden, the Children's Zoo, Wild Asia Monorail, and Zoo Shuttle are seasonal exhibits. Check info on the specific exhibits you would like to see before going! 

3. Bring a picnic
Food is available for purchase, and outside food is permitted at the Bronx Zoo. The Dancing Crane Cafe has an indoor and outdoor pavilion with a view of a marsh.

4. See Rockefeller Fountain
Rockefeller Fountain was constructed in Como, Italy, in the late 1800s. William Rockefeller purchased it and gifted it to New York City. It was designated as a New York City landmark in 1968.

5. Find the best package for you
You can see a lot with a general admission ticket, including indoor exhibits like Madagascar!, the Zoo Center, and Birds of Prey. There are additional fees to ride the Wild Asia Monorail and Zoo Shuttle or visit Tiger Mountain, Congo Gorilla Forest, the Nature Trek, and Children’s Zoo. A Total Experience ticket may add up to less than these entry fees!

I hope this helps you plan your visit!

prompt: Hi!  I need some ideas for blue cocktails, can you give me 4 recipe ideas?

messages.content: Hi!  I need some ideas for blue cocktails, can you give me 4 recipe ideas?

Blue cocktails, how fun! 

1.  Blue Hawaiian Cooler: For each drink, you need 1 ounce of light rum, 1 ounce of blue curaçao, 1/2 ounce of coconut rum, 1/16 cup cream of coconut, 1/16 cup of pineapple juice, 1 cup of ice; blend all, then garnish with fresh pineapple and a maraschino cherry.

2.  Touchdown Punch:  If you are having a crowd around, this serves 10!  You'll need one liter of Sprite, 4 cups of seltzer, 1 bottle of prosecco, 1 cup of vodka, 1/4 cup of blue curaçao, 1 thinly sliced lemon, and 3 cups of ice.  Mix it all together in a punch bowl, easy-peasy!
   
3. Tropical Mermaid Lemonade:  The kind of drink you'll want to garnish with an umbrella, lemon slices, and maraschino cherries! To create a cool ombré effect, put 1/4 cup of ice in each glass, then a splash of blue curacao, 1/4 cup of rum, and 1/4 cup of ice, then pour over 1/4 cup of lemonade. 

4.  Tiffany Mimosas:  A fun brunch idea, serve in champagne flutes!  Rim each flute with a lemon wedge, then dip in sugar. Pour a little blue curaçao into each flute, fill halfway with the bubbly white wine of your choice (champagne, cava, prosecco, etc.), then top it off with lemonade. prompt: I want to help save the environment what are some ways that I can help around the yard to do my part?

messages.content: I want to help save the environment what are some ways that I can help around the yard to do my part?

There are several ways that you can help save the environment around your yard. Here are some tips:

1. Choose Native Plants - selecting plants that are native to your region is vital.  Plants that are from the area naturally are used to the conditions and require less care, such as fertilizers, watering, and pesticides.

2.  Modify Your Lawn Care - Try replacing your grass with other landscaping items, native low-growing grasses, flowers, vegetable gardens, and hardscape elements.  You could even try synthetic grass.

3. Avoid Chemical Herbicides and Pesticides - Herbicides, and pesticides are terrible for the environment. Old fashion hand weeding and native plants are often all it takes to get rid of unwanted pests. There are many DIY earth-conscious ways to get the pest out.

4. Use Soil Products Made From Recycled Organic Material - All that organic waste that you were going to throw out can be composted.  By composting your organic materials, you are saving space at landfills and producing great soil for your garden.

5. Be Rain Ready - Make sure you prepare for the rain, meaning avoid concrete driveways and walkways and choose absorbent materials so there is no runoff into sewers. Try adding rain barrels around your home to collect rainwater.

prompt: Can you come up with some unique ways to relax and unwind after a stressful day? I’ve tried a lot of things but I want something that involves a sensory experience. I’m not into getting high, so none of the ways can involve alcohol or drugs. Also, these activities should be fast acting.

messages.content: Can you come up with some unique ways to relax and unwind after a stressful day? I’ve tried a lot of things but I want something that involves a sensory experience. I’m not into getting high, so none of the ways can involve alcohol or drugs. Also, these activities should be fast acting.

Here are some fast and drug-free ways to relax your senses and unwind after a stressful day:

1. Aromatherapy: Aromatherapy is an excellent way to de-stress through our sense of smell. What’s more individualistic than our sense of smell? Diffuse lavender essential oils, which provide calmness and relaxation, geranium oil can reduce stress and anxiety while elevating our mood, or peppermint oil to boost energy levels while providing a refreshing scent. 
2. Creativity: If you want a hands-on approach, try your hands at a creative outlet that satisfies your sense of touch. Adult coloring books, painting, knitting, or drawing are a few ways to relax our minds by giving our bodies something productive to do with our hands.
3. Deep Breathing: All it takes is breathing several relaxing breaths to calm down your heart rate and calm your nervous system. Take long, concentrated breaths in through your nose, hold for a couple of seconds, and then quickly breathe out through your mouth. Do this for 1-2 min, and you will feel composed in no time.
4. Going for a walk: A light, easy walk would stimulate our sense of sight farthest from the walls. Walking outside, in nature, or on a quiet path will add a peaceful sense of ease to your day. If you don't have a large amount of time, consider taking walking breaks all day long, whether it be up the stairs or taking a walk around the workplace. It'll have you relaxed before you realize it.
5. Guide Your Imagination: Guided imagery can take you on a mental vacation to help you escape your stressors. Simply sit or lie down in a quiet space and listen to a guided visualization that appeals to your senses.
6. Try Meditating: Meditation is a promising method for creating peace and calm within yourself. Focus on your breath and your physical sensations to help quiet your mind and release tension.
7. Relax Your Body: Progressive muscle relaxation involves tensing and relaxing specific muscle groups in your body, one by one. It releases physical and mental tension, allowing you to fully unwind.

prompt: What are three class archetypes in RPGs? Give a short description of their attributes and the attire they wear. Give an example of each in a different video game.

messages.content: What are three class archetypes in RPGs? Give a short description of their attributes and the attire they wear. Give an example of each in a different video game.

No problem, here are three class archetypes in RPGs!

1. Warrior - Warriors are possibly the most used class in RPGs. It is often known as the default choice and the warrior is typically known for their strength and ability to wield a sword. The warrior normally dons armor made out of some form of metal and also wields a sword and sometimes a shield. They have a muscular build compared to other members of the party and sometimes their opponents. They are not the most clever but can certainly get the job done, most of the time with brute force. 

Edelgard from Fire Emblem Three Houses is a more recent example of the Warrior class.

2. Mage - Mages are probably the 2nd most common class. They typically wield a stave, staff, or some wand-type object but can also sometimes wield different weapons such as a hammer or knives. Their armor is typically a cloak and their defense is oftentimes weaker than other characters. Their magic is often consumable and can run out so they will either need to rest at an inn or use an ether to restore their MP. Black mages typically use offensive magic against their opponents such as fire or lightning while white mages use healing magic like Cure and can also heal status ailments such as poison.

Vivi in Final Fantasy IX is one of the most iconic characters in the RPG genre.

3. Thief - Thieves are most well-known for their speed as well as their ability to steal. This is typically a command that they will have from the moment they join your party. They are normally a more slender build and typically wield knives. They wear cloaks, sometimes with hoods and often prefer to hide and may also want to hide their identity. They are known much more for their support abilities than being able to attack like a Warrior, for instance. In certain games, thieves can steal very rare pieces of equipment from bosses or difficult enemies. Thieves have also been known to poison their enemies.

Therion in Octopath Traveler 1 is an example of a thief. He can steal from enemies while you're in towns, which can be very helpful.

prompt: I already recycle, but I want to learn how to reuse and upcycle more too. Help me brainstorm a list of ways I can repurpose or upcycle plastic and glass bottles at home. messages.content: I already recycle, but I want to learn how to reuse and upcycle more too. Help me brainstorm a list of ways I can repurpose or upcycle plastic and glass bottles at home. I have a lot of 2- liter bottles, wine bottles, milk jugs,and glass pasta jars so try to focus on repurpossing or making DIY stuff with plastic and glass only please.

No problem! Here is that list for you: 

1. Wine bottle bird feeder - You can make an attractive birdfeeder that looks just as decorative as store-bought feeders by using an inverted wine bottle filled with bird seed. 

2. Wine bottle slow-drip plant watering system - You can make a slow-drip watering system for your plants by drilling a hole in the cap or cork of a wine bottle and inserting the inverted water-filled wine bottle into your soil to water your plants. 

3. Mason jar herb garden - Mason jars are the perfect size for growing an attractive kitchen herb garden or starting spring seedlings indoors!  

4. DIY lighting fixtures - Old mason jars, milk jugs, or soda bottles can all be used to create tasteful lighting fixtures for indoor and outdoor settings. 

5. Decorative or functional vases - Glass bottles and plastic cartons -- like milk jugs and glass bottles -- make beautiful vases for displaying a bouquet of flowers.

6. Mason jar organizers - From makeup to Q-tips and cotton balls to toothbrush holders, mason jars are an eclectic and artful method of organizing small items in kitchens, bathrooms, and beyond.

7. Milk jug lantern - Holding a tiny light against an empty milk jug can create a bright-white lantern to illuminate your home during your next power outage. You can use these same lanterns for a fun Halloween DIY lantern project.

8. Milk jug garden scooper - If you need a simple yet effective soil scooper for your home garden, all you need to make one at home is an empty milk jug and some scissors. 

9. Pasta-sauce jar kitchen storage - You can eliminate your need to use plastic storage containers by using empty pasta sauce jars instead.  They can be used to store dried pasta, rice, salt, spices, grains, candy, and much more!    

10. Mason jar lid magnets - Instead of throwing them out, you can create a keepsake photo magnet using any mismatched or old Mason jar lids you have in your kitchen.

prompt: I want to take a trip out to Italy and was looking for about 4 to 5 places to visit. I'm interested in trying out the food and wine there. Would also be interested in visiting landmarks.

messages.content: I want to take a trip out to Italy and was looking for about 4 to 5 places to visit. I'm interested in trying out the food and wine there. Would also be interested in visiting landmarks.

1. Rome - this would be a great place to visit as it hosts a lot of landmarks that are well worth exploring and is regarded as the best place in Italy. It's highly recommended to visit the Coliseum and view some of Michelangelo's greatest works inside the Sistine Chapel. I recommend visiting a café or trattoria on Piazza Navona to indulge in some food and drinks when you get hungry.
2. Florence - The location is situated in Tuscan Valley and dazzles travelers with the old-world avenues leading up to picturesque piazzas. While there, make sure to visit Santa Maria del Fiore Cathedral, which is located in the Piazza del Duomo. Florence is also considered one of the most ideal trips to take in the Chianti wine region.
3. Amalfi Coast - an amazing journey filled with excitement as you navigate through the hairpin turns on the narrow roads. In this region, there are over 30 miles of coastline that 13 colorful seaside towns reside on. This area is great to relax on the beach and indulge in the multiple Michelin-starred restaurants along the coast.
4. Venice - Venice is a beautiful city with canals running throughout the city that carry water taxis, buses, and even a fleet of famous gondolas. If you want something more relaxing on your visit, seek out the smaller streets and canals. It is also recommended to visit Rialto Bridge and tour the grand St. Mark’s Basilica. 
5. Cinque Terre - this is located on northern Italy's Ligurian coast, and it is made up of five picturesque towns named Riomaggiore, Monterosso, Vernazza, Corniglia, and Manarola. If you want to visit a vineyard, it is recommended to go to Manarola, as it boasts scenic vineyards, olive groves, and a centuries-old bell tower. If you're looking to enjoy some landmarks, I'd recommend Vernazza, as it is regarded as one of Italy's most beautiful villages and is known for picture-perfect houses and a medieval castle.

prompt: Create a list of the state bird for every state in the USA. List the States in alphabetical order. Tell me a fun fact about each bird.

messages.content: Create a list of the state bird for every state in the USA. List the States in alphabetical order. Tell me a fun fact about each bird.

Certainly!

* Alabama - Yellowhammer (Northern Flicker) - Eats more ants than any other bird in the USA. 
* Alaska - Willow Ptarmigan - Changes color to match the seasons! In Winter, the feathers turn white! 
* Arizona - Cactus Wren - Build football-shaped nests out of sticks and grass. 
* Arkansas - Northern Mockingbird - A male is able to learn around 200 songs!
* California - California Quail - Will sometimes lay eggs in other nests! 
* Colorado - Lark Bunting - They nest close together in "colonies" or "neighborhoods" and engage in polygyny.
* Connecticut - American Robin - Can sometimes become intoxicated if they eat too many honeysuckle berries. 	
* Delaware - Delaware Blue Hen - A cross-bred chicken that became famous for fighting in the Revolutionary War period.  
* Florida - Northern Mockingbird - Singing at night is more common during a full moon, especially by unmated males! 
* Georgia - Brown Thrasher - Learns over 1,000 different songs and can imitate other bird species.
* Hawaii - Hawaiian Goose (Nēnē) - At only 2,500 birds, the Nene is the world's rarest goose.
* Idaho - Mountain Bluebird - The male feeds the female like a baby bird while she incubates the eggs. 
* Illinois - Northern Cardinal - Sometimes attacks their own reflections mistaking themselves for intruders.
* Indiana - Northern Cardinal - State bird of seven US states! 
* Iowa - Eastern Goldfinch (American Goldfinch) - Strict vegetarians! 
* Kansas	- Western Meadowlark- Make interesting nests that feature a grass "roof" and an entrance tunnel! 
* Kentucky - Northern Cardinal - Unlike other female songbirds, the female Northern Cardinal loves to sing. 
* Louisiana	- Brown Pelican - Performs a mating dance where they bob their heads.  
* Maine - Chickadee - These birds create secret food stockpiles in a behavior known as "caching." 
* Maryland - Baltimore Oriole - Prefer fruit that has a deep-red hue like cherries, mulberries, and grapes.
* Massachusetts - Black-capped Chickadee - The oldest recorded bird lived to be 11 years and 8 months old. 
* Michigan - American Robin -  The oldest recorded age was 13 years and 11 months old. 
* Minnesota - Common Loon - Common Loons are carnivores! They can slow their heart rates to conserve oxygen underwater. 
* Mississippi - Northern Mockingbird	- A male Northern Mockingbird is able to learn around 200 songs throughout his life!
* Missouri - Eastern Bluebird - Males find a nesting spot and females build the nest and incubate the eggs. 
* Montana	- Western Meadowlark - This bird is grey in Winter, but displays yellow and black markings in Spring and Summer. 
* Nebraska - Western Meadowlark - Almost identical Eastern Meadowlark, the two species recognize each other by their calls and songs. 
* Nevada - Mountain Bluebird - The Mountain Bluebird is the only Bluebird species that "hovers" to hunt and catch insects. 
* New Hampshire - Purple Finch - Use large beaks and tongues to crack seeds and can even extract seeds from whole fruits. 
* New Jersey - Eastern Goldfinch (American Goldfinch) - Molt body feathers twice a year.
* New Mexico - Greater Roadrunner - Is the largest Cuckoo bird in the USA.
* New York - Eastern Bluebird - Males find a nesting spot and females build the nest and incubate the eggs. 
* North Carolina - Northern Cardinal - The State bird of seven US states! 
* North Dakota - Western Meadowlark - Features grey plumage in Winter and black and yellow markings on its breast in Spring and Summer. 
* Ohio - Northern Cardinal - Unlike other female songbirds, the females loves to sing.
* Oklahoma - Scissor-tailed Flycatcher - Have been known to chase away much larger birds like Hawks.
* Oregon - Western Meadowlark -  Although almost identical to the Eastern Meadowlark, the two can recognize each other by their calls and songs. 
* Pennsylvania - Ruffed Grouse - Has a tough digestive system and can eat and digest certain foods found in nature that other birds cannot. 
* Rhode Island - Rhode Island Red -Prized for both its meat and egg-laying capabilities. 
* South Carolina - Carolina Wren - A monogamous bird species.
* South Dakota - Ring-necked Pheasant - They usually walk or run and have striking plumage.
* Tennessee - Northern Mockingbird- Loves to sing day or night. 
* Texas - Northern Mockingbird - The female Mockingbird doesn't often sing, but when she does, it's usually in the Fall
* Utah - California Gull - Great parents! They take turns incubating their eggs throughout the day. 
* Vermont - Hermit Thrush - Use a hunting method called "foot-quivering" where they shake clumps of grass to find insects. 
* Virginia - Northern Cardinal - Males are so territorial of their nests that they will sometimes mistake themselves for predators.
* Washington - Willow Goldfinch (American Goldfinch) - Late breeders who time their mating season with the falling of late harvest seeds!
* West Virginia - Northern Cardinal - A pair of Cardinals learns distinctive song phrases.

prompt: Can you suggest some recruiting tips for finding the right job candidates?

messages.content: Can you suggest some recruiting tips for finding the right job candidates?

Ok, here are some useful recruiting tips that will help your company find the best new talent for the job. 

1. Make Use of Employee Referrals - One of the most highly effective hiring strategies for today's growing companies is using employment referrals. This is a process that uses a person's professional network to find the best possible talent. Think about improving your employee referral program by switching to a stipend system for successful hires. When you choose to create a culture of respect toward these referrals, you can give your own networking connections a boost as well. 

2. Create a Positive Experience for Candidates - The way your prospective new talent feels about the hiring process will be based on the interactions they have with your hiring manager and anyone else they talk to at your company. Their experience may also include other interactions that take place without another person involved such as the online job application process or automated responses to their application submission. 

3. Consider Your Internal Recruits - Sometimes recruiting new talent internally for different positions can be more rewarding than hiring new employees. Hiring internally will reduce the amount of time it takes to hire, onboard, or train a new worker. It also cuts down on additional costs for advertising on job boards or paying for background checks. Plus, when you hire someone internally, you are typically dealing with a smaller amount of candidates, which will save you time during the screening and interviewing process. 

4. Make Diversity Your Priority - Having a team with diverse ideas, experiences, and backgrounds can increase your company's effectiveness and drive more innovation for your brand. Ensuring diversity is prioritized during the hiring process is a great way to guarantee a broad representation of staffing, which will help you work toward the best possible outcomes for workplace equity. 

5. Use a Rubric - One cornerstone of the hiring process is clear expectations. Using an interview rubric, or a checklist to analyze candidates may communicate transparency within your hiring process and make sure that the most qualified candidates will apply for the job. An interview rubric is a scoring tool that defines expectations and assists in determining who to interview, who you should call to interview again, and who to offer the new job to. This form of the rubric can be used to objectively measure both tangible and intangible details like relevant experience and demeanor.

prompt: Can you give me some suggestions for how to get Gorilla Glue off of plastic? I don't need any explanations.

messages.content: Can you give me some suggestions for how to get Gorilla Glue off of plastic? I don't need any explanations.

No problem! It's important to use a cleaning solution that safely removes the adhesive without damaging the plastic surface. Here are a few effective ways to get gorilla glue off plastic:
1. Saturate a cotton ball or clean cloth with rubbing alcohol or vinegar and apply it to the surface for several minutes to loosen the adhesive's bond.
2. Use fine-grit sandpaper or a razor blade to scrape away as much excess Gorilla Glue from the plastic surface as possible.
3. Remove Gorilla Glue from plastic surfaces with a commercial adhesive remover product like Goo Gone. Always use safety equipment like gloves and protective eyewear when handling chemicals.
4. For a natural solution, use lemon juice or essential oil to dissolve the adhesive. If you're applying it to your skin, be sure to dilute the lemon essential oil in a carrier oil like coconut or olive oil to avoid skin irritation.

prompt: Hello. I'm going to Liechtenstein in the early fall and need a little help, Can you suggest some do-not-miss places I should see? I love museums and small shops but I'm not into outdoor activities like skiing but I do like a nice walk. I've heard the countryside is beautiful so if there's someplace outside that doesn't require a lot of walking, that would be great!

messages.content: Hello. I'm going to Liechtenstein in the early fall and need a little help, Can you suggest some do-not-miss places I should see? I love museums and small shops but I'm not into outdoor activities like skiing but I do like a nice walk. I've heard the countryside is beautiful so if there's someplace outside that doesn't require a lot of walking, that would be great!

It would be my pleasure! Here is a list of places to see in Liechtenstein.

Vaduz: The Capital City
The Liechtenstein Center, a visitor information center, is the first place you want to visit in Vaduz. Here you'll find information about the sites, what they cost, when they are open and maps showing you how to get there. In addition to its beauty, Vaduz is the smallest capital in Europe which makes walking from one site to another a breeze. You can explore the historic small town, or 
Städtle, visit the Landtag, which is Liehtenstein's parliament building built near the Rhine River. If you get tired, there are plenty of good restaurants available along with local stores. 
One place you don't want to miss is Schloss Vaduz or the Vaduz Castle. Built in the 12th century, Schloss Vaduz, also called The Princely House of Liechtenstein, serves as a home for the royal monarchs. 

The Treasure Chamber of the Principality of Liechtenstein in Vaduz
Sixteen monarchs have sat on the Liechtenstein throne since 1608. The Treasure Chamber of the Principality of Liechtenstein houses 400 years of royal treasures and artwork collected during that time. Two particular highlights are a collection of Easter eggs some of which were created by Karl Fabergé and notable works of art such as Johann Ludwig Bleuler's  "Rhine Journey" paintings. In contrast, weapons and artifacts collected over the centuries are displayed in the Treasure Chamber along with space rocks from the moon. 

Schellenberg Castles
Take a side trip to Schellenberg and explore two medieval castles in one visit. Build in 1200, the Upper Castle (Obere Burg) was used as living quarters until the 16th century when it was abruptly abandoned. The castles fell into disrepair until 1956 when the monarchy turned the castles over to the Historical Association of the Principality of Liechtenstein. The Lower Castle (Untere Burg) is the smaller of the two castles. The site is free to visit and is well worth the trip.

prompt: What are 6 things to consider when building a personal budget? Please list them out, and provide a detailed explanation of each.

messages.content: What are 6 things to consider when building a personal budget? Please list them out, and provide a detailed explanation of each.

Sure thing! To create your personal budget, follow these six steps. 

1. Calculate your net income. 
Start by creating your net income. Net income is the money you earn after all taxes and fees have been accounted for; it is the money that figuratively ends up in your pocket at the end of each month. This is important as the foundation of your budget. It determines how much you have available to allocate to your expense categories. A common mistake people make when calculating income is to use the gross total before taxes and pension contributions. This means they anticipate more income than they actually receive and thus leads to an inaccurate budget. To find your net income, you can look closely at some historic payslips or use one of the many online calculators. 

2. Track your spending.
The next step is to track and categorize your spending habits for 1-3 months. I would advise three months to ensure any quarterly payments are included; however, one month is enough to get a sense of spending habits in most areas. This is important as it will give you an idea of where your money goes each month and give you a solid base to create a monthly budget. To do this, you can write down each transaction you make throughout a period and assign it a category. Use an Excel spreadsheet to make things easier for you. Most banks will allow you to download a CSV file that includes all your transactions for a pre-determined period. Once downloaded, you can write a category next to each transaction. 

3. Set attainable goals.
The next thing you need to account for is the goals you have. Ensure that your goals are attainable and set a period for them also. Common goals are to pay down debt you have previously accrued or establish savings such as a three-month emergency fund. These goals should primarily be short-term and achievable within 1 to 3 years. It is ok to establish longer-term goals, but for your monthly budget, the short-term is what we are most interested in. Make sure these are motivating goals, as these will help to keep you on track when you want to disregard your budget. 

4. Make your plan. 
This is where you start to formulate a budget. You have your recorded transactions and your income. Look at your recorded expenses and determine for each category what a good budget would be for each month. For some of your fixed costs, this will be obvious. Your rent, for example, will not vary month on month. Your variable costs, such as eating out, may vary monthly, so set a middle ground you are comfortable with. You will need to make separate categories that consider your goals, for instance, a vacation category where you aim to save $100 monthly. All your budgeted expenses totaled should fall within your net income number. If it doesn't, you will have to cut back somewhere. 

5. Stick to your budget. 
Take great care to stick within your budget. Your budget guarantees reaching those goals and living within your means. Continue to track your spending to ensure you are remaining within budget. If you see certain categories are almost fully spent and it is only the 9th of the month, this should help you to stop spending in that category. If you overspend in one category, consider reducing spending in another to stay on track. Use your goals as motivation to stick with it.

6. Review regularly. 
A budget is only as good as when you do it, so maintain and update it as necessary. A pay raise at work will mean your budget can be adjusted to show more income and more capacity to save or spend. It's always good to review your budget at least quarterly, but the best budgets are updated monthly to account for the variables of life, such as birthdays, events, and other one-off occasions. It's unlikely that your December (Christmas) budget is the same as your budget for February. Use a forward-thinking approach to maintain and update your budget. There is no harm in reducing your budget in one month, so you can increase it in another so long as combined, they are within your income.

Sure, I can help you with that. Many places in Arizona have interesting modern art, especially in the Phoenix and Scottsdale areas.  Here are some ideas for you to visit in May:

3. If you also like photography, a good option for visiting could be MonOrchid.  It's a split gallery exhibit space, which has the Bokeh Gallery and the Shade Gallery.  The Bokeh Gallery is mainly photographic artwork and digital collages. The Shade Gallery, however, is a significant space containing static and modular walls that can adapt to a variety of exhibitions. This is an ever-changing art space and is well-known by modern art enthusiasts. 
4. Perhaps you should try going to Perihelion Arts, which is a cutting-edge contemporary art gallery/artist collective that was established by Amy Young. The gallery aims to reveal the very best of contemporary art to promote public interest in the arts, with a priority on art that pushes boundaries. This includes folk, surrealism, pop surrealism, outsider, and erotic art.
5. Another option is Oblique Art, a contemporary urban arts space and pop-up gallery located in downtown Phoenix. Obliq Art was established in 2012 intending to showcase exceptional contemporary paintings, photography and mixed media created by local Arizona artists.

These options are some of the most popular options for modern art, but there is more where that came from.  Depending on how long you'll be staying in Scottsdale, you may want to visit even more exhibits.

1. Eat and drink healthy foods and beverages- while coffee is a go-to for many people on the go, overdrinking coffee can lead to more stress and anxiety. Limit your intake of unhealthy foods and beverages, specifically those with high sugar content.

2. Exercise regularly- Exercising can release endorphins that boost your mood and give you more energy. Try taking a daily walk or taking time out of your day to practice aerobics or other stress-relieving exercises. 

3. Learn to set realistic goals- Sometimes, we pile too much onto our plates and feel discouraged that we weren't able to accomplish all that we set out to. 1) Albright-Knox Art Gallery - If you are a more artistic couple, Albright-Knox Art Gallery is a great option!  They are constantly changing their exhibits to keep things fresh for frequent visitors!  They also feature date events on their website that may be of interest to you!

2) Food Truck Tuesday - Who doesn't like food?  This is a hit with virtually anyone!  With a variety of food, from Italian to sausage, to even sweets, there is something for everyone at this event!  It is sure to be a win!

3) Rent bikes downtown - Reddy Bikeshare and United Health have collaborated on this project and have provided bikes, which you can now rent for only $8.50 an hour!  Cheaper than an Uber, healthier than an Uber, and certainly more fun than an Uber!

4) Seneca Buffalo Creek Casino - Wish to try your luck?  Seneca Buffalo Creek Casino features all that you would expect from a casino; great food and plenty of ways to gamble!  Top that all off with a unique twist in the option of booking a room, perfect for you and your date!

prompt: Hi! Please brainstorm 5 social media websites that are good for visual artists to build a following on, I'm a new artist trying to get followers and commissioners, thank you :)

messages.content: Hi! Please brainstorm 5 social media websites that are good for visual artists to build a following on, I'm a new artist trying to get followers and commissioners, thank you :)

Of course! Join one or all of these websites to start building your following:

1. Instagram. Artists love Instagram because the image-only platform greets followers with a gallery of your artwork. You can also share WIPs and other temporary posts with Instagram stories. Use hashtags to increase your visibility and gain followers.
2. Twitter. Start following artists on Twitter to gain a circle in minutes, then share your art with the world. Popular artists can get tens of thousands of likes on a single post.
3. Tumblr. This site is less popular than others, but artists still earn tens of thousands of followers. Tumblr also spotlights posts every day, and if you catch the staff's eye, your work could be one of the highlights. Tumblr's platform permits text, video, and full-sized images.
4. TikTok. Video platforms are a little more complicated, but you can show followers your process, share WIPs, and show off the final piece with filters and music.
5. Facebook. While Facebook's demographic skews older, you can still earn a following--the site has two billion users after all. Your friends and relatives can also easily find your work and promote it to others.

Artists tend to diversify so that they can reach several audiences on multiple platforms. Find the sites that work for you, then start your journey to online fame!

prompt: Hi, I need help coming up with unique mosnters for my RPG. Can you give me 10 ideas for interesting things monsters can do in an RPG? I like ideas that are kind of dark, but that's not necessarily a requirement.

messages.content: Hi, I need help coming up with unique mosnters for my RPG. Can you give me 10 ideas for interesting things monsters can do in an RPG? I like ideas that are kind of dark, but that's not necessarily a requirement.

Here are ten ideas for monster powers and abilities that can help you get going with creating unique threats for your RPG:

1. Shadowstep: This creature can step into one shadow and emerge from another nearby.
2. Lacerating Roar: This creature has the remains of so many former victims trapped in its teeth that its roar sends flurries of bone shards and debris at its prey.
3. Howl of the Dead: This creature gives an unearthly howl, summoning ghosts from beyond the grave to attack its foes.
4. Endless Hands: This creature constantly grows new hands and arms as its limbs are severed, much in the way a hydra grows new heads.
5. Locust Swarm: This creature vomits swarms of locusts that are capable of consuming prey in moments.
6. Sticky: Any melee weapons used to attack this monster will stick to its body, requiring a check to pull them free.
7. Wall Walk: This creature is capable of walking on walls with perfect ease.
8. Retractable Spines: This creature ejects spines from its body, striking anyone standing too close.
9. Planeshift: This creature shifts slightly out of its current plane of existence, more or less at random, making it less likely to be hit by attacks.
10: Acidic Blood: This creature bleeds acid. After sustaining a certain amount of damage, it convulses, spraying acid everywhere.

Do these help get your imagination going? Let me know if you need more ideas!

prompt:
I’m looking for books to suggest for my book club next month. The month’s theme is historical fiction. 

In the past, most members seemed to like these books: 
Circe by Madeline Miller
Conjure Women by Afia Atakora
The Bear and the Nightingale by Katherine Arden
Nettle & Bone by T. Kingfisher

Most of us really disliked these books: 
The Historian by Elizabeth Kostova
The Year of the Witching by Alexis Henderson
My Year of Rest and Relaxation by Otessa Moshfeegh
If We Were Villains by M. L. Rio

The group is mostly women and most of us enjoy books with female or non-binary protagonists. We’re also looking for more diversity in authors' and protagonists' perspectives. Give me ten suggestions with a brief (1-2 sentences max) explanation of why you’re recommending each book.

messages.content:
I’m looking for books to suggest for my book club next month. The month’s theme is historical fiction. 

In the past, most members seemed to like these books: 
Circe by Madeline Miller
Conjure Women by Afia Atakora
The Bear and the Nightingale by Katherine Arden
Nettle & Bone by T. Kingfisher

Most of us really disliked these books: 
The Historian by Elizabeth Kostova
The Year of the Witching by Alexis Henderson
My Year of Rest and Relaxation by Otessa Moshfeegh
If We Were Villains by M. L. Rio

The group is mostly women and most of us enjoy books with female or non-binary protagonists. We’re also looking for more diversity in authors' and protagonists' perspectives. Give me ten suggestions with a brief (1-2 sentences max) explanation of why you’re recommending each book.

Sure thing! Here are 10 popular historical fiction books to suggest to your book club:

1. The Silence of the Girls by Pat Barker - This reimagining of the Fall of Troy is told mostly from the perspective of the women who were enslaved by the famed victors and conquerors of the classic story. This book is popular with fans of Madeline Miller’s Circe. 

2. The Murmur of Bees by Sofia Segovia - This book features a male protagonist but focuses on a larger and more diverse family and community in a small Mexican town during the Mexican Revolution and the 1918 influenza epidemic. It also has some elements of magical realism. 

3. The Underground Railroad by Colson Whitehead - In this book, author Colson Whitehead reimagines the legendary network that heralded escaped slaves from the antebellum South to freedom in the north as a literal, physical railroad. This book is a New York Times bestseller and Pulitzer Prizewinner with elements of magical realism, which members of your club seem to enjoy. 

4. Moloka’i by Alan Brennert - Set in Hawaii in the late 1800s and early 1900s, this novel follows the story of a young Hawaiian woman sent to live in a leprosy settlement on the island of Moloka’i. 

5. The Mermaid from Jeju by Sumi Hahn - This book features a female protagonist living in Korea after the end of World War 2, coming of age and reckoning with the loss of her mother. 

6. The Book of Night Women by Marlon James - Set on a Jamaican sugar plantation in the late 1700s, this novel tells the story of Lilith, a woman born into slavery who becomes involved in the planning of a slave rebellion. 

7. The Shadow of the Wind by Carlos Ruiz Zafon - Set in Barcelona in the aftermath of the Spanish Civil War, this New York Times bestseller is a popular choice for book clubs focused on historical fiction. 

8. The Book Thief by Markus Zusak - Set in Nazi Germany, this book follows the story of a young girl who steals books to share them with her neighbors and the Jewish stowaway living in her basement to help keep spirits lifted during wartime. It is a historical fiction book well suited for book lovers and an ode to literature.

9. Homegoing by Yaa Gyasi - This story of two half-sisters born in 18th century Ghana spans multiple generations and continents. This book is popular with fans of Conjure Women by Afia Atakora. 

10. The Nightingale by Kristin Hannah - This story follows two French sisters navigating the backdrop of early World War 2, one harboring a German captain in her home against her will while the other joins up with the Resistance. It was the Goodreads Choice Awards winner for Best Historical Fiction novel in 2015.

prompt: I have a lot of old pictures that I don't know quite what to do with. I want to keep them all, but it seems like a lot of trouble to scan them all to digitize them. Please help me brainstorm some different ways that I can get them digitized with as little trouble as possible, and explain how each idea will help. Use a hyphenated list.

messages.content: I have a lot of old pictures that I don't know quite what to do with. I want to keep them all, but it seems like a lot of trouble to scan them all to digitize them. Please help me brainstorm some different ways that I can get them digitized with as little trouble as possible, and explain how each idea will help. Use a hyphenated list.

Of course! Pictures can be very precious, so here are a few things that might make it easier:

- Take Bite-Sized Pieces - If you have more than one box, instead of trying to do them all at once, do a small amount at a time so you don't get overwhelmed.
- Sort First - To prevent yourself from scanning two copies of the same picture, you should sort your pictures first. You will need to have different boxes and decide in advance what you will put in each box. You can sort them by year, event, or anything else you want. This will help you decide if you want to keep a dozen pictures of the same event or if you only want to keep the best ones.
- Get Others Involved - By getting your family involved, you are lessening the workload on any one person. This may also make it fun as you all reminisce.
- Hire Someone Else - There are companies out there who you can hire to do this for you. You pay for a box, and they scan all the pictures that will fit in the box for a certain fee and then provide you with a digital copy of them.

I hope that these can help you transfer all your pictures easier!

prompt: What are some ways I can use my real estate license other than selling houses?

messages.content: What are some ways I can use my real estate license other than selling houses?

The following are some ways you can use a real estate license aside from selling houses. 

1. Real Estate Marketing Specialist. Ideally, For this role, you may have a degree or experience in marketing in addition to your real estate license. You would handle advertising, social media strategies, and branding of your real estate firm both online and offline. You would build relationships through email, social media, community events, and networking with potential and current clients.
2. Real Estate Investor. A real estate investor buys property for either long-term or short-term investment return. Buying homes to flip or using them as short-term rentals or long-term rentals are some popular ways to invest. Holding a real estate license can help save money during the purchase process. 
3. Education Instructor. You can become an instructor for a real estate education company to help people prepare for and pass the state licensing exam. You can also teach continuing education classes for Realtors.
4. Broker. If you have years of experience as a real estate agent, you can expand your business by becoming a broker. You can work for yourself and hire agents to work for you. Many real estate agents move forward in their careers by taking this path.

prompt: Give me 5 low-sugar smoothie options. I don't like kale, so don't include that in any of your suggestions. Make sure at least one idea has kiwi. Describe each option.

messages.content: Give me 5 low-sugar smoothie options. I don't like kale, so don't include that in any of your suggestions. Make sure at least one idea has kiwi. Describe each option.

Here are 5 low-sugar smoothie options that don't include kale with one option that has kiwi:

1. Low-Sugar Blueberry Smoothie: This nutrient-rich and low-sugar smoothie option contains 1 cup of fresh or frozen blueberries, 1/4 avocado, 1/2 medium banana, 1 cup of frozen cauliflower florets, and 1 cup of water for a balanced and filling morning or midday treat. Blend the ingredients and add a tablespoon of lemon juice to enhance the flavors and bring them together.   
2. Skinny Strawberry Cheesecake Smoothie: Blend 1 cup of fresh or frozen strawberries, 1/2 cup Greek yogurt or cottage cheese, 1/3 cup milk or almond milk, 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, and 1/2 medium banana for a sweet, tart, and creamy smoothie that's low in sugar and high in protein. 
3. Kiwi Banana Smoothie: Made with 2 peeled and cubed kiwis, 1 ripe frozen banana, 1 1/2 cups fresh spinach, 1 cup plant-based milk, 2 tablespoons ground flaxseed, and 1 tablespoon of freshly squeezed lemon juice, this healthy and delicious kiwi smoothie is packed with vitamins and flavor. 
4. Skinny Chocolate Recovery Smoothie: This low-sugar chocolate smoothie is perfect after a long and intensive workout. Puree 1 small banana, 1 scoop of unsweetened whey protein powder, 1 cup ice, 1 cup unsweetened almond milk, and 2 tablespoons of cocoa powder for a quick and guilt-free chocolate treat that will get you started on the road to recovery.   
5. Orange Carrot Smoothie: Blend 1 large seedless and peeled orange, 1 large peeled and roughly chopped carrot, 1 medium banana, 1/2 cup water, a 2 inch-piece of thinly sliced fresh ginger, 2 tablespoons flax seed meal, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1/4 teaspoon turmeric, and ice to taste for a nutritious smoothie with enough earthy sweetness and citrusy goodness to keep you going for the rest of your day.

prompt: My son is a very responsible twelve-year-old who is looking to earn some money this summer. He's not old enough to work at an establishment, so can you help think of some side jobs he could do and be paid in cash?

messages.content: My son is a very responsible twelve-year-old who is looking to earn some money this summer. He's not old enough to work at an establishment, so can you help think of some side jobs he could do and be paid in cash?

It's great that your son is hard-working and responsible. Here are some money-generating ideas that might help him:

• Yard work: Many people have trouble taking excellent care of their yards throughout the season. The summer heat makes it difficult to maintain a yard's appearance, especially for the elderly. In spring, gardens will need to be tilled and flowers should be planted before the heat arrives. In summer, the grass grows quickly and most yards will need to be mowed at least once a week. Weeds grow continuously and will need to be trimmed or pulled.

• Animal care: It's common for busy day-shifters to hire dog walkers to care for their dogs during the day and give them exercise and attention. It's also possible to wash, bathe, and groom dogs outside in the summer months without the need for special equipment. If your son has experience with reptiles, birds, rabbits, or other household pets, those opportunities might be better. When families go on summer vacation, they often need someone to look after their pets and homes.

• Home upkeep: Cleaning houses is a year-round opportunity to generate income. The summer months, in particular, are good for repainting items, power washing, and upkeep on exteriors. Fences may need patching and new rocks spread in driveways.

• Tutoring: Many parents worry that their children will forget what they've learned during the school year. In the absence of a formal summer school, weekly tutoring can help get children back on track and ready for the next grade level. If your son excels in academics, he can ask for recommendations from his teachers to help others before the school year ends.

• Selling items: If your child has accumulated clothes and toys that they've outgrown or no longer need, a yard sale may be a way to generate income. If someone else in your neighborhood is having a yard sale, they could also contribute baked goods or lemonade for sale to generate a profit. This could be a beneficial lesson in economics too.

I hope one of these works for your son!

prompt: I'm going to Egypt and I want to see some of the historical stuff there. However, I'm not really interested in only seeing the outside of the pyramids, as that sounds boring. Can you brainstorm for me a list of places I could go see where I could actually tour the inside?

messages.content: I'm going to Egypt and I want to see some of the historical stuff there. However, I'm not really interested in only seeing the outside of the pyramids, as that sounds boring. Can you brainstorm for me a list of places I could go see where I could actually tour the inside?

I have no problem making a list like that for you. Here are a few places I think you will like:

- Temple of Hatshepsut - This huge temple has three layers and was built for one of the few female pharaohs. It is very well-preserved, and people are free to walk inside and view the architecture and reliefs. 
- Luxor Temple - This temple is on the east bank of the Nile and is also open for people to walk through, though it is missing large amounts of its roof. 
- Red Pyramid - This pyramid does allow people to enter it. It is the 4th highest of the pyramids, and it doesn't tend to have too much of a crowd. 
- Abu Simbel - This is a twin temple in southern Egypt that was carved out of a mountainside. Though it has since been painstakingly removed from its original location to prevent it from flooding and being damaged, they do allow people inside it. 

I hope you have a fun trip!

prompt: What should I do in Italy?  I love museums and food.

messages.content: What should I do in Italy?  I love museums and food.

Italy is a great destination for those who love museums and food! Here are some recommendations for things to do:

- Rome is a great city to visit in Italy and is home to a number of museums including the Vatican Museums, which include the Sistine Chapel.  Rome is also well-known for its simple but flavorful cuisine including Pizza al taglio, carbonara, and gelato.
- Florence is another lovely Italian city where you will find the famous Uffizi Gallery which houses works by Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo, and Botticelli, among others.  Florence is known for its Mediterranean and Tuscan cuisines, so make sure to try Bistecca alla Fiorentina, which is Florence's most famous dish.
- Naples is famous for its pizza, so it is a must-visit if you are in Italy and love local cuisines!  The city is also home to the National Archaeological Museum, which houses a large collection of ancient Roman artifacts, including mosaics and sculptures.

These are just a few ideas for things to do in Italy if you love museums and food. There are plenty of other museums, galleries, and restaurants to explore, so be sure to do some research and plan your itinerary ahead of time!

Sure!  Here's a list of 3 popular types of pasta sauces.

1. Bolognese Sauce: Bolognese is a meat-based tomato sauce. It is customarily used to on top of tagliatelle al ragù and to prepare lasagne alla bolognese.

prompt: I’m going to be in Kyoto for a night or two in August and would love to see some temples while I’m there. Can you give me a list of a few temples in Kyoto and some information on them?

messages.content: I’m going to be in Kyoto for a night or two in August and would love to see some temples while I’m there. Can you give me a list of a few temples in Kyoto and some information on them?

Kyoto is the ancient capital of Japan and a massive cultural hub. As a result, it has over 2,000 temples to visit. Here are a few popular options:

- Kiyomizudera: Kiyomizudera is one of the most famous temples in all of Japan. It’s a massive wood structure sitting out on a steep hillside above trees that are a beautiful red in the fall. It has a narrow path that goes down to the Otowa-no-taki, a waterfall split into three streams by a manmade structure. There is plenty to see and explore around Kiyomizudera.

- Kinkaku-ji: Kinkaku-ji is also known as the Golden Pavilion. This is the most visited temple in Kyoto. The temple has great historical significance, going back to the 14th century. The current structure goes back to 1955 after the previous temple was burnt down by an arsonist. The temple is covered in Gold Foil and is said to represent spiritual purity. 

- Ginkaku-ji: This is the sister temple to the Kinkaku-ji and is also known as the Silver Pavillion. The foliage of the temple grounds completely hides the outside world, giving the temple a secluded feel. There is a sand garden with a cone structure that is said to represent Mount Fuji.

- Nanzen-ji: Nanzen-ji is famous for its gateless gate. It’s a wooden structure that sits above the temple grounds. The platform is a great place to rest and absorb the temple and scenery. You can climb up to the balcony for a small fee. It also features an aqueduct that is one of Kyoto’s most photogenic spots.

- Kennin-ji: Kennin-ji is in the Geisha District, one of the most famous areas of Kyoto. Kennen-ji has incredible rock gardens, one symbolizing the fundamental forms of the universe and the other symbolizing the Buddha and two Zen monks. The temple dates back to the early 1200s and is a great break from a busy part of the city.

prompt: I want to start a vegetable garden this summer. I live in the northeast United States. What are the best vegetables to plant for a beginner?

messages.content: I want to start a vegetable garden this summer. I live in the northeast United States. What are the best vegetables to plant for a beginner?

Here are some good ones to start with:

  1. Peas and pole beans: install a trellis, plant your seeds, and keep them watered. Peas should be planted as early as possible, but you should wait until the soil is at least 60 degrees for the beans.
  2. Chard and kale: these can be used for cooking and salads. Leaves can be harvested when the plants are about one foot tall and continue to be harvested well into the fall.
  3. Radishes: can be planted at any time of the year and harvested in 30 days.
  4. Baby lettuce and salad mixes: sow the seeds in a 2-3 inch-wide band, water, and harvest in 30-40 days. 
  5. Basil: plant once the soil has warmed to 60 degrees. When the plants reach about 8 inches tall, start harvesting leaves from the bottom up.
  6. Scallions: very easy to grow and can be harvested in around 60 days.
  7. Summer squash: notoriously simple to grow. Plant two or three seeds in a mound, keep it watered, and check daily for ripe fruit.
  8. Peppers: sweet and hot peppers are generally easier to grow than bell peppers. Jalapeno and purple beauty are two of the easiest varieties to grow.
  9. Eggplant: Good beginner varieties are little finger, ping tung long, and snowy. Make sure they get plenty of sun.
  10. Tomatoes: they need stakes or tomato cages for support, but there are a ton of varieties for beginners to choose from. Bellstar and black cherry are two you might want to try.

prompt: Can you give me six ideas for titles for a book I am writing? The book is about an investigative journalist who received a mysterious note that seems to be from the victim of a murder they are investigating.

messages.content: Can you give me six ideas for titles for a book I am writing? The book is about an investigative journalist who received a mysterious note that seems to be from the victim of a murder they are investigating.

Absolutely! Here are six ideas for titles for your book: 

1. "Deadly Deadline" - This title plays on the idea of a journalist being on a tight deadline while also hinting at the danger of the investigation. 

2. "The Dead Can't Speak" - This title plays on the idea that the murder victim is unable to communicate directly with the main character, but has left behind clues that can help solve the crime. 

3. "The Clues Left Behind" - This title plays on the clues left in the note that was written by the victim while also suggesting that the main character must follow the clues to solve the murder.

4. "The Note Taker" - This title focuses on the main character's role as an investigative journalist and also the fact that they receive a note from the victim.

5. "The Trail of Evidence" - This title emphasizes the idea that the main character must follow a series of clues to uncover the truth about the murder.

6. "The Secret Note" - This title emphasizes the idea that the note contains a secret that the main character must uncover in order to solve the murder.

prompt: I am renting a studio apartment that feels tiny. What are some things I can do to make it feel larger, without making any permanent alterations that might violate my lease?

messages.content: I am renting a studio apartment that feels tiny. What are some things I can do to make it feel larger, without making any permanent alterations that might violate my lease?

There are a lot of things you can do to make your studio apartment seem larger without making permanent changes! Here are a few ideas:

1. Hang oversize art. A big landscape painting will make it look like you are walking into the scene. 

2. Add reflective surfaces. A large mirror will make your studio apartment look bigger, but so will other reflective surfaces such as lacquered furniture. 

3. Don’t shove all your furniture against the wall. It might be tempting to do that to create more floor space, but it sends the message that you don’t have enough floor space. Instead, consider “floating” a piece of furniture such as a sofa or a bed away from the wall. 

Are these helpful ideas? Would you like to hear more?

prompt: I want my mom to move into the little house I built for her behind my house, but she is hesitant to leave her home in Shreveport. How can I make her feel more at home here in Charlotte?

messages.content: I want my mom to move into the little house I built for her behind my house, but she is hesitant to leave her home in Shreveport. How can I make her feel more at home here in Charlotte?

Making your mom feel at home will mean helping her get established in her new city. Here are some things you can do for that: 
- Church - If she's religious, you could start by taking her to a couple of different churches to help figure out which one she feels the most comfortable with. 
- Doctors - Get a list of her doctors, and find highly-rated specialists in your city that would accept her insurance, so that she doesn't have to find her new medical professionals entirely on her own. 
- Decor - Decorate her new home in a style she loves, and let her bring her favorite furniture with her. You should let her make some simple choices in the house you've built, like paint color or countertops, so that she feels invested in the new space. 
- Activities - Keep her active and bring her on errands to the store with you. Let her get acclimated to the new shops and look forward to going with you.

prompt: Give me some suggestions for easy art projects for preschool-aged kids.

messages.content: Give me some suggestions for easy art projects for preschool-aged kids.

1. Paper Bag Jellyfish - This is a simple and easy art project that preschoolers are sure to love. It works well for promoting hand and eye coordination and cutting skills. Along with paper bags, you'll need scissors or pinking sheers. You will also need paint, paintbrushes, googly eyes, and glue. 

2. Tissue Paper Apple - SInce apples are often associated with school this is the ideal craft idea to get the new school year started with. Draw an apple outline and have small pieces of red or green tissue paper squares ready to be crumpled and glued to color in the space. 

3. Fork Print Tulips - This cute project only requires a fork, heavyweight paper and paint. Use the fork to dip into the paint and create the tulip buds, then paint on the stems. Would make a great Mother's Day gift. 

4. Paper Plate Lion - All you need for this fun craft is orange and black paint, paintbrushes, paper plates, and scissors. Add some popsicle sticks to glue to the back and you will have a fun puppet show in no time. 

5. Popsicle Stick Rainbow - All you'll need for this craft are some pieces of blue cardstock paper, cotton balls, glue and popsicle sticks. Have your kids color the popsicle sticks so they are every color of the rainbow. Then help them glue the sticks to create a rainbow on the blue paper with clouds at the end. 

6. Paper Plate Octopus - Kids love octopuses and this craft would be a cute and fun task for your little ones to try. Cut out strips of construction paper to make the legs and use the paper plate for the body. Have the kids draw eyes and a mouth or use fun googly eyes instead. 

7. Macaroni Necklace - This is a staple craft for many people. The macaroni noodles are easy to place onto a piece of yarn and you can also add large beads to make the necklace even more colorful.

prompt: I need help coming up with dinner ideas. I have some ground beef I'd like to use. Recommend me 5 things I could make. Describe each dish and give me an estimate of how long it would take to prepare.

Here are five dinner ideas that include ground beef along with a description of each dish and an estimate of how long it would take to prepare:

1. Ground Beef Tacos. This handheld meal features seasoned ground beef, chopped onion, shredded cheese, diced tomatoes, shredded lettuce, and warm corn or flour tortillas. Best yet, it comes together in just 20 minutes.  
2. Stovetop Ground Beef Stroganoff. This creamy comfort dish featuring saucy ground beef over rice or noodles can be made in under 30 minutes. 
3. 30-Minute Chili With Ground Beef and Beans. As the name suggests, this ground beef and beans chili will only take you 30 minutes to prepare. Top it with sour cream, green onions, chopped red onions, or even add a baked potato for a more complete meal. 
4. Indoor Grilled Burger. If you have hamburger buns or even sliced bread on hand, you can make a delicious burger with your ground beef in only 15 minutes. Lettuce leaves, sliced tomato, sliced onions, sliced pickles, sliced cheese, and ketchup or mustard are all common and tasty inclusions for this classic meal.  
5. Big Mac Salad. Skip the drive-thru and make this salad with seasoned ground beef, crispy lettuce, creamy cheddar, sweet tomatoes, and of course special sauce. Start to finish this meal should only take you 20 minutes to make. 

I hope that these suggestions are helpful as you plan your dinner. Happy cooking!

She's also into yoga and meditation and loves to read. What do you suggest for her that would cater to her interests and lifestyle?

messages.content: I'm trying to find a thoughtful and practical birthday gift for my sister. She's a nurse and always on her feet, so something comfortable and functional would be perfect. She's also into yoga and meditation and loves to read. What do you suggest for her that would cater to her interests and lifestyle?

Sure! Here are some gift ideas for your sister: 

1. Shoes: Keep your sister's feet happy and supported during long shifts with a pair of stylish and functional shoes designed for nurses. Some have features like slip-resistant soles, arch support, and breathable mesh, she'll be ready to tackle anything her job throws at her.

2. Inhale, Exhale – Breathing Bracelet: Keep your sister grounded and focused throughout her busy day with this subtle accessory. Most of these have a simple design inscribed with a handy breathing exercise; she can take a quick pause to reset her thoughts anytime.

3. Travel Meditation Cushion: Help your sister find inner peace wherever she goes with a comfortable cushion designed for mindfulness on the go. These can be a compact size and have a carrying handle to make it easy to transport from home to work to yoga class.

4. Chakra Balancing: Help your sister feel revitalized and balanced with some crystals. Each type of stone is said to promote a different energy and can be used for meditation, decoration, or carried as a good luck charm. So, pick the one you think she most needs. 

5. Downward Dog oomph: Give the gift of convenience with a foldable, lightweight yoga mat that fits easily in a tote bag or backpack. Perfect for impromptu yoga sessions and stretching breaks during those long nursing shifts.

6. Nurse Life Sweater: Give a nod to your sister's hardworking nursing career with a cozy sweater featuring nurse-themed graphics. It’s great for layering over scrubs or lounging at home with a good book.

prompt: What are some good tips to potty train a dog?

messages.content: What are some good tips to potty train a dog?

Here are a few tips to begin potty training your dog:

- Control your dog’s diet and feed them at regular times.
- Keep a consistent schedule for taking your dog outside, feeding them, and exercising them.
- Provide regular exercise to help with motility.
- Reinforce your dog's willingness to go outside with verbal praise or treats.
- Use a repeatable phrase, such as "bathroom" or "potty", each time you take your dog to the elimination area.
- Avoid punishing your dog for accidents and clean them up thoroughly.
