prompt: I just became engaged and I need tips about how my dog can be a part of it. I want him there, but I don't want it to be weird for my guests either. Give me some ways to make any way I include him happen more smoothly.

messages.content: I just became engaged and I need tips about how my dog can be a part of it. I want him there, but I don't want it to be weird for my guests either. Give me some ways to make any way I include him happen more smoothly.

Here are some tips on how to include your dog in your wedding:
1) Be objective regarding your dog's true behavior, especially around guests. Ask yourself if you're setting yourself and/or your guests up for disappointment.
2) Have your dog only be part of the photos instead of worrying about their behavior during the ceremony.
3) Find out if any of your guests would be uncomfortable around dogs.
4) See if your chosen venue allows pets.
5) Hire someone or have a designated dog handler for the day of the wedding who can see to its needs and keep the dog happy and focused.

prompt: I have been thinking about starting a running routine but I don't know how to structure it into a program. Please help me make a running program that details the amount of running I should do that ramps up from a sedentary lifestyle until I can run a marathon.

messages.content: I have been thinking about starting a running routine but I don't know how to structure it into a program. Please help me make a running program that details the amount of running I should do that ramps up from a sedentary lifestyle until I can run a marathon.

Congratulations on wanting to become active and start training for a marathon. Before beginning any exercise program, be sure to talk to a healthcare professional such as a doctor so they can check to make sure you are able to enter into an exercise program. Assuming you pass a physical and are fit enough to start exercising here is an example program that can get you from sedentary to marathon shape:

Beginner's schedule
Week 1: Run for one minute, and walk for 90 seconds. Repeat eight times. Do it three times a week.
Week 2: Run for two minutes, and walk for one minute. Repeat seven times. Do it three times a week.
Week 3: Run for three minutes, and walk for one minute. Repeat six times. Do it three times a week.
Week 4: Run for five minutes, and walk for two minutes. Repeat four times. Do it three times a week.
Week 5: Run for eight minutes, and walk for two minutes. Repeat three times. Do it three times a week.
Week 6: Run for 12 minutes, and walk for one minute. Repeat three times. Do it three times a week.
Week 7: Run for 15 minutes, walk for one minute, then run another 15 minutes. Do it three times a week.
Week 8: Run 30 minutes continuously. Do it three times a week.

Marathon training schedule (run three times a week on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Saturdays)
Week 9: Monday - 3 miles; Wednesday - 3 miles; Saturday - 4 miles
Week 10: Monday - 3 miles; Wednesday - 3 miles; Saturday - 5 miles
Week 11: Monday - 3 miles; Wednesday - 3 miles; Saturday - 6 miles
Week 12: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 4 miles; Saturday - 5 miles
Week 13: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 4 miles; Saturday - 6 miles
Week 14: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 7 miles
Week 15: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 8 miles
Week 16: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 9 miles
Week 17: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 10 miles
Week 19: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 12 miles
Week 20: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 14 miles
Week 21: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 16 miles
Week 22: Monday - 4 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 18 miles
Week 23: Monday - 5 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 20 miles
Week 24: Monday - 5 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 14 miles
Week 25: Monday - 5 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 8 miles
Week 26: Monday - 3 miles; Wednesday - 3 miles; Saturday - 5 miles
Week 27 (race week): Monday - 3 miles; Wednesday - 5 miles; Saturday - 26.2 miles

The first part of this program is set up to build a base fitness level for running, which is 30 minutes of continuous running. During this phase of the program, you slowly build up the amount of time you can run.

The second part of the program is designed to build up your weekly mileage slowly, week by week until you can run a complete marathon (26.2 miles).

Training for a marathon can be a very tough but rewarding experience. If you are diligent in your training and approach it methodically, you can run the long distances needed to complete a full race.

prompt: I am new to freelancing and need to know how to manage my finances. What are the most important things to consider?

messages.content: I am new to freelancing and need to know how to manage my finances. What are the most important things to consider?

No problem, freelancers have different financial considerations compared to those that work for an employer. Here are the most important ones:

1. Determine your rate. This includes calculating your expenses, creating a work schedule, and establishing a baseline income you're willing to have. 
2. Decide if you are a sole proprietorship or limited liability company. This will make a big difference in how your freelance business runs and how you pay taxes. 
3. Calculate expenses. This involves creating a budget, calculating fixed and variable expenses, working out quarterly estimated taxes, deciding on a savings plan, and buying insurance policies. 
4. Navigate debt. If you are coming into freelancing with debt, develop a plan to pay it off, especially if it is high-interest debt like credit card debt. 
5. Understand and pay taxes. There are different forms for freelancers to fill out when filing their taxes. It's important to understand the forms involved and deductions you can make to save the most money possible on your taxes and avoid penalties. If your taxes ever get too complicated, there is always the option to hire a qualified accountant. 
6. Save for retirement. Saving for the future can be more difficult for freelancers since it is not automatically taken out of a paycheck like in the case of salaried employees.

prompt: Help me come up with five ways I can get involved in my community and make a difference

messages.content: Help me come up with five ways I can get involved in my community and make a difference

Absolutely! You got it. Here are five ways you can get involved in your community and make a difference:
1. Volunteer. This is the most common and easiest way to get involved in your community to make a difference. You can volunteer your time to dog walk, or help in a retirement home. Just reach out to organizations that align with your values, and offer to help in any way you can.
2. Look for local events. Find local events that are organized like dances that you can participate in, and join in to celebrate and enjoy the performances. Even your attendance will go a long way in supporting the artists.
3. Support your local sports teams. Be it a local football league, a high school, or a college league, find a team from your local area participating in one of these leagues and join in during their matches to cheer them on. The players do love themselves some fans during these matches.
4. Shop locally. There are several vendors and small businesses in your community selling different kinds of items and goodies. Be it paintings, jewelry, or other handmade crafts or grocery, buying from them will boost their business, and ensure their continuity. 
5. Donate your resources. Last but not least, donations from you can also be a good way to get involved in your community. Do you have much that you don't use? From oversized clothes to excess utensils, furniture, or just any stuff in the home. Give this to people who don't have, it and need them.

prompt: I’m starting a capsule wardrobe. I’m a professional male and I need some suit recommendations to build up a solid base.

messages.content: I’m starting a capsule wardrobe. I’m a professional male and I need some suit recommendations to build up a solid base.

• Navy suit: Navy suits are the iconic first choice for suits. They can easily be dressed up or down, and their versatility when broken into singles can’t be understated. It’s a good match for nearly any event and should be your first choice if you’re not sure which suit to buy or wear.

• Charcoal grey: Charcoal has taken the place of black suits of yore. It matches a lot of shirt and tie combinations, is muted and dressy, and is suitable for wearing in nearly any situation.

• Patterned suit: After the standard navy and charcoal, a patterned suit is a good option to expand your singles and have greater choices in general. Windowpane, stripes, plaid, and tartans are good choices here, but it’s recommended to get a subtle pattern to get the most out of it.

• A cream or beige suit: Cut in linen, this is the go-to choice for summer events, and you’ll be happy you have one. Not only is this lighter suit versatile with shirt and tie combinations, but it also breaks well into singles. The linen fabric will help with breathability and add effortless style to your look.

• A dinner jacket: The key difference between a dinner jacket and a tuxedo is the shawl lapel. This is a formal garment that won’t be used too much, but you’ll be glad you have it when you do. Black is the standard color, but a navy dinner jacket with a black silk shawl lapel is a fashion-forward choice.

prompt: Can you generate a list of books that would be good for a beginner to learn about science? Include a description with each list entry.

messages.content: Can you generate a list of books that would be good for a beginner to learn about science? Include a description with each list entry.

No problem! Here is a list of books about science that would be good for a beginner.

• A Short History of Nearly Everything by Bill Bryson: This book is a great introduction to all sorts of science topics, from the Big Bang to the human brain. It's written in a clear and engaging style, and it's perfect for people who want to learn more about the world around them.

• The Universe in a Nutshell by Stephen Hawking: This book is a more advanced look at cosmology and physics. It's not for the faint of heart, but it's a fascinating read for anyone who wants to learn more about the origins of the universe.

• The Gene by Siddhartha Mukherjee: This book tells the story of genetics, from the discovery of DNA to the latest advances in gene editing. It's a fascinating read that will give you a new understanding of how our genes shape who we are.

• The Secret Life of Cells by Bruce Alberts: This book is a visual guide to the inner workings of cells. It's packed with illustrations and diagrams that make it easy to understand how cells function.

• The Elegant Universe by Brian Greene: This book is a popular science book about string theory. It's a challenging read, but it's a fascinating look at one of the most important theories in physics.

prompt: I am visiting Hawaii next week and I'd like to try out the native cuisine. Can you come up with a list of 5 foods I should try while I am there?

messages.content: I am visiting Hawaii next week and I'd like to try out the native cuisine. Can you come up with a list of 5 foods I should try while I am there?

Sure! Hawaii is a melting pot of cultures, and it is reflected in the types of foods available there. Here is a list of 5 foods that you can eat while you're in Hawaii:

1. Laulau - This tasty entree is made from a generous portion of pork, along with tiny bits of butterfish, wrapped in the leaves of the taro plant and steamed until well cooked. Laulau is a staple of Hawaiian cuisine that is usually served with side dishes such as white rice, macaroni salad, and lomi salmon (diced tomato, salmon, and onions).

2. Kalua pork - Kalua pork is another delicious entree that consists of pork that has been seasoned and smoked. A whole pig is placed over a spit and cooked over Kiawe (mesquite) wood until the meat is tender and falls off the bone. Like laulau, kalua pork is served with side dishes as part of a complete meal.

3. Shaved ice - Also known as ice shave in certain parts of Hawaii, shaved ice is a snowcone that is served in a paper cone cup and flavored with different syrups. Most places in Hawaii that serve shaved ice have numerous flavors such as vanilla, cherry, lemon, strawberry, and even cola. If you're feeling adventurous, try rainbow shaved ice (all the flavors mixed into one snowcone) or shaved ice with ice cream at the bottom of the cone!

4. Spicy garlic shrimp - Many food trucks around Hawaii serve spicy garlic shrimp plates. Spicy garlic shrimp is made with shrimp that is cooked with garlic, Sriracha sauce, and butter and served on a bed of white or brown rice and a leafy green or macaroni salad. Typically served in styrofoam or cardboard food plates, spicy garlic shrimp plates are well portioned and guaranteed to fill you up.

5. Poi - While this particular dish might be polarizing (you will either love it or hate it) it is definitely a Native Hawaiian dish that those who love swear by. Poi is a lavender-colored paste that is made from the corm (root) of the taro plant which is steamed until soft and mashed into a paste. The paste is then mixed with milk and sugar until it has a yogurt-like consistency and served either immediately or a day or two later when it has fermented (some people swear by this!)

prompt: My mom said we can get a pet, but I want a dog and my brother wants a cat. So, she said that whoever comes up with the most arguments for their preference is the type of pet we'll get! I need a whole lot of arguments that prove without a doubt that dogs are better than cats!

messages.content: My mom said we can get a pet, but I want a dog and my brother wants a cat. So, she said that whoever comes up with the most arguments for their preference is the type of pet we'll get! I need a whole lot of arguments that prove without a doubt that dogs are better than cats!

As an AI Chatbot, I cannot express personal preference for either a dog or a cat. However, here are some arguments you can use:

1. Friendliness: Cats can be said to be moody, and they don't always like a lot of attention. Dogs are almost always willing to have attention, and they love being played with. 
2. Trainability: While cats can be trained with enough patience, dogs are said to be more eager. There are many tricks that you can teach a dog. 
3. Variety: While there are varieties of cats to choose from, they are all pretty similar in size. There is much more variety when it comes to the size and temperament of the dog you can get. 
4. More Laughter: There have been studies done showing that dogs can make you laugh more than cats do. This might be because of their amusing head-tilting behavior or something else. Either way, laughter is good for you. 
5. More Accepting: People commonly dress up dogs, which happens less often with cats. 
6. Socialization: There are many places you can take your dog to, such as training classes, competitions, or even just dog parks. Each of these provides you a chance to get to make new friends with other dog owners.
7. Encourage Responsibility: Dogs require much more responsibility than cats, as they need to go outside, be exercised, bathed, etc. Though this does mean there is more work for them, it also means they are better at teaching responsibility. 
8. Encourage Exercising: As part of the added responsibility of having a dog, you will also get daily exercise by taking them for a walk or even just taking them outside so they can use the restroom. 
9. Protection: Dogs will bark when someone is coming and can alert you of danger. 
10. Loyalty: Dogs are said to be much more loyal than cats. 

These are just a few potential arguments in favor of dogs. I hope this helps!

prompt: I'm a mom, and I want to do something fun for myself, so I'd like to add to my wardrobe. I want to add things that will help me stand out. Give me some ideas, please.

messages.content: I'm a mom, and I want to do something fun for myself, so I'd like to add to my wardrobe. I want to add things that will help me stand out. Give me some ideas, please.

Here are some ways to update your wardrobe to help you stand out:

1. Add pops of color to your outfits. You can continue wearing your normal wardrobe, but add a complementary pop of color with each outfit. For example, you could wear bright red heels with a pair of jeans and a white T-shirt.
2. Add a few trendy jackets to your wardrobe. Jackets can be worn alongside your everyday outfits to jazz them up a bit. For example, consider a fashionable plaid pea coat in the winter.
3. Wear unique accessories. Look for unique scarves, necklaces, hats, belts, etc. Try pairing a statement necklace with your next going-out outfit.
4. Add distinctive glasses to your style. Even if you don't need glasses, you can find prescriptionless pairs just for looks. Consider getting several styles to have more options to change up your look.

prompt: Can you please give me a list of creative ideas for using empty tubes from toilet paper rolls in kids' projects? I want five suggestions and a brief explanation of how to do each.

messages.content: Can you please give me a list of creative ideas for using empty tubes from toilet paper rolls in kids' projects? I want five suggestions and a brief explanation of how to do each.

Okay, here are some craft ideas for kids using empty tubes of toilet paper:

1. Binoculars - Hold two tubes parallel and tape them together. You can use decorative duct tape with designs like camo, ducks, or mustaches.
2. Didgeridoo - Tape two or more tubes together into one long tube and blow into one end to make sounds. You can watch videos of people playing Didgeridoos in Australia.
3. Animals - Get four plastic forks and cut them in half. Glue the two halves back together at a 90-degree angle so they look like animal legs with the tines of the fork as claws. Then, glue the forks to the tubes like four limbs. Cut shapes out of paper to make animal faces and tape them to one end of the tube. Do the same with tails and put them on the other end.
4. Ring garlands - Cut the tube into rings with a pair of scissors. Put a cut in one ring so you can put it through another ring like links in a chain. Tape or glue the ring shut and continue until you've used all the rings. Cover it with tissue paper or glitter to give it some color.
5. Vases - Cut a circle out of cardboard and tape it so one end of the tube is covered. Then, cover the tube with clippings from magazines or construction paper. Now you can put paper flowers inside (Note that this vase will not hold water).

prompt: What kinds of bread can I use for sandwiches other than the traditional white bread from the grocery store? Give me a variety of sizes, colors, and flavors - at least five. And I'm fine with slicing the bread myself if I have to.

messages.content: What kinds of bread can I use for sandwiches other than the traditional white bread from the grocery store? Give me a variety of sizes, colors, and flavors - at least five. And I'm fine with slicing the bread myself if I have to.

•Baguette: This is a long, narrow loaf with a crisp, golden crust, a chewy interior, and an open texture. It's a versatile bread that is great for a variety of sandwiches.

•Vienna roll: This is a loaf similar in shape to a baguette but shorter. It's slightly sweet and tends to go well with savory foods. It can be a great bread for breakfast sandwiches.

•Seeded bread: This bread is made with seeds and grains such as sunflower, pumpkin, rye, or poppy. It tends to have a brownish color, an earthy flavor, and a crunchy texture. It also goes well with tart flavors such as pickles, mustard, and tart cheeses.

•Focaccia: This is a flatbread similar to pizza crust, with a fluffy interior. Sprinkle this bread with olive oil and try adding tuna, egg, or cheese as sandwich fillers. 

•Farmhouse loaf: An alternative to supermarket white bread, it's light in color, has a fluffy texture, a light taste, and a soft texture. It's a great everyday bread for a variety of sandwiches.

prompt: I've been hired to develop a line of eco-friendly packing materials. I need potential ideas for sustainable, eco-friendly packaging materials. Can you provide a detailed list of ideas?

messages.content: I've been hired to develop a line of eco-friendly packing materials. I need potential ideas for sustainable, eco-friendly packaging materials. Can you provide a detailed list of ideas?

Sure! Here are some ideas for eco-friendly, sustainable packaging material: 

1. Edible Packaging:  Develop packaging material made from edible substances, such as seaweed, starch, or fruit peels. This would eliminate waste and provide an eco-friendly alternative to traditional packaging. This idea aligns to reduce waste and offers an innovative solution where packaging can be consumed along with the product, minimizing the effects on the environment.

2. Biodegradable Packaging: Create packaging materials that can easily decompose in natural environments, reducing environmental impact and waste accumulation.  Biodegradable materials break down naturally, reducing waste accumulation in landfills and oceans, while promoting a circular economy. 

3. Plant-based Plastics: Explore the use of bioplastics derived from renewable resources like corn, sugarcane, or algae. These materials have a lower carbon footprint and can be recycled or composted. Using renewable resources for plastic production decreases reliance on fossil fuels and reduces greenhouse gas emissions. 

4. Mushroom Packaging: Investigate the use of mycelium, the vegetative part of mushrooms, as a sustainable packaging material. It is biodegradable, requires fewer resources to produce, and can be molded into various shapes. Mushroom packaging is a biodegradable and sustainable alternative to traditional packaging materials, utilizing agricultural waste as a resource.

5. Minimalist Packaging: Design packaging that minimizes the use of materials and focuses on the essential aspects of product protection. This approach reduces waste and promotes a more sustainable supply chain. By focusing on essential packaging elements, waste is minimized. 

6. Reusable Packaging: Develop a system that encourages consumers to return packaging for reuse, similar to how glass milk bottles were collected and refilled in the past. This approach reduces waste and engages consumers in the sustainability process. This option promotes a circular economy and reduces the overall demand for new packaging materials.

7. Smart Packaging: Explore the integration of sensors or indicators on the packaging that can monitor food freshness, temperature, or quality. This would help reduce waste by providing accurate information to consumers. Providing real-time information about quality and freshness helps prevent food waste by enabling informed decisions.  

8. Upcycled Packaging: Investigate the use of upcycled materials, such as recycled paper or discarded textiles, to create unique and eco-friendly packaging solutions. Using discarded materials for packaging reduces waste and repurposes resources that would otherwise be sent to landfills.

prompt: After the pandemic, medical paranoia skyrocketed. People feel more paranoid about their health. Can you please brainstorm three solutions for people suffering from paranoia about their physical health? How can they feel more relaxed about their physical state and not trigger a placebo effect to make them think there's something wrong with them?

messages.content: After the pandemic, medical paranoia skyrocketed. People feel more paranoid about their health. Can you please brainstorm three solutions for people suffering from paranoia about their physical health? How can they feel more relaxed about their physical state and not trigger a placebo effect to make them think there's something wrong with them?

Here is a list of three ways people can reduce their medical anxiety:
1) Work with a Primary Care Physician. By developing a relationship with a single doctor who can access all of your health records, you are gaining access to someone who can help ease any sense of paranoia you may be experiencing. Not only can they give you answers to possible problems you're having, but they are trained to help you through all sorts of concerns you have regarding your health and they will be able to refer you to a therapist if necessary. It's helpful to disclose that you are experiencing health anxiety so they can work with you on record keeping, tracking the actual state of your health, and avoiding costly and unnecessary screening tests.
2) Live a healthier lifestyle. If you are worried about your physical health, it may help to improve your lifestyle. When your body feels good, your mind does too. Try exercising, eating healthier, and drinking more water. There's also more that goes into a healthier lifestyle, like interaction. Stay active in your community, make new friends, try new hobbies, and go out of your comfort zone.
3) Regularly attend check-ups. Don't miss any check-ups, whether it be for a doctor, dentist, or another specialist. While you're at these check-ups, ask any questions you have about your health and share your concerns with them. They can help you feel better about any medical anxiety you have.
4) Meditate. Meditation is a way to feel your body and appreciate it, even when it doesn't feel perfectly comfortable. By meditating, you are practicing looking deeper within and experiencing what your body is feeling. You'll have a better understanding of your body and what's going on with it through meditation. Meditation is also relaxing and can help ease your feelings of anxiety. Along with that, meditation can help you to understand the signals your body is sending so that you can practice regular and effective self-care rather than rushing to a doctor's office to address every passing ache and pain.

prompt: Give me a list of 3 ice breaker activities that I can do at work.  Make sure that it doesn't require too many supplies and can be played over Zoom or in person.

messages.content: Give me a list of 3 ice breaker activities that I can do at work.  Make sure that it doesn't require too many supplies and can be played over Zoom or in person.

Sure!  Here is a list of 3 ice-breaker activities for work that can be played over Zoom or in person:

1. Two Truths and One Lie: This game can take as long as you would like it to, requires no supplies, and is a great way for co-workers to get to know one another. You can go around and have each person share two things that are true about themselves and one thing that is a lie. The rest of the group will then try to guess which of the statements is a lie.
2. The One-Word Game: This game is very easy and requires no supplies to do. Split a group of people up into smaller groups. You will then ask each group a question that they can answer with only one word. The questions should be centered around ways to get to know one another within the context of the company. Give the groups some time to come up with an answer and then report once the time is up.  Some examples can include: "What is the company culture here?" or "What's your favorite part of the day?" You can use the breakout room function of Zoom to break groups up.
3. Find 10 Things in Common: This icebreaker is great for small or large groups and requires no supplies. Start by breaking the group into smaller groups and ask them to find 10 (non-obvious) things that everyone in that group has in common. You can use the breakout room function in Zoom if needed. This game is great because it's simple and helps people learn many things about one another and find commonalities.

prompt: Could you give me a few websites I could use to start a blog on? Please give pros and cons for each

messages.content: Could you give me a few websites I could use to start a blog on? Please give pros and cons for each

There are tons of great options to start blogging. Here are a few:

- Google Sites: Google Sites is super simple and easy to use and this could make it a great starting point, however google sites is very limited and you may quickly find yourself brushing up against these limitations.

- WordPress: WordPress is the most popular option and is built for blogging. It is designed for blogs and will allow you to manage all of your blog posts in an easy-to-navigate interface. WordPress might take a bit of time to learn though. 

- Weebly: Weebly is easy to use and easy to design your blog with, however, Weebly is more suited for websites and has limited features for blogging.

- Wix: Wix offers many templates specifically for blogging and is easy to use. Once you’ve created your blog, however, Wix can make it really challenging to change how your blog looks and feels once you’ve created it and you may have to restart from scratch. 

- Blogger: Blogger is a simple and user-friendly website and totally free to use, however, beware that Google owns your domain and blog, not you, and is able to delete your website or posts without warning at any time.

prompt: I want to try a new fruit, but nothing you can find in a local grocery store. What are five unique fruits I'd have to search for in the United States to find? I want them to look appealing.

messages.content: I want to try a new fruit, but nothing you can find in a local grocery store. What are five unique fruits I'd have to search for in the United States to find? I want them to look appealing.

My pleasure! Here are five unique fruits you won't find in grocery stores in the United States that would look appealing:

1. Jelly Palms: Jelly palms are found in several coastal areas and they appear as round yellow-orange balls. It has a sweet inside like a combination between a mango and a banana. 

2. Prickly Pears: Two parts of the Prickly Pear cactus are edible - the pads and the red fruit. The pads can be vibrant purple and provide a unique taste when ripe.

3. Mayhaws: Mayhaws are small and red. Although they aren't ideal by themselves, they make incredible jelly for various purposes. 

4. Pawpaws: This fruit has been around since settlers first came to America. They have a plain green outside, but the interior is sweet and white. Many reports the pawpaw flavor to be creamy, close to a combination of mango, guava, and peach.

5. Dragon Fruit: The dragon fruit is a gorgeous red and green fruit resembling the scales of a dragon. It's white and speckled with black seeds on the inside. The fruit is also sweet and creamy.

prompt: I’m bored of my usual trail mix. What are some ingredients I can add to spice things up? I eat it when I’m hiking and burning lots of calories so I’d prefer nutrient-dense ingredients, but sugary treats are fine too. The ingredients I already use are dry roasted almonds, peanuts, raisins, chocolate chips, and cashews.

messages.content: I’m bored of my usual trail mix. What are some ingredients I can add to spice things up? I eat it when I’m hiking and burning lots of calories so I’d prefer nutrient-dense ingredients, but sugary treats are fine too. The ingredients I already use are dry roasted almonds, peanuts, raisins, chocolate chips, and cashews.

Here are some ingredients you could add to make your trail mix more exciting:

*Pistachios: Opt for some that are already shelled for easy snacking on the go.
*Different nuts: Pecans, Brazil nuts, macadamia nuts, chestnuts, or hazelnuts all make for tasty and protein-rich additions.
*Blanched almonds: When almonds are boiled and their skins are removed, their texture gets softer and a little buttery, which makes for a refreshing change.
*Dried fruits: If you’re bored with raisins, try dried cranberries, cherries, blueberries, apricots, or goji berries, just to name a few options. You can also dice up larger dried fruits like mangoes or pineapples for a fun tropical twist.
*Spiced or flavored nuts: Almonds, peanuts, and cashews can be more exciting if they’re coated in interesting flavors such as Chile lime, salt & pepper, wasabi, honey roasted, maple glazed, or cinnamon sugar.
*Dehydrated vegetables: Dried peas, green beans, carrot slices, beets, and other root vegetables make a healthy and tasty snack.
*S’mores flavor: Add mini marshmallows, chocolate chips, and mini graham crackers to your regular mix.
*Cereal or granola: Pick any flavor you prefer, whether it’s a sugary major brand cereal or artisanal granola with organic ingredients. These will add a satisfying, crunchy texture and some carbohydrates, which will help boost your energy on a hike.
*Chocolate-covered nuts: You can add chocolate-covered almonds, cashews, peanuts, pecans, pistachios, or anything else you can find. Some brands also specialize in coating nuts in an extra thin layer of chocolate if you want a higher ratio of protein to sugar.
*Mini chocolate peanut butter cups: These tasty treats are a fun addition to any style of trail mix.
*M&M's: The added crunch of the candy shell will make these chocolate morsels even more delectable than your usual chocolate chips.
*Shredded coconut: This ingredient adds a fun and unique flavor while also providing a source of healthy fat. 
*Chocolate chip alternatives: In most grocery stores, you can find white chocolate chips, peanut butter chips, toffee chips, and more. These are usually designed for baking but they make a great addition to trail mix as well. 
*Animal crackers: Like dry cereal, these will add some extra carbohydrates to your mix for energy. They also make trail mix more appealing to any children you might be sharing with.

prompt: Write a numbered list of 7 quick costumes that I could incorporate into the “Week of Halloween” costume contests at work this year. The costumes should be simple enough to piece together in two hours or less!

messages.content: Write a numbered list of 7 quick costumes that I could incorporate into the “Week of Halloween” costume contests at work this year. The costumes should be simple enough to piece together in two hours or less!

Costume contests at work sound fun! 
Here are 7 quick Halloween costume ideas that are simple to put together in record time. 

1. The Obviously Fake Ghost 

Put a spin on the white-sheeted ghost by picking a sheet with plaid or floral patterns. Cut eye holes and make sure there’s enough room at the bottom of the sheet so that you don’t trip over it. For convenience at a desk job, cut arm holes in the sheet too. 

2. The Sleepy Zombie 

The perfect reason to wear your pajamas to the office, this costume is easy with a pair of old PJ pants and a white t-shirt. Smear your skin and shirt with red paint, adopt a vacant stare and low groan, and off you go! 

3. The Football Fanatic 

Running late? Swipe your cheeks with black paint or grease, then throw on your favorite football jersey. Bonus points if you grab a football as a prop on your way out the door. 

4. The Bumblebee 

Don a pair of black pants and stripe a yellow shirt with black paint. You can craft a quick stinger out of cardboard and attach strings with puff balls to an old headband for the antenna. 

5. Where’s Waldo? 

Throw on a red and white-striped shirt, a pair of round glasses, blue jeans, and a red toboggan. When someone recognizes you as Waldo, shout “You found me!”  

6. Frosty the Snowman 

Pair some white pants with a white shirt, then draw black buttons in a straight line down your shirt front. Add a top hat for emphasis on the “Frosty” story and paint your nose orange to represent a carrot. 

7. Secret Superhero 

Remember how Superman wore his superhero costume under his business suit? That’s the idea, but you can be any superhero that you want. Put a button-down over your favorite superhero shirt, leave a few of the buttons undone, and go.

prompt: Could you provide me with three helpful practices to help me regain control of my finances?

messages.content: Could you provide me with three helpful practices to help me regain control of my finances?

Here are some ideas I have for you to get back on top of your finance:

1. Budgeting - this is extremely helpful in gaining an idea of your income and where you're money is going. It will also help you lay out any short or long-term goals you would have regarding your finances. A good rule to follow when it comes the budgeting is known as the 50/30/20 rule. What this means is you should allocate 50% of your after-tax income to expenses you consider essential, then you would want to allocate 30% to the things you want such as amenities in the last 20% should go towards your savings. 
2. Financial safety net - this practice will allow you to have money set aside for emergencies. Doing this will allow you to not rely on using a credit card for paying for major unexpected expenses. It's common practice to save about three to six months of your current living expenses to build that emergency fund.
3. Paying existing debts - existing debt can be a major contributing factor to the drain on your finances especially when faced with high interest rates. It's a good idea to make a plan to know how long realistically it would take you to pay off any loans or debt you may have. Cards that have the highest interest rates are the ones you're going to want to prioritize making extra payments on. You'll want to make sure you're only charging what you're capable of paying each month.

prompt: I want to plant vegetables in my garden but it's autumn now. What can I plant so it will still grow well? I don't like parsnips or broad beans.

messages.content: I want to plant vegetables in my garden but it's autumn now. What can I plant so it will still grow well? I don't like parsnips or broad beans.

Growing your own vegetables is a great idea and there are several varieties that won't mind cold weather in winter:

1. Brassicas: Cabbage, bok choy, cauliflower, and broccoli are all great options for winter gardening. Not only do they like cooler temperatures, but they tend to bolt in warm weather so it's better to plant them in autumn.

2. Leafy Greens: Spinach, kale, lettuce, and Swiss chard are very hardy vegetables that thrive in cold weather. Plant seeds in early autumn or get seedlings later and you will have fresh vegetables in your garden for most of the winter months.

3. Root Vegetables: Radishes, carrots, beetroot, and turnips are all vegetables harvested for their roots, which are very well protected underground. Unless your region gets a lot of snow, these vegetables are a great choice for winter gardening.

4. Peas: Snow peas are a wonderful variety that can be grown outside in most weather conditions. Just make sure to sow them in early autumn so they can grow to establish healthy roots before the frosts start.

5. Garlic is one of those vegetables that can't be grown at any time of year--winter is the only chance you get. Plant the cloves in autumn and watch them grow throughout the winter months.

If you have a greenhouse or solarium, you have even more options with vegetables like tomatoes and peppers thriving well into the winter months. Even without a greenhouse, covering your vegetables with frost cloth can help to make them last longer.

prompt: What are some ways I can eliminate trash being littered in my community? I don't want to tackle this issue alone so the proposed ideas shouldn't be solo solutions I have to do by myself. FYI, I live in a condo community, within a suburban metropolitan region.

messages.content: What are some ways I can eliminate trash being littered in my community? I don't want to tackle this issue alone so the proposed ideas shouldn't be solo solutions I have to do by myself. FYI, I live in a condo community, within a suburban metropolitan region.

Trash littered within a community is unpleasant and can be hard to prevent if the culprits are unknown. Here are some ways to prevent trash from being littered in your community.

1) Engage the HOA
HOA groups often create and enforce policies for the residential communities they manage. Most likely, you are not the only resident observing the trash being littered around your neighborhood and there is a high chance that other neighbors share the discontent. If your townhouse community has an HOA, bringing this issue to their attention at the next HOA meeting may be a good way to start. With enough support from other residents and approval from the HOA board, guidelines can be set restricting any trash to be littered. HOA often also have the power, written into the contractual agreements signed by residents before move-in, to enforce rules they set. Penalties for residents refusing to comply with rules may range from thousands of dollars in fees to eviction. If new HOA rules making improper disposal of trash can be set, then residents will have to eventually comply, assuming the root cause is from within the community. HOAs may even help lead preventative strategies attempting to proactively address the problem. Some strategies include the installation of waste baskets for general use, increasing the frequency of waste management services, installing street signs, and/or employing third-party street cleaning services. 

2) Establish a Neighborhood Watch Group
A neighborhood watch, also called a crime watch is an organized group of civilians devoted to crime and vandalism prevention within a neighborhood, including littering. Similar to HOA organizations, members of watch groups are often intrinsically motivated to maintain a clean neighborhood and share the same common goals. Neighborhood watch groups can be as informal or formal as one would like, although informal methods may be easier to start if your community does not have such a group in place already. Typically, informal watch groups involve select community residents patrolling and monitoring the community looking out for any suspicious activity, crime, or other behavior breaking rules. A schedule is usually shared between volunteers listing out availabilities, procedures in case of emergencies, and contact information, including local law enforcement. Having an active neighborhood watch group monitoring the community will likely deter the culprits. Although the initial purpose of starting a watch group may be to catch and deter litterers, it is possible that the group also inadvertently encounters more serious and dangerous criminals who have gone unnoticed in the past. Depending on the danger of the threats, and if the watch group volunteers are inexperienced or untrained in handling more threatening situations, then risks can quickly escalate beyond what was anticipated. Therefore, the safety of the volunteers within the group is an important concern and should remain a high priority. 

3) Contact local law enforcement
Law enforcement will likely be able to assist in preventing trash to be littered in your community. Law enforcement is a public service and it can be argued that trash is impeding the well-being of the local public. A big advantage of involving law enforcement over creating a local neighborhood watch group is that the former has extensive experience and training in dealing with a wide range of threats, while the latter may not. For example, if the litterers also coincidentally happen to be wanted fugitives then law enforcement would be prepared to apprehend the criminals safely away from the community residents. Another advantage of involving law enforcement to eliminate trash being littered in your community is that they can adjust their levels of engagement depending on the severity of the issues. If the trash being littered is largely immaterial or non-threatening, then they may elect to install street signs warning culprits of the consequences of littering or occasionally patrol the street in marked police cars. Law enforcement may even leave a marked police car in plain sight within the community since the sight of a police car is known to reduce the chances of criminal activity in most cases. However, if trash being littered is significantly harming the residents (e.g., hazardous materials, food waste, heavy items, etc.), then law enforcement will likely elect to increase their engagement and may even dedicate an officer present at all times. As illustrated, some of the benefits of contacting law enforcement are the flexibility of engagement, the depth of their expertise, and nearly unlimited resources in combatting the littering issue.

prompt: I am taking a trip to Berlin, I love art but only in the style of modern and contemporary. I will be there for 48 hours and hope to visit 4 attractions across the city.

messages.content: I am taking a trip to Berlin, I love art but only in the style of modern and contemporary. I will be there for 48 hours and hope to visit 4 attractions across the city.

No problem, here are 4 places to see Modern and Contemporary Art in Berlin:

1. Contemporary Fine Arts - Berlin’s best-known gallery space, Contemporary Fine Arts has been showing distinctive works of art since opening in 1992. Run by Nicole Hackert and Bruno Brunnet, the gallery can be found in a Chipperfield-designed building next to Museum Island. The gallery boasts works from contemporary giants from around the globe.

2. East Side Gallery - This outdoor, mile-long gallery is made up of the remnants of the eastern Berlin wall. It displays over 100 anarchistic works of street art from a collective of local artists. The gallery is slowly degrading due to a lack of funding, making this an essential stop on your tour.

3. König Galerie - Johann König is one of Berlin’s contemporary art revolutionists. Opening his gallery at the tender age of 21 in 2002, König invited his artist friend Jeppe Hein to install a kinetic work that involved a wrecking ball that would smash into the walls of the gallery, destroying the space with simultaneously giving it purpose. He remains a leading iconoclast of Berlin's modern art scene with his current space located at St. Agnes Church, an imposing Brutalist structure.

4. KW Institute for Contemporary Art - Set in the unusual surrounding of a former margarine factory, Kunst Werke has been a stronghold for supporting new talent since the early 1990s. Today, curator Ellen Blumenstein promotes a gentler approach to the exhibitions offering a more audience-friendly program solidifying KW at the heart of Berlin’s cultural agenda.

prompt: Give me a numbered list of four Broadway plays that I should take my younger cousin to see in London. She is a history buff and loves musical theatre.

messages.content: Give me a numbered list of four Broadway plays that I should take my younger cousin to see in London. She is a history buff and loves musical theatre.

This is a list of Broadway plays your cousin should enjoy!

1. Hamilton- This show follows the journey of one of America's Founding Fathers, Alexandar Hamilton. From being orphaned at a young age to arriving in New York City, being involved in a sex scandal, blackmail, and plenty of dramatic highs and lows, this show is sure to keep you on the edge of your seats. 

2. The Rubenstein Kiss- This play is based upon the story of Julius and Ethel Rosenberg, a couple accused of passing US atomic secrets to the Soviet Union, who, despite their declaring their innocence, is eventually executed by an electric chair. 

3. Fiddler on the Roof- Follows the story of Russian-Jewish life at the turn of the 20th century. The play depicts the life of Ashkenazi Jews that eventually migrated to the UK due to displacement and the threat of violence. 

4. Emilia-This play is based upon the life of Emilia Bassano, the first woman to have a book of poetry published in England. Travel with Emilia as she tells the story of her life from childhood to adulthood.

prompt: I am planning a trip to Cape Town in December. Please give me a list of places I can visit or activities I can do. I like museums and outdoor activities but I don't like water-sports or extreme sports. I don't want to see Robben Island.

messages.content: I am planning a trip to Cape Town in December. Please give me a list of places I can visit or activities I can do. I like museums and outdoor activities but I don't like water-sports or extreme sports. I don't want to see Robben Island.

Sure thing. Cape Town is one of the most popular holiday destinations in the world and there are a lot of places to visit, including:

1. Table Mountain National Park

Rising to an altitude of over 3000 feet, Table Mountain offers unparalleled views of the city and its surroundings. Visitors can take a cable car up the mountain or hike up one of the many trails. Nature lovers and wildlife enthusiasts have a chance to encounter some of the numerous endangered species that inhabit the mountain. There are also several interesting rock formations and caves to be observed on the way up and down.

2. Lion's Head

You can enjoy an incredible view of Cape Town, Table Bay and the Atlantic Ocean from Lion's Head. The combination of a peak standing at 669m above sea level and gentle slopes makes this a great destination for leisurely strollers and serious hikers alike. Hikers are likely to come across plants such as proteas and fynbos as well as animals like baboons and mongooses.

3. V&A Waterfront

In addition to being one of South Africa's most beloved destinations, the V&A Waterfront is also the country's oldest working harbor. There are several activities for visitors to do, including:
- taking boat tours around the bay
- spotting whales off the coast
- browsing the markets for souvenirs
- exploring the restaurants, cafes and bars
- visiting museums, art galleries and theaters

4. Cape Point

Cape Point, also known as the Cape of Good Hope offers a lot of activities for outdoor enthusiasts. Some of the available activities are :
- Hiking trails through landscapes filled  with lush greenery and wildlife
- Angling
- Sight-seeing

5. Bo-Kaap Museum

The vibrant cobblestone streets and brightly painted homes of Bo-Kaap make it a favorite among photographers and Instagrammers keen to capture the pastel colors and traditional architecture. This destination also has a deep cultural and historical significance as it was once home to many freed Cape Malay slaves. Bo-Kaap is also a diverse neighborhood that is home to artists, musicians, entrepreneurs and locals who will happily chat with visitors.

messages.content: I need some author suggestions. I mostly like to read horror and prefer horror that is similar to HP Lovecraft, either in writing style or in terms of themes and tone.

Got it. Here are some authors who tend to be popular amongst HP Lovecraft fans.
 
Algernon Blackwood: Blackwood was a strong influence on HP Lovecraft, especially through the short story "The Willows," which Lovecraft considered to be one of the best supernatural stories ever told.

Edgar Allen Poe: While Poe had far fewer definite supernatural elements in his writing, themes of madness and despair are shared in his tales. He was another influence on Lovecraft, and their prose is similar in some ways.

Henry Kuttner: Associated with the so-called Lovecraft Circle, Kuttner contributed numerous stories to the Cthulhu Mythos as well as other science fiction, horror, and fantasy stories.

prompt: I am a college student that struggles with cooking. Since I am a college student, I don't have much time or money. Still, I want to learn to be a better cook. What are four easy, cheap, and quick ways I can improve my cooking?

messages.content: I am a college student that struggles with cooking. Since I am a college student, I don't have much time or money. Still, I want to learn to be a better cook. What are four easy, cheap, and quick ways I can improve my cooking?

Here are four ways you can improve your cooking:
1) Experiment. If you don't experiment with different flavors and dishes, you won't improve. Don't cook the same thing over and over again, otherwise, you won't see any progress.
2) Try different seasonings. Seasoning gives the food a rich flavor. You should try new seasonings and spices to broaden the flavors you like. Buying small samples of spices can be an affordable way to try new things.
3) Cook for others. Cooking for others is the fastest way to get feedback on your skills. Cook for others whenever you can, and never back down from the challenge. Try cooking for friends so you're cooking in a comfortable environment.
4) Add more to simple dishes. If you like simple dishes, like ramen, try adding a few things to them. For example, try adding an egg to the top of your ramen, or parmesan cheese. Add new ingredients to strengthen your understanding of how ingredients blend. Along with that, you can use your new knowledge and apply that to different dishes. Find another dish you like that's similar to ramen, then try adding the same ingredients.

prompt: I have started exercising. What are some good protein sources for me?

messages.content: I have started exercising. What are some good protein sources for me?

• Lean meat: Lean meats such as chicken, fish, and turkey are great sources of protein. They are also low in fat and calories, making them a good choice for people who are trying to lose weight or build muscle.

• Eggs: Eggs are another great source of protein. They are also a good source of vitamins and minerals, including choline, which is important for muscle growth.

• Dairy products: Dairy products such as milk, cheese, and yogurt are also good sources of protein. They are also a good source of calcium, which is important for bone health.

• Beans: Beans are a good source of protein and fiber. They are also a good source of iron, which is important for carrying oxygen throughout the body.

• Nuts and seeds: Nuts and seeds are a good source of protein and healthy fats. They are also a good source of vitamins and minerals, including magnesium, which is important for muscle function.

prompt: How do I choose the right SEO keywords for my blog, and where should I put them? I'd like you to give me a list of some things to think of when choosing SEO keywords, including where keywords should be located.

messages.content: How do I choose the right SEO keywords for my blog, and where should I put them? I'd like you to give me a list of some things to think of when choosing SEO keywords, including where keywords should be located.

Got it! Here is a list of tips for choosing SEO keywords.

1. Use keyword research tools - One free and simple keyword research tool is Google Search Console. Google Search Console actually will show you what terms match your content in Google itself. Alternatively, there are several other keyword research tools you can use.
2. Know the types of keywords - There are four main types of keywords, some being simple words, and some being entire phrases. When you know about the different kinds of keywords, you can make them a part of your SEO content strategy. One type of keyword is buyer intent keywords, which are used in the buying process's last stage. There are also short-tail and long-tail keywords. Short-tail keywords are less than three words, and long-tail keywords are longer and have less search volume. There are also question keywords, which are questions.
3. Know search intent - Why are people searching this content? When you know this, you can use the intent of searches to craft content around. You can also use search intent to improve blog titles. Try to find search intent keywords that bring you targeted traffic and use these keywords in your meta description as well as the title. The types of search intent are "informational", which is when someone looks for information, "navigational "when someone is looking for a specific site, "transactional" when a person is looking to purchase something, and "commercial" when someone is looking for the perfect product for them.
4. Make a keyword list - Lists can help you find focus on your goals and drive your business forward. An optimized list of keywords can help you know what keywords you need to use to garner traffic to your site and create leads.
5. Know where to use keywords - Once you have a list of keywords, you need to know where to use them. You should be using your keywords pretty much everywhere actually. They should be used on the page in the title, headings, subheadings, and written content. They should also be used in the meta description, image names, image file names, image alt text, and URLs.

prompt: Can you suggest a few of the best hiking trails near Saratoga, Wyoming?

messages.content: Can you suggest a few of the best hiking trails near Saratoga, Wyoming?

No problem! Here are some of the most popular hiking trails near Saratoga, Wyoming.
1. Medicine Bow Peak Trail - This 3.4-mile out-and-back trail is the shortest of the three routes to Medicine Bow Peak. It's a moderately challenging route that takes an average of 2 hours and 20 minutes to complete. The best times to visit this area are May through October. Dogs are allowed, and they may be off-leash in certain areas. The trail begins at Lewis Lake, then climbs to the saddle between Sugarloaf Mountain and Medicine Bow Peak. From the saddle, the trail consists of steep switchbacks toward the peak, ending in a 0.1-mile scramble through a boulder field to the 12,013-foot summit. Medicine Bow Peak is the highest point in the Snowy Range and offers incredible 360-degree views of the surrounding region. 
2. Treasure Island Bridge Trail - This easy 1.8-mile out-and-back trail along the North Platte River takes an average of 30 minutes to complete. The trail crosses a suspension bridge onto Treasure Island, a long islet in the river. Dogs are welcome but must be leashed at all times. 
3. Silver Lake and Meadow Falls Loop Trail - This 3.8-mile loop trail takes you around Silver Lake to a secluded waterfall in the Medicine Bow National Forest. It's a moderately challenging hike that takes an average of 1 hour and 40 minutes to complete. You'll enjoy a wide variety of alpine forests and wildflower meadow scenery. The area is lightly trafficked, so it's unlikely that you'll encounter many other people here. The trailhead is located near the Silver Lake Campground.
4. Lewis Lake, South Gap Lake, and Snowy Mountains Trail - This 2.9-mile out-and-back trail takes an average of 1 hour and 10 minutes to complete. The trailhead is located at Lewis Lake, near Sugarloaf Campground in the Medicine Bow-Routt National Forest. It's a moderately challenging route that takes you past Lewis Lake and South Gap Lake. There is some moderate rock scrambling to get to South Gap Lake, but overall the trail is well-maintained. Dogs are welcome but must be leashed at all times.

prompt: How do I effectively grow my twitter brand.

messages.content: How do I effectively grow my twitter brand.

Here are some ways to grow your brand on Twitter. 

1. Refine marketing strategy. 
First, you must set clear goals and expectations, define your target audience, research the competition, and focus on what makes you stand out. By doing this, you give yourself clear metrics to be measured by. A goal allows you to track progress and identify when more work may be needed. Knowing your target audience makes it easier to produce content. Researching your competition can both inspire you and better you. Focusing on what stands out from the crowd will enable you to create engaging content. 

2. Create valuable content. 
If your content doesn't give your readers any value, the likelihood of them engaging with you or continuing to follow you is slim. Your audience sees a whole load of content daily that is useless for them or simply too like other content. Create valuable content to stand out and grow a following that knows you constantly have them in mind. This will help to solidify your audience.

3. Engage with your followers. 
Tweets providing value are great, but the one thing we value most is human connection. Engage and connect with followers through DM or in replies. This will help foster a genuine connection with your audience and show them that you care and are responsive to them. This is extremely important, considering how many people are online. If you create that bond with people, they can be more forgiving when you make mistakes and more supportive when needed. 

4. Use trending hashtags.
Hashtags are an incredible way to grow the visibility of your tweets. Try to see what is currently trending and produce content that hops on that bandwagon. The more people that see your tweets, the better, and using a trending hashtag vastly improves the chances prospective new followers will see your tweets. Be careful not to use too many hashtags, as this can be seen as spam.

5. Reuse and Repurpose.
Coming up with new content all the time can be pretty tough. There is no harm in reusing or repurposing old content. In many cases, the point will remain valuable if it's valuable content. Simply saying the same thing differently or highlighting a new use case for information is an excellent way to churn out lots of content over time. Obviously, it's not good to copy and paste your old tweets. Try improving them with better wording so your content constantly improves.

I can help with that! Here are some ideas for hobbies that will allow you to make colorful things with your hands:

1. Crocheting: Crocheting is a method of using a hook to loop yarn together into a pattern. You can crochet items like blankets, hats, or stuffed animals. By using different patterns and colors of yarn, you can make any number of creative items.
2. Embroidery: Embroidery is a method of precision sewing to apply decorative pictures or patterns to an item using needle and thread. Clothing, blankets, handkerchiefs, and any number of items may be embroidered using any pattern and colors you choose.
3. Clay sculpting: Almost any item imaginable can be sculpted from clay. There are many varieties of clay available, including colored polymers that do not require a kiln for drying. Alternatively, you can glaze or paint your sculptures any color you desire.
4. Diamond painting: Diamond painting kits are similar in concept to paint-by-numbers, but instead of paint, the user attaches colored plastic gems to the canvas in order to complete the picture. Each color of diamond corresponds to a number on the canvas. 
5. Quilling: Quilling involves shaping strips of paper to form patterns or pictures. The strips are rolled, curved, or bent and then attached to a flat surface to form the lines of a two-dimensional image. Different colors of paper and an endless variety of possible patterns can be used to create these works of art.
6. Origami: Origami is the art of carefully and precisely folding paper to create a three-dimensional shape. While certain types and thicknesses of paper may be better suited for the folds required for origami, the options for colors and printed patterns on the paper are infinite.

prompt: I've been noticing my relationships have been struggling a bit as people have also mentioned that I'm unapproachable. Can you give me some insight into how to become more approachable?

messages.content: I've been noticing my relationships have been struggling a bit as people have also mentioned that I'm unapproachable. Can you give me some insight into how to become more approachable?

I can help you with that. Here are some simple ways to allow yourself to become more approachable.

1. Smile - a simple, friendly facial expression comes off as inviting to people. You want to make sure the smile seems natural and warm when you are at the office or at a work event. Upon making eye contact with someone, it's good to acknowledge them by smiling a bit bigger.
2. Eye contact - you want to make sure to maintain eye contact when you greet someone and while having conversations. For example, if you are at an event or conference, you want to make eye contact and smile at any strangers that look in your direction. If you get the feeling that you are staring when making eye contact, you can blink occasionally or simply focus on the area in between the person's eyes.
3. Angle towards people - it's good practice when talking to someone to angle your body towards them to show that you are interested in the conversation. You want to focus on turning your feet and legs towards that person and allow your body to follow. This is good to do either sitting or standing. However, if you are sitting, you might also want to lean in slightly as it will show that you are listening and engaged in the conversation.
4. Look up - it's good to keep your head and eyes up when you're walking around the office or at events. This is because when you are looking up and ahead it is easier to make eye contact with others and greet them. It's important to note that people read your face to determine your approachability. Staring at the floor or your feet will cause the person to not be able to assess your interest.
5. Avoid fidgeting - having nervous habits can give the impression that you are anxious. You want to avoid fidgeting with things like your keys, pen, or hair or simply doing something you might not be aware of, such as cracking your knuckles or touching your face. You'll want to focus on keeping your hands at your sides or in your lap or just using them to gesture rather than fidgeting during conversations.

prompt: My debit card was involved in a data breach, and I lost $3,000. The bank says I'll get it back, but they don't know how long it'll take. What are some things I can do to better protect myself in the future?

messages.content: My debit card was involved in a data breach, and I lost $3,000. The bank says I'll get it back, but they don't know how long it'll take. What are some things I can do to better protect myself in the future?

I'm sorry to hear this! Suspicious charges can be frustrating. Here are some recommendations for how to best protect your funds:

1) Stick to large, reputable banks and institutions. Although there is some data that suggests large banks are more likely to be targets of cyberattacks, they are also more prepared to handle them. Small, hometown banks often have less rigorous security standards and a smaller amount of available cash flow, meaning that they cannot immediately refund your funds and must wait until the dispute has settled.

2) Complete all purchases on a credit card, rather than a debit card. Although this seems counter-intuitive, as credit cards incur interest, they are also much safer. When disputing a credit card charge, you do not have to pay the funds until the dispute is settled. It's much easier to stop a charge than it is to recover funds once they have departed your account. Furthermore, interest is only paid on credit card charges that carry over to the next month or interest period, and some might even offer perks like cash back on purchases or point accrual towards future discounts or interest rates.

3) Use a verified transaction company, such as Paypal, when completing online purchases. Paypal has buyer protection and can handle disputes efficiently. Smaller sites with their own payment processors might not be as safe and verified as they assert themselves to be, nor will they be as conveniently reachable in the event of a dispute. 

4) Refrain from linking your bank account, debit card, or credit card to any services. Saving your information in their system creates a database that can be breached at any point in the future if your password is discovered or the company suffers a cyberattack. Typing your information each time makes this less likely, although not impossible. 

5) Change your passwords frequently and don't save them on websites or in your browser. Using strong passwords and changing them frequently significantly reduces the likelihood they will be involved in a company's data breach. You may not be immediately notified of a compromised password, so don't reuse them.

6) Diversify your accounts. As the saying goes, "don't keep all of your eggs in one basket." Your checking account should be used for flowing cash, while your savings account should hold any lump sums that you may need access to in emergencies. Beyond your emergency fund, you can store cash in certificates of deposits (CDs) or investments that earn interest.

7) Stay aware of your account and purchases. Turn on purchase alerts if your bank offers them. Balance your checkbook and review your account frequently to notice any strange charges. The earlier these charges are caught, the easier they are resolved.

I hope these suggestions help better protect your funds in the future!

prompt: If I wanted to go to Paris, what are some of the popular tourist spots I should plan to visit?

messages.content: If I wanted to go to Paris, what are some of the popular tourist spots I should plan to visit?

There are many different popular tourist spots in Paris. Here are a few suggestions: 

- Eiffel Tower: The Eiffel Tower is the number one thing to do and the most photographed attraction for most tourists visiting Paris. You can ride the elevator to the top and get an incredible view of the city as well as have a meal at one of the two fine restaurants that are found within the tower. 

- Louvre: The Louvre is the most visited museum when visiting Paris. Here you can view more than one million objects including Leonardo da Vinci's "Mona Lisa," Michelangelo’s “Dying Slave,” and the Greek statue, “Venus of Milo.”

- Notre Dame de Paris: The Notre Dame cathedral stands more than 400 feet high and has two lofty towers with a spire and is considered a supreme example of French Gothic architecture. 

- Palace of Versailles: The Palace of Versailles started as a royal hunting lodge but became a palace for the king's court. It ceased being a royal residence during the French Revolution and today is a museum of French history.

prompt: Hi, please give me five reasons why I should be an art major. I need to show my parents because they don't believe me. Don't make them too long, just a few sentences each. Also, don't address it directly to my parents, it's not a letter.

messages.content: Hi, please give me five reasons why I should be an art major. I need to show my parents because they don't believe me. Don't make them too long, just a few sentences each. Also, don't address it directly to my parents, it's not a letter.

Sure thing! You can give your parents these five reasons:

1. We consume art every day. TV, music, movies, photography--art isn't just a picture hanging in a gallery, although that's valuable, too. Becoming an artist means contributing your creativity to the world.
2. No one has the same ideas that you do. Two people can paint the same still life, and their paintings will still be unique because they interpreted the source differently. It's important to share YOUR vision because nobody else can.
3. While it's true that not every artist signs a million-dollar contract in a month, not every artist works for pennies, either. Plenty of artists make a liveable income or at least supplement their paychecks.
4. The Internet has made it easier than ever for artists to find work. You can jump on Twitter, Instagram, or TikTok and potentially earn thousands of followers. Artists also join Patreon, which allows their fans to fund their work in exchange for requests, sketches, and exclusive pieces.
5. If you don't act now, you might spend the rest of your life wondering why you didn't take the risk. It's better to try and potentially not succeed than never try at all.

prompt: I have piles of old t-shirts just sitting there and I don’t want to give them away because they’re good. Can you tell me some creative ways to repurpose old t-shirts? I only want to use scissors to do it all and no sewing, please. Plus none of the ideas should suggest any special cutting tools or machines because I don’t know how to use any.

messages.content: I have piles of old t-shirts just sitting there and I don’t want to give them away because they’re good. Can you tell me some creative ways to repurpose old t-shirts? I only want to use scissors to do it all and no sewing, please. Plus none of the ideas should suggest any special cutting tools or machines because I don’t know how to use any.

Sure! Here are some amazing t-shirt transformation ideas to repurpose your old tees without sewing:

1. Pillow Talk: Turn your old t-shirts into comfy throw pillows with no sewing required! Simply cut the front and back panels of your shirts to the same size, stack them on top of each other, and tie each corner into a knot. Fluff it and enjoy your new DIY décor!

2. Scarf it Up: Stay cozy and stylish with a t-shirt scarf. Cut your shirt into strips (width depends on your preference), pull each strip to stretch it out, and tie the strips together end-to-end. Wrap and twist to your heart's content!

3. Tote-ally Awesome: Ditch the plastic and make a reusable shopping bag from your old tank tops. Cut off the sleeves and neckline, leaving the back intact. Put the bottom of the shirt in a knot and flip it inside out. Tote around your groceries (or anything else) in an eco-friendly style!

4. T-Shirt Blanket: Transform your old tees into a cozy and stylish blanket that's perfect for snuggling up on the couch. Cut the shirts into squares of equal size and lay them out in a pattern of your choosing. Keep the squares together at the corners using simple knots. Before you know it, you'll have a personalized quilt that's as warm as it is sentimental.

5. T-Shirt Headband: Give your hair accessories a unique twist by crafting a headband out of an old shirt. Cut a strip of fabric from the shirt (the thicker you want the headband to be, the wider your strip should be), and stretch it out until it curls on the edges. Keep the ends sticking up like bunny ears.

6. T-Shirt Ice/Heat Pack: Next time you're nursing an injury or feeling sore after a workout, skip the drugstore purchases and grab an old t-shirt instead. Cut out a square or rectangle from the shirt, fill it with ice cubes or heat in the microwave, then knot the edges together to create a makeshift cold or hot pack.

prompt: What are five ways that I can “pretty up” my home on a budget? Small home design details make me feel happy and comfortable.

messages.content: What are five ways that I can “pretty up” my home on a budget? Small home design details make me feel happy and comfortable.

Do any of these ideas look like they'll help?

•	Paint or wallpaper an accent wall in your bedroom or living room! 
One color for every wall in your bedroom or living room can feel monotonous. It’s boring for the eyes. Give you and your guests something to break up the space with an accent wall. This is a colorful wall that uses either paint or wallpaper, creating a focal point where you can show off more of your interior design personality. 
•	Bring nature indoors with a fresh vase of flowers, windowsill succulents, and a kitchen herb garden. 
Grocery stores have sales on seasonal flowers every week, so change out a vase of fresh flowers to bring nature indoors. You could also line your living room or bedroom windowsills with succulent plants, which require little upkeep to maintain vivid greenness and full beauty. Another great idea would be to grow your herbs in the kitchen. Use small pots in a line across your windowsill and plant fresh seasonings, like oregano, rosemary, and cilantro. 
•	Change your curtains!
For bedrooms, most people prefer blackout curtains. However, that still leaves your living room curtains, and perhaps the curtains in your home office. Change it up! Find a floral pattern that you love or choose light curtains and allow the sunshine to stream through in the mornings. 
•	Create a flowerbed or small garden and line your front path with solar lights. 
Solar lights are eco-friendly ways to illuminate the way to your front door while also providing a nice evening aesthetic to your home’s exterior. As for a small garden or flowerbed, a new hobby could be fun, and you’d beautify your yard with pretty seasonal blooms. Plus, if you go the small garden route, there’s nothing quite like harvesting and eating veggies that you've grown! 
•	Line your bedroom ceilings with fairy lights. 
Fairy lights are a colorful, twinkly way to add a touch of magic and whimsy to your bedroom. If you invest in ones with a remote, you can change colors to suit your moods while lying in bed to unwind after a long day.

prompt: I've been balancing a day job and freelance writing for a while, and I want to know how to make the transition to freelancing full-time. How do I do so? Can you make me a list that goes through some helpful steps in this process?

messages.content: I've been balancing a day job and freelance writing for a while, and I want to know how to make the transition to freelancing full-time. How do I do so? Can you make me a list that goes through some helpful steps in this process?

Good luck with your transition into freelancing! Here's some things you can do to give yourself the best chance of success

1. Figure out finances - Find out how much you typically spend each month including bills and figure out how much money you need to bring in every month to make ends meet. 
2. Get a regular client - You should find a client with regular work while you're still working your day job. This client acts as a sort of retainer because you know that you can be assured to have regular work while you're with them. When you have a regular client, you can make the rest of your income from other clients.
3. Network - Get networking as soon as possible. Doing so will offer a community of support, and you may find some connections that will hire you or connect you with others who may hire you.
4. Be present online - You should have a website and be active on social media. This is something else that you can do while you're at your other job.
5. Make an elevator pitch - Ask yourself exactly what you want to bring to the table, and make this clear on your website site. If you provide more than one service, you should have a main service and work every other one around that main one. People will more likely hire you if they know what you can do for them.
6. Take on as much work as possible - You'll know when you reach the point that it's time to move to freelance. When you want to move forward, you should do everything you can to work on your freelancing. 
7. Don't wait to be ready - The truth is, you'll likely not ever feel quite ready. But don't jump into freelancing too fast. Make sure your foundation is set, and then you can shift to freelancing as your career.
