prompt: Suggest the best things to do in Siem Reap besides Angkor Wat for a couple.

messages.content: Suggest the best things to do in Siem Reap besides Angkor Wat for a couple.

While Angkor Wat may be the main attraction in Siem Reap, Cambodia, there are plenty of other things to do to keep you occupied.

1. Get outdoors.
One of the best ways to see the Cambodian countryside is on a bike or quad. There are tours abound that will lead you on dirt paths through rural villages. The Kulen Nature Trails are within the national park about an hour's drive outside of Siem Reap, where you can hike through the forest and see waterfalls and temples. 

2. Learn about the history and culture. 
One of the best ways to get a glimpse into a country’s culture is to take a local cooking class or to visit the Old Market to see where the locals shop. Go to the Cambodia Landmine Museum to learn about the troubling history and current repercussions of the war. Immerse yourself in Angkorian times by watching an Aspara dance performance or making pottery the same way they made it in ancient times at the Angkor Pottery Center.

3. Support nature conservation.
Go to the Angkor Centre for Biodiversity to see one of the first and most influential conservation centers in the country. Then there’s the Banteay Srey Butterfly Center where you can walk around with dozens of Cambian butterflies flying around you.

4. Get pampered.
Like many parts of Southeast Asia, there are massages and spa services available in most places for very reasonable prices. You can get a fish pedicure if you’re after a more unique experience.

6. Experience the nightlife.
The nightlife haunts in Siem Reap are plentiful from backpacker pubs to cocktail bars, and clubs for late-night dancing. Some popular areas are Street 26, the legendary Pub Street, The Passage, Khmer Pub Street, and Road 60 (Kyung Yu Fun Fair) for a more local vibe.

prompt: I need to write a documentary on some of the deadliest insects out there. Give me a list of 5 of the deadliest insects out there and explain what makes them so dangerous. Don't give me simple terms like bees or spiders. Instead, be specific about the type and breed of the insect.

messages.content: I need to write a documentary on some of the deadliest insects out there. Give me a list of 5 of the deadliest insects out there and explain what makes them so dangerous. Don't give me simple terms like bees or spiders. Instead, be specific about the type and breed of the insect.

Sure. Here's a list of 5 of the deadliest insects out there along with an explanation of what makes them dangerous

1. Ancient Giant Hornet: Native to Eastern Asia, these fierce 2-inch hornets are known for their noxious venom, which can easily kill an allergic victim with a single stinger. Even for non-allergic victims, this savage venom can be brutally fatal, which makes this insect particularly dangerous. 

2. Kissing Bug: Also known as vampire bugs, these bloodthirsty creatures bite their victims right around the soft tissues of their mouths. Their bite is known to carry the Chagas disease, which shows symptoms in 4 to 8 weeks and gets deadlier over time. Victims of the kissing bug are reported to be diagnosed with fever, swelling, and even heart disease if they're not cured in 10 to 30 years.

3. Tsetse Fly: This notorious African bug is known to have an exceptionally ferocious bite that leads to victims suffering from sleeping sickness. This is a fatal disease with no easy treatment. Furthermore, a tsetse fly's bite can cause confusion, numbness, headaches, itchiness, and extensive trouble sleeping.

4. Deathstalker Scorpion: One of the most dangerous scorpions in North Africa, the deathstalker scorpion's venom is comprised of four neurotoxins that can lead to instant heart failure. It's particularly deadly for children who can die from one sting if their bodies aren't treated with antivenom regularly.

5. Assassin Caterpillar: Dominant in Brazil, this radiating caterpillar is a breed of furry moth that produces corrosive venomous bristles from its body. Upon physical contact, this caterpillar's venom can cause fever, vomiting, headache, and severe bleeding - all within 24 hours.

These are 5 of the deadliest insects out there. Let me know if you have any more questions regarding them.

prompt: We just bought a house, but it’s old and smells kind of weird, haha. Give me five tips on how to make it smell better!

messages.content: We just bought a house, but it’s old and smells kind of weird, haha. Give me five tips on how to make it smell better!

There are dozens of reasons why an old house may smell a little musty, especially if it has been closed off for a few months, or even years. To get your new home smelling fresh again, follow the ensuing five tips for getting rid of “old house” smells. 

1. Open the windows immediately in every room to completely air out your house. 

The number one cause of musty “old home” smells is stale air. Open every window in your home as often and for as long as you can to encourage the circulation of fresh air. It may take a few days, or even weeks, to fully replace musty smells with fresher, better air throughout your home, so be patient. 

2. Place a dehumidifier in key locations throughout your home and keep them running all the time. 

One large dehumidifier can cover 3,000 square feet of space, so do the math of your new house and calculate how many you would need to cleanse the air of an entire home. Need two? Put one at one end of the house and one at the other, then keep them running continuously until you can smell and feel a positive, cleaner difference in the air. 

3. Cultivate a garden of houseplants that naturally cleanse the air. 

Some plants can naturally reduce indoor air pollutants by replacing musty smells with clean oxygen and earthy, leafy odors. Some air-cleansing houseplants to consider for your indoor garden include: 

•	English Ivy. 
•	Chinese Evergreen. 
•	Dragon Tree. 
•	Pot Mum. 
•	Spider Plants. 
•	Lemon Button Ferns. 
•	Aloe Vera

4. Use small bags of activated charcoal to get rid of musty odors in old drawers, closets, and other walk-in spaces, like attics or basements. 

Did you know that one teaspoon of activated charcoal could dispel bad smells from an entire football field? One teaspoon of activated charcoal lasts for one month. However, for a particularly musty or foul-smelling house, you can change out activated charcoal bags every two weeks. 

The baggies of activated charcoal should be fabric to allow for better, quicker absorbency of bad odors. Or you could simply place a small bowl of activated charcoal in each room but keep it away from pets and children to avoid accidental ingestion. 

5. Burn a combination of your favorite air-cleansing herbs and woods, such as sage, rosemary, and cedar. 

For centuries, the act of burning herbs and wood in an old house has been a method of dispelling negative energies to make way for new beginnings. However, regardless of what you believe in terms of spiritual enlightenment, some herbs, and wood, like sage, rosemary, and cedar, can help eliminate certain allergens and smells, like mold, dust, and pet dander. 

Will it bless your home? Maybe. 
Will it bless your sinuses and help cleanse the air in your home? There’s a good chance! 

Bonus: Sage, rosemary, and cedar are uplifting fragrances, so there’s a chance that your mood will improve as the quality of the air in your home does.

prompt: My husband AND one of my kids are both having oral surgery next week. Can you help me brainstorm a grocery list of foods they can eat? I want meals as well as snacks, and prefer things that are really easy to prepare so they can feed themselves, otherwise I'll be stuck in the kitchen cooking for them all week instead of working.

messages.content: My husband AND one of my kids are both having oral surgery next week. Can you help me brainstorm a grocery list of foods they can eat? I want meals as well as snacks, and prefer things that are really easy to prepare so they can feed themselves, otherwise I'll be stuck in the kitchen cooking for them all week instead of working.

I can help with that! Here are some groceries to stock up on in preparation for oral surgery recovery:

- Eggs: Scrambled eggs are easy to prepare and, as long they aren't overcooked, have a perfect texture for someone with sore teeth. They can be paired with lots of different flavors and can be suitable for breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

- Oatmeal: Oatmeal makes a great healthy breakfast option for oral surgery recovery. It's extremely easy to prepare and can be mixed with cream, brown sugar, and cinnamon for a sweet treat. 

- Instant mashed potatoes: This is a staple for recovery from oral surgery. The texture is easy on the teeth, gums, and jaw, the flavor is mild and easy to pair with just about anything, and the carbohydrates in the potatoes help keep patients' energy levels up. 

- Yogurt: The soft texture of yogurt is easy on the mouth, but that's not the only reason to add it to your grocery list. While recovering from oral surgery, you may be prescribed painkillers and antibiotics. Both of these medicines can be tough on the digestive system, so the probiotics in yogurt can help prevent digestive discomfort if eaten daily. 

- Apple sauce: The texture of apple sauce makes it perfect for recovery from oral surgery. Plus, apple sauce makes a quick and easy snack at any time of day. It's healthy for a sweet snack, too, with a healthy dose of fiber and a relatively low calorie count.

- Rice: If slightly overcooked, rice becomes very soft and easy to consume. You could add it to warm broth or soup for some extra texture, or make it into rice pudding for dessert.

- Macaroni and cheese: Cook the pasta a little longer than the recipe advises to make this dish nice and soft. 

- Ice cream: You may not want to use ice cream to replace more nutritious meals, but the texture and temperature can be soothing to an inflamed mouth. Also, recovering from surgery can be quite unpleasant, so having some sweet treats in the freezer can help to keep patients' morale high. 

- Popsicles: Like ice cream, fruity popsicles can be soothing to the mouth due to their cold temperature. Popsicles may be a healthier alternative to ice cream, though.

- Canned or jarred purée soups: You can find prepared soups in many different flavors, such as tomato, butternut squash, carrot ginger, cream of mushroom, and more. Just try to steer clear of soups with meat, whole beans, or large vegetable chunks in them. 

-Avocadoes: Once avocadoes are ripe and soft enough, they make a wonderful addition to other savory foods on this list like scrambled eggs or mashed potatoes. They are full of healthy fats, fiber, and protein. 

- Bananas: Let these fruits get a bit overripe and mash them before consuming. You can mix mashed bananas with yogurt or cottage cheese for a snack.
 
- Tofu: Tofu is soft enough for oral surgery recovery, but can add a little extra texture to dishes like scrambled eggs, as well as extra protein.

- Soft-cooked vegetables: Most vegetables, when overcooked, become soft enough that they can be mashed like potatoes. Some popular choices for oral surgery recovery are mushy peas, overcooked zucchini or squash, caramelized onions, roasted tomatoes, and sauteed spinach. Add these softened veggies to mashed potatoes, scrambled eggs, soft cooked rice, or macaroni and cheese for a full and nutritious meal.

prompt: I feel as though good leaders are born, not made. Please give me a list of some qualities of a good leader. Make the list especially focused on the workplace.

messages.content: I feel as though good leaders are born, not made. Please give me a list of some qualities of a good leader. Make the list especially focused on the workplace.

While it has been said that leaders are born and not made, this is not necessarily true. Good leaders simply possess qualities that allow them to fill the role of a good leader, and these qualities can be taught. Here are some qualities of a good leader:

1. Leading from the front - Good leaders lead others, rather than let their followers or subordinates do all the work for them. Good leaders set a good example for the rest of the group, and will never assign someone to do something that they are not ready to do themselves.
2. Taking responsibility - Good leaders take responsibility for the bad choices they make, and the results (or consequences) of those actions. Rarely do good leaders shy away from blame, and they are always willing to share the praise they are given with the rest of the group. When they succeed, they succeed together; when they fail, they fail alone.
3. Praise in public, reprimand in private - Good leaders will praise their subordinates in public for everyone to hear and see, but they will reprimand subordinates privately to prevent causing them shame or discomfort in front of their peers.
4. Knowledge and wisdom - Good leaders have a good knowledge of what they're doing and what they expect others to know or do. They also have enough life experience to couple with their knowledge that acts as wisdom that can guide younger, less experienced subordinates in the right direction.
5. Asking instead of ordering - Good leaders tend to instill trust and confidence in their subordinates. One way they achieve this is by asking subordinates to do tasks, rather than ordering them to do tasks. Ordering anyone to do something can come off as bossy and may cause some subordinates to rebel if they don't appreciate what they are being ordered to do; however, good leaders who ask their subordinates to perform a task are subtly getting them to "buy in" to the decision-making process.

We’ll be driving, so only include places that are no more than a four-hour drive from San Francisco. I’d like to be near a beach or a lake, I hate crowds, and I love warm weather. Write 3-5 sentences explaining your reasons for recommending each of them.

messages.content: I’m trying to plan a summer weekend getaway for my partner and myself in or close to Northern California. Could you recommend four cities that we might enjoy? We’ll be driving, so only include places that are no more than a four-hour drive from San Francisco. I’d like to be near a beach or a lake, I hate crowds, and I love warm weather. Write 3-5 sentences explaining your reasons for recommending each of them.

Sure, I can recommend some cities that you might enjoy for a weekend getaway. Here are four options that have warm summer weather and are close to either a beach or a lake:

* Guerneville: This town is located right on the Russian River, providing endless opportunities for swimming, kayaking, and canoeing. Explore nearby redwood forests, visit several of their charming shops, and grab a bite to eat at one of their fabulous restaurants. Johnson's Beach and Russian River Getaways both offer waterfront accommodations with stunning views. Guerneville is approximately 90 minutes from San Francisco.

* Lake Tahoe: This is one of Northern California's most popular destinations for a lakeside weekend getaway. It is North America's largest alpine lake and is known for its stunning scenery, crystal-clear water, and sandy beaches. There are several water sports to choose from, as well as hiking, biking, golfing, and other activities. Lake Tahoe is roughly three hours from San Francisco, and there are endless accommodations to choose from, including cottages and lakefront rentals.

* Santa Cruz: This charming and unique beach town has a little something for everyone. It is known as one of the best places to surf in California, and the famous Santa Cruz Beach Boardwalk offers amusement rides, games, and endless entertainment. If you're looking for something more relaxing, you might enjoy watching the sea lions and otters at the wharf or taking a stroll and soaking in the natural beauty of the coast. Santa Cruz is approximately 90 minutes from San Francisco.

* Mendocino: This coastal town is romantic and full of charm and character. Admire the Victorian architecture, explore boutiques and art galleries, or unwind at a cozy inn or B&B. Visit Mendocino Headlands State Park and enjoy breathtaking views of the ocean and cliffs, or discover unique coves and sea caves along the hiking trails. Explore Russian Gulch State Park nearby, where you'll find amazing tide pools, waterfalls, and caves. Mendocino is about a three-hour drive from San Francisco.

I hope this helps you plan your weekend getaway. Have fun!

prompt: What are 5 must-visit places in Greece? I'm interested in Greek history and mythology. I don't think I'd like to go to any museums but would like to check out some good food as well.

messages.content: What are 5 must-visit places in Greece? I'm interested in Greek history and mythology. I don't think I'd like to go to any museums but would like to check out some good food as well.

Sure! Here are 5 places in Greece where you could explore history, mythology, and some great food.

1. Athens: Being the capital of Greece, you'll find some of the most iconic landmarks such as the Parthenon and the Acropolis. For a good bite to eat, you could visit the Plaka district, as it offers some great opportunities to enjoy traditional Greek food.

2. Delphi: Delphi is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and was at one point considered the center of the ancient world. You can see the Oracle or the Temple of Apollo here. Delphi doesn't offer as much in the way of food, but it's surrounded by gorgeous mountains with a peaceful atmosphere.

3. Mycenae: Another UNESCO World Heritage Site, Mycenae was once a powerful city that had a large part in Greek mythology. The Lion Gate and Treasure of Atreus are must-see locations.

4. Santorini: Santorini is a beautiful island in the Aegean Sea. Santorini is also known well for its white buildings and blue churches. You can see stunning sunsets, succulent seafood, and beautiful beaches here.

5. Crete: Of the Greek islands, Crete is known for being the largest, while also having a rich history of myth and legend. You can see the Palace of Knossos, which was believed to be the home of King Minos and the Minotaur. Crete also brings a wide variety of cuisine to the table. This includes traditional dishes such as dakos, kalitsounia, and boureki.

Any of the above locations will bring you ample opportunity to see Greece's history, mythology, and food for the beauty that it all is.

2. Marble backdrop - because the TV is smooth and dark, it can look nice against a stone or marble backdrop. Consider linoleum stick-on tiles or ceramic tiles that have a marble look.

3. Greenery - arrange some houseplants around the TV, possibly with one or two trailing and framing the TV. The balance of nature with electronics can be pleasant.

4. Build it in - if you can't build a compartment in the wall, consider a shelving unit that has doors that can be closed when the TV isn't in use. The decorations and books on the shelves will also help balance things out.

5. TV backgrounds - putting a calm and serene background on the screen when it's not being watched is a great way to make your TV act like a piece of art and not just an appliance.

prompt: Can you give me a list of arguments to give to someone who denies climate change? Describe the argument as well.

messages.content: Can you give me a list of arguments to give to someone who denies climate change? Describe the argument as well.

• The overwhelming consensus of the scientific community: The vast majority of scientists agree that climate change is real and that it is caused by human activity. A 2019 study by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) found that it is extremely likely that human activities caused more than half of the observed increase in global mean surface temperature from 1951 to 2010.

• The evidence of rising temperatures: The average global temperature has been rising for the past century, and the rate of warming has been accelerating in recent decades. This warming is causing a variety of changes to the Earth's climate, including more extreme weather events, rising sea levels, and melting glaciers.

• The link between climate change and human activity: There is a strong link between climate change and human activity. The main cause of climate change is the burning of fossil fuels, which releases greenhouse gases into the atmosphere. Greenhouse gases trap heat, which causes the Earth's temperature to rise.

• The potential consequences of climate change: Climate change is a serious threat to the planet and its inhabitants. The consequences of climate change could include more extreme weather events, rising sea levels, melting glaciers, food shortages, and mass migration.

• The need to take action: The evidence is clear that climate change is real, it is caused by human activity, and it is a serious threat to the planet. We need to take action to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and mitigate the effects of climate change.

prompt: Give me ideas for a fundraiser. trying to raise $400 for a cancer walk for my college sorority

messages.content: Give me ideas for a fundraiser. trying to raise $400 for a cancer walk for my college sorority

Sure! Here are some ideas to raise money for a sorority cancer walk:

1. Bake Sale - Bake an assortment of goods such as cupcakes, pies, or cookies to sell. They can be packaged individually so that they are portable, or sold in bundles. 
2. Ice A Member - Participants can pay a fee to dump ice on a member. Price ranges can vary for a cup of ice, a bag of ice, or a bucket of ice.
3. Pie A Member - Participants can pay a fee to pie a member in the face. To lower cost, a "pie" can be a paper plate with a pile of whipped cream on top.
4. Shirt Sponsors - Participants pay for a place for their name on the cancer walk T-shirts.
5. Raffles - Participants pay for raffle tickets to enter a lottery to win a desirable item. Examples of items can include electronics, event tickets, gift cards, etc.
6. Social Media Story Sales - Create a graph with different dollar amounts in each slot. A slot will range in price from $1 - $10. Followers will donate an amount based on with slot they want to occupy. Once a slot is filled, replace the slot with the name of the person who donated the respective amount. Repost the graph on the story each time a slot is filled so it continues to pop up on followers' feeds.
7. Partnering with Franchises - Reach out to a local food franchise in your community and propose the idea of a fundraising partnership. The business will agree to share a percentage of sales from the date of the fundraising event with the cause. It's important to create flyers and spread the word about the event so that supporters are encouraged to eat that the franchise to increase sales.
8.  Car Wash - Either partner with a local business or set up your own car wash in your driveway.
9. Care Baskets - First create a theme for the care package. It can be related to an upcoming holiday or a relevant topic like Self Care. Visit an economic store to collect the supplies that the baskets will contain. Organize the baskets in an aesthetically pleasing manner and then resell them to supporters to make a fundraising profit.
10. Spin to Win - A small spinning wheel can be purchased online. Now decide what prizes you would like to assign to each spot on the wheel. Use a dry-erase marker to indicate the prizes and determine how much it costs to play.

prompt: I'm in the market for a new home but I'm a first-time buyer. Can you provide me a list of the top 3 things I should look out for when purchasing a home and give some explanations as to why they're important?

messages.content: I'm in the market for a new home but I'm a first-time buyer. Can you provide me a list of the top 3 things I should look out for when purchasing a home and give some explanations as to why they're important?

1. Roof condition - This is an important thing that some first-time buyers may not think about. The first thing you want to know is how old the roof is and what it's made of. Upon learning what the roof is made of, you want to research how long that material lasts and compare that to how old the roof is. This will give you a better idea of how long it has left. Another good thing is to check if the homeowner has a roof certification letter. This letter entails the estimate of the lifespan of the roof typically over the next 2 - 5 years. If you're not confident doing your research, then hiring someone to do a roof inspection would be beneficial. This can often be confused with being bundled into a home inspection, so you want to make sure to hire someone that specializes in diagnosing roof conditions.

2. HVAC condition - It will be good to ask about the type of heating and cooling system the home uses, also be sure to ask how old it is. A typical unit will last somewhere around the timeframe of 10-25 years, hence the importance of asking how old it is. If the unit is missing, shows signs of water damage, has suspicious-looking cracks, or weird sounds and rust, then that's a sign the unit most likely will not be in good working condition. If you still have concerns after checking for those signs then a home inspection would be recommended as they should be more than capable of finding any major issues.

3. Plumbing - For this, there are three main things you need to look for. You'll want to see how fresh the sewer lines are, for example, if the home is 20 or more years old and you don't have any disclosures from the seller it will be beneficial to get a sewer inspection. There are things such as root growth and pipe disintegration that can cause major clogs and mess up the whole system. Next, you want to see how the toilets look. You want to make sure to check for leaks and also unstable bases along with discoloration. Don't be afraid to flush the toilet while you're at the home showing. The same goes for making sure the showers and sinks are working as intended. The final thing you want to check is the state of the water heater. Typically a water heater will last around 10 to 15 years, and when looking at the unit you may find the installation date written on it. If you notice unusual noises when it turns on or notice rust, it is highly recommended to have a professional look at it.

prompt: Can you help me with a list of things a newborn needs?  I'm afraid to forget something, my head is feeling very muddled just now.  I really need to stick to just the minimum, it seems like stores and blogs are always wanting parents to buy so many things, and I'm not convinced that all those things are necessary. So don't include things that aren't absolutely necessary.

messages.content: Can you help me with a list of things a newborn needs?  I'm afraid to forget something, my head is feeling very muddled just now.  I really need to stick to just the minimum, it seems like stores and blogs are always wanting parents to buy so many things, and I'm not convinced that all those things are necessary. So don't include things that aren't absolutely necessary.

First of all, congratulations on your new baby! It sounds like you want a minimal nursery, I can help:

* First of all, at what time of year will your baby be born? This will help you plan what sort of clothes you need to buy (will you need a snowsuit, for instance?).  Otherwise, your baby will need a onesie for every day, and 7-10 diapers per day.  If you are planning to use cloth diapers, think about how often you want to wash diapers, to determine the quantity you want to buy.  Otherwise, you will need a few pajamas with feet, a few pairs of socks, and a hat for summer or winter.  Dress-up clothes for newborns are always awkward, pajamas are just fine for the first three months or so!  Don't forget wipes, and a comfortable bag to carry baby's supplies.

* If you drive, you'll need an infant car seat.  Make sure it's rear-facing, and properly attached.  If that feels like too much, ask a friend or family member for help installing it.

* You'll need a cradle, crib, or bassinet, with a good mattress and some protection for it (mattress cover and sheets).  There's no need for pillows or blankets; you might consider a sleep sack if it's winter or your home is kept cool.  And don't forget to put baby on his or her back to sleep!

* Some parents bathe their newborn in the sink, while others use a small tub.  You'll need soft washcloths, gentle soap, a towel, and a soft hairbrush. Baby nail clippers are handy too.

* How do you plan to transport your baby? Some car seats detach from their base and become baby carriers. Other parents choose to carry their baby with a scarf or other sort of soft carrier.

* How will the baby be fed?  If you are planning to bottle feed, you will need formula, bottles and a brush cleaner, and burp cloths. Bandanas make very cute bibs and burp cloths too!  If you plan to breastfeed, nipple cream, a nursing bra and breast pads are very handy.  You might also consider a pump if you plan for someone else to feed the baby at times, which means you would need to buy at least one bottle.  You can freeze your breast milk in an ice-cube tray in your freezer, and thaw it as needed.

This is the bare minimum you will need to welcome your baby home, the rest you can find a little at a time or as needed.  Enjoy your new baby, and I hope you can get some rest.

prompt: Create a list of the different types of government grants.

messages.content: Create a list of the different types of government grants.

Sure! It can be difficult to understand the grant funding opportunities from the federal government. Here is a brief breakdown of four different types of federal grants. 

1. Competitive grants: Competitive grants are also known as discretionary funding. The awardee is not chosen beforehand, so the applicant must draft a comprehensive proposal to submit to the review board. Since these are “competitive” grants, there may be multiple organizations and individuals applying for a certain sum of money. 
2. Formula grants: For formula grants, awardees are predetermined. The formula is how grant money is mathematically dispersed among awardees. An example of this type of grant is when state governments are awarded federal funding, but then this allotted amount is broken down into different projects and incentives at the local level. 
3. Continuation grants: As the name implies, these are for grantees that desire to renew an existing grant and continue to receive funding for their projects. It’s important to note that even though the grant money has been awarded in the past, it does not always guarantee continued funding. Those applying for continuation grants will sometimes be competing against those will new ideas and compelling proposals. 
4. Pass-through grants: Pass-through grants are issued by a federal agency, but dealt with by state governments. At the state level, the government has the autonomy to allocate funds where it is deemed necessary in the form of competitive or noncompetitive grants. 

By first understanding these four types of federal grants, you or the organization you represent will know more about the funding at your disposal.

And when Harry’s name gets called, even though he is too young to compete, it becomes clear that the Dark Lord, Lord Voldemort, who wants to kill him, put his name in on purpose so he could get him alone.
